reviews.review:
Wonderful wine tasting. We spent two wonderful hours in Diego's company drinking excellent wines, learning about them and appreciating a harmonic food. At the end of tasting time, we got a surprise: a late harvest wine that was not planned. ;P
I think this was one of the best things we did in BA. Strong recommended!!!!

Wonderful time!. We book a wine tasting here and it was the best afternoon. We had Bertie lead us in this wonderful experience. His passion was incredible and made us excited. He took his time explaining every wine and tapas we were giving. Our group was only 4 so it seemed really personal almost family style, just sitting and talking as we learned about the different wines. I think we spent almost 2 hours if not more but it was well worth it. I would do this again.

Fun way to learn about Argentina's wines. There is so much to know about Argentina's wines and we learned a lot through our tasting at Anuva Wines while having great fun! Diego was skilled at leading us through the experience with humor and intelligence, sharing his great depth of knowledge. The tapas pairings were delectable. It was nice to be in a small group where conversation can easily happen - we very much enjoyed meeting other travelers from Brazil and hearing about their experiences. A pleasant and enriching experience all the way around!

Anuva Wines. If you are staying in Buenos Aires and would like an initial appreciation of Argentinian wines, Anuva Wines is the place to go. We booked on the website and had a prompt reply with details of where/when to go. The location does not have signage outside and you have to ring an intercom buzzer to be allowed in. Diego provided background information and ample tastings of five wines, ranging from sparkling white to red wines, all from boutique wineries in the west of Argentina. The wines were accompanied with five small tapas, which complemented the wines perfectly.It was a great experience, lasting just over 2 hours. Highly recommended as a pre-dinner scene setter!

Great Tasting, Great Fun. Diego was very knowledgeable, the setting is beautiful and the wine is amazing. I highly recommend this tasting! You get a taste of all the wines of Argentina - the infamous Malbecs, other reds and even (gasp!) some white!!! A highlight of the trip, don't miss out.

Fun way to spend an afternoon . Diego was our sommelier, really pleasant and fun and educational experience. It's nice to try wines from boutique Argentinian wineries and support "the little guy". The tapas tastings went well with the wines.These are not super high end wines, but very affordable, drinkable wines that are good for every day. They shipped our 3 cases back to California and the wines arrived at our house before we did! In a week! Our next trip will be to Mendoza to visit some of these wineries.

Great service and reception of people. I truly enjoyed meeting with Anuva Wines. The way they treat me when I showed up at the door was just fabulous. I was made to feel as celebrity or royalty. Great thanks for offering me a tasting of your wines and telling me your story.

Great wine tasting in Buenos Aires. Great wine, good food, beautiful setting, knowledgeable host, generous pours... what more do you need in a wine tasting session?! Located in a trendy neighborhood of Palermo Soho area of Buenos Aires. They have options to ship the wine back to your home- free if you order a case. They serve wines from vineyards that you can't find in the states. Definitely has be wanting to take a trip back to Buenos Aires just to go to Mendoza or Salta. They give you a tapas sized plate of food for every wine you taste. 2nd pours are encouraged and our host gave us a taste of an extra wine. Diego was very knowledgeable not just of wines, but also of things to do in the city- especially where to eat!.

Perfect wine/food pairing. This is my second time doing a wine tasting with Anuva wines. Both times were excellent. This time we had Bertie as our tasting guide and he was excellent. Anuva has a very well designed area for the tasting as well as a nice balcony that you can drink on if the day permits. The food pairings with the wines were great. It wasn't to much food but enhanced the tasting. Being a beginner in wine tasting Bertie gave us lots of information that was easy to understand and remember. He really made the experience great and I couldn't ask for a better teacher. I left feeling like a pro. You also have the option to order wine and have it shipped back to the USA(which we did). All in all it was a great day, and it makes you feel like you have been to Mendoza without all the trouble of getting there. Highly recommended!!
Interesting and fun. Fun experience. Pairings were great and love that they ship! Time flew by. Diego was knowledgeable and even allowed us to try some others he hadn't prepared that we asked about.

A trip to Mendoza without the airfare to Mendoza!. My boss and I were in Buenos Aires for work this past week. I would have loved to take the 3 hour flight to Mendoza but unfortunately time didn't permit so I tried to find an alternative. And I found the perfect one! Anuva Wines allows you to taste extremely high quality wines that are the "best kept secrets" in the Mendoza region. The wine cellar is clean and gorgeous. The sommelier is extremely well educated and teaches you all about the wine region, types of wine and grapes and answers any questions you may have. Would highly recommend of any wine drinkers/lovers!!

A Must Do!. We had a wonderful time at Anuva Wines! It was a fun and relaxed atmosphere while still being very informative regarding Argentinian wines. Diego was fascinating to listen to and couldn't have been more personable. The tapas served were delicious too. Overall a great experience, something I would definitely recommend for anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Accommodated a vegan at the last minute. This was my first wine tasting experience. It'll be hard to top Anuva's group wine tasting. We didn't call ahead to ask if vegan food pairings were possible, but they were able to pull something together with ease. It felt very classy.

Wonderful and unique wine experience. We spend a very lovely afternoon at Anuva Wines and enjoyed incredible wines paired with excellent food that brought out so many different sides of every single wine. The groups were very small and there was enough room for questions and discussions about argentinian wines.A must for every wine lover who wants to get to know more unique wines of the country!

David and Kim Cadman . Really enjoyed the private wine tasting .Would of preferred more nibbles with the wine we were being served .Wines were lovely .The host for our wine tasting gave us good information.

One of my favorite tastings.. Bertie was my sommelier and it was a lot of fun. Why I liked it so much?1. The wines were boutique and different from different parts of Argentina.2. The parings were all execellent portion and great. 3. Bertie was well knowledgeable about the wines. 4. The tasting was very personal. 5. Lastly, the best part is that it's free refills. Can't beat that. :)

Love their winery. We visited last summer 2015 and thoroughly enjoyed the winery and the wealth of information we learned from the staff! We loved it so much we signed up for the auto shipments for one year. We have received our final shipment but still have some wine in reserve for special occasions. I will always remember Anuva and recommend them to anyone I know visiting BA!!!!

Fantastic evening tasting Mendoza. Awesome night trading five beautiful boutique wines from the Mendoza region. Alice knew her stuff and kept the evening flowing with great food and wine. Of course you can purchase the wines you tasted. They were really accomating and held the eine we purchased until we returned to Buenos Aires. Superb service.

Great alternative to a wine tour!. We thoroughly enjoyed the wine and tapas evening at Anuva wines. We booked it because we weren't able to visit the Mendoza or Salta wine regions - but wanted to learn about and taste some quality Argentinian wines. This was perfect for that!Alice was our lovely and knowledgable host. We tried 5 wines - one sparkling white, another white (which had a sneaky twist!) and three reds. All were delicious. We particulary appreciated that Anuva showcases wines from smaller producers. The tastings were generous, with top ups always offered. The food was very good without being spectacular - but paired very well with the wines. We really enjoyed chatting with the other guests, its a very social atmostphere. The only small negative was that they had some diners coming (I think they offer dinners now) so it felt a bit rushed towards the end and we had to be coaxed out, we were having such a good time we would have loved to stay longer! Also hoping that Anuva might be able to offer free shipping to Australia (as with the US) sometime in the future! Let me know if you do!

Great learning experience!. My boyfriend and I came for a wine tasting with Alice. The whole thing lasted about 2 hours and we happened to be the only ones booked for that time. Alice was very knowledgeable and happy to answer all our questions - we had a lot. I definitely walked away feeling like I knew something more about wine, especially wine in the Mendoza and Salta regions. I would say the food that it came with was pretty mediocre though. But the wines were really special and she was happy to top up!

Wonderful experience. My daughters and I booked this wine tasting based on feedback seen on TripAdvisor. Many positives - very knowledgeable host, five unique wine types, the food (the empanadas rocked), and conversation with table mates from (literally) around the world, etc. Only one negative - it is in the middle of nowhere and, once there, it is not easy to find as there is no signage. Look for the door number and call - a bit awkward, but, overall very worth it!

Awesome wine!. My wife and I were able to try five different wines from Argentina (champagne, chardonnay, malbec, cabernet, and syrah) and they were all amazing. Alice did a great job explaining each wine and was an excellent host. Also, the food they served was really tasty and paired well with each wine. I highly recommend this trip.

Chance to try some new wines. We don't drink a lot of wine from South America so we weren't familiar with some of the lesser known grapes. We tasted 5 wines with the class - Chin Chin Sparkling, Mairena Torrontes, San Gimignano Syrah Roble, Mairena Malbec and Carinae Hommage (Malbec). Each wine was paired with a small plate. The sommelier for the night also opened up a 6th wine that wasn't part of the lineup at end of class for a tasting. Wine pours were generous and I think everyone went away very happy.
Great Wine Tasting!. Great wine tasting experience!!! Loved all the wine and food. The ambiance was excellent. Definitely recommend this place!

A MUST for your trip to Buenos Aires. If you enjoy wine and food then you must do this! Alice and her team provided an intimate wine tasting group in a beautiful facility. The 5 wines were phenomenal and pairings were perfect. It was a nice way to relax and enjoy conversation with friends. I think locals would even enjoy this as a fun interactive experience. Highly recommend!
Excellent Experience. Anuva had a great atmosphere and knowledgeable employees. I would recommend this tasting to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires.

Wine, Small Plates, Good Company. Without having a sophisticated palate, I was apprehensive about taking on a wine tasting. I am happy to report that Anuva exceeded my expectations. Bertie was our host and sommelier, providing a passionate and informative description of each of the varietals chosen for us, and the characteristics of the regions in which they were crafted. He is clearly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about what he does. 2 whites and 3 reds made up our exploration. I will not go into detail about the names and traits, for I assume Anuva changes what they serve regularly. Suffice it to say they were each delightful in their own way, and I would happily drink each of them again. There are small plates that accompany each glass, selected for their ability to complement whichever wine you are sampling. There is a brief explanation of how the plate enhances the drink.Our tasting group that evening was made up of people from several different countries. The conversation was lively and fun, and Bertie was always there to facilitate discussion or answer questions (of which we had several). Should I find myself in BA again, I would be happy to return.

Great value, good fun and very informative. Knowledge of the staff were faultless. The event was run spectacularly and I enjoyed it heaps. Great value in that we all had as much as we wanted with some spare at the end of the night. Food was tasty and complimented the pairing. The upstairs tasting room was super cool and layed back. Definitely recommend for anyone wanting the 'Mendoza' experience in BA.

Great fun, good company and tasty!. Entertaining evening with good wine and food and generous serves. The host was knowledgable and friendly, you don't need to be a wine expert to enjoy this. We had a great table with other couples which proved to be a wonderful evening and got noisier as it progressed. We had been to wine tastings in Mendoza but were impressed with the quality of wine served mostly from small boutique vineyards. Great presentation and a fun evening.

Great wine tasting in BA!. Wine tasting at Anuva was so fun! You are seated at a big table with many other friendly people (mostly tourists), so you get a chance to discuss the wine and get to know other people who are traveling. Everyone at my table was really friendly and got along very well. At the tasting, you can try 5 different wines - for us, there was one sparkling, one torrontes (white wine from Argentina that is delicious and not very common in the states), and three red blends (with malbec featured heavily in two). Our sommelier was very knowledgable about the region and the wines, plus he was quite generous with the pour. He was also quick to offer refills when he saw that your glass was nearing empty. Not only did I have good wine, but it was all paired with delicious food. I planned on having dinner after, but with two crostinis, a corn stew, a meat and cheese plate, an empanada, and a chocolate truffle, I was full by the end of the tasting. If you're traveling alone, like me, this is a super easy and fun way to meet people, make friends, and start the night off well. I definitely recommend it!

Too overprized. Although Diego's knowledge is very wide and deep and could teach us about the regions and the wines, I did not see a lot of added value in this wine tasting. The prize of it is too overprized for what you get. We were 8 people and after he poured the 7.5dl bottle, almost half of the bottle was full! so we did not even get half of the normal tasting size (1dl) to try the wine. We had to ask him several times if we could get a little more wine so at least we can actually taste the wine. I did also a wine tasting in Chile on a vineyard and there we only paid half prize and got the double of what Anuva Wines was offering. So all in all I do not recommend this wine tasting. I am surprised that all the other comments are so positive.

Psssst....this is a MUST on Your To-Do List!. This was such a wonderful experience - from the ambiance, to the friendly/knowledgeable staff and diverse guests, I would say that this was one of the top experiences during my stay in Buenos Aires. The wine and food pairings were exceptional and I found that the carefully chosen food pairings definitely elevated the wine to an even higher level (who would have known that could be done!?!). The wine portions are generous and the host walked each guest through the experience of exploring the wines with each of their palates. Whether a novice or a skilled wine taster, I think each of us learned something we didn't know prior to this wine tasting. It is located in a trendy section of Palermo Soho, so if you have time to walk around before the tasting, check out some of the small shops that are around the area. I very much appreciated that Anuva wines are from small, family-owned wineries and the love that they have for wine-making is evident in the final product. Lastly, if you are interested in purchasing wine to come back to the States, this is the BEST way to have it shipped. This is one of the few places that can ship it for a reasonable price to your home (unless you reside in one of the 9 states that don't allow importation of of any alcoholic beverages).

Excellent wine tasting in the heart of Palermo Soho. A colleague and I found Anuva through TripAdvisor, and it was just as described. Alice and her team were very knowledgable and pleasant. We were treated to 5 generous pours, with chef prepared food pairings. However, it never felt the least bit pretentious. One thing to note- it can be tough to find, as the location is upstairs in a corner building and it isn't well marked. We went to another wine tasting during our visit, but this was our favorite. Highly recommended!

Great start to an evening. Had a great couple of hours with the delightful host Alice. Food pairings were interesting and the wine was excellent as was Alice's knowledge. Note : this is a wine tasting not a meal with wines so plan on going on afterwards to eat
Wonderful time!. Beautiful Space, Loved the wine and the food.Hostess was very knowledgable.I would go back again. Reminded me of Napa but a little more exotic
Amazing wine and great food. Tasting the Argentina wine and appetizers is a must when going to Argentina. What a great experience.

Good wine, good food pairings. Professionally run. Nice evening, about 2 hours. Interesting slate of wines, good pairings. Wished that we might had received a bit more information on the wine / growers etc other than a short verbal intro description. Nice people. Unless you go with your own crew Just know that you will most likely be seated with other US tourists, albeit highbrow.
Unique Experience. Knowledgeable host, relaxed environment with a cosy set-up for wine and food , friendly staff .Overall a good wine tasting experience.

Wine and Tapas. We enjoyed the wine and food pairings. We thought the wines offered for sale were overpriced. We felt we were rushed out as we were told to go find our own taxi as it would take too long for us to wait for the taxi to arrive.

Wine in the Loft!. Great for a small to medium size group of friends who want to try wines from the different region. Diego was our sommelier and did a fantastic job at educating us on the various wines in the region.

Stairway to ( almost ) Heaven !. Spent an afternoon in the relaxing company of delightful ladies : chatting, learning, drinking and eating. Our English hostess was happy to share her wine and food knowledge and give us some insight to living in BA too. Tasted some new wines, I was already a Malbec lover - thanks to a lovely cave owner in St Emillion, and have sampled "few" bottles since then :-) still found some lovely examples at Anuva. The single door entry to the tasting room is low key, and the room is located at first floor level if you are from the UK, second floor level if you are a from the USA ( it's a ground/first floor retail space below ) Even if you decide fifty dollars is more than you want to pay for an experience there is loads of useful info on the company website. Salud!

Awesome Evening!!!. What a great evening!!! I was staying in the Recoleta area of Buenos Aires and I grabbed a cab to the Palmero Soho area for this wine tasting evening. WOW, what a great time. Diego was amazing. He is as informative of a wine expert as I have ever seen. The night I was there they were featuring Malbacs, and while I am not a malbac fan, I had a great time!!! I wish I would have had some friends along with me to experience this. If you have the time to experience an evening like this, please do it!! You won't reget it!!!!

Fun way to learn about Argentine wines. A group of 5 of us -middle aged parents, 3 kids in their 20s - did a session at Anuva at the end of March, 2016.Diego Esteban was the host, and took us through a wine tasting of 5 wines from small Mendoza producers, with paired tapas. It was a lovely evening. Great and interesting wines, and all small batch stuff that you otherwise wouldn't come across. The tapas were great too. It isn't billed as dinner, but our session ran from about 6 to 8, and we really didn't need dinner afterward.Diego is a great host. Very personable, and extremely well informed. He knows a ton about the industry. If you are interested, you can learn a lot in a fun relaxed setting.

Amazing wine tasting . What a great way to be introduced to some of the best boutique wines in Argentina! Pay attention to the directions of this "hidden gem"when reading the location on the website. You will be pleasantly surprised when you arrive. The room is ideal, the staff professional and excellent wines are paired with tasty tapas. A knowledgeable sommelier educates you as you are partaking in this festive evening. A must for any wine lover!

Great winetasting. Laid back atmosphere. We either started late or the other guests were late. Good explanation of the wines and regions. Interesting tidbits for the tastings. About 24 guests including other Americans and a whole bunch of people from Bourdeaux, France :) They helped me to get a taxi back to my hotel.

Do NOT miss this experience!. If you can't make it to Mendoza wine country, make sure you carve out an evening to visit Anuva! The lovely, airy space, the delicious wines, the tapas, and in particular, the people at Anuva offer a great introduction to Argentine wines in a fun and informative atmosphere. In addition, their prices for bottles and shipping to the USA are extremely reasonable and the wines I ordered arrived within 3 weeks. Highly, highly recommend this!

Tipsy afternoon. We shared our wine experience with two couples and a group of fun (read wine) loving ever so slightly older folks. Our hosts Bertie and Erika made sure we all had a great time and delivered an informative and fun wine tasting experience. Their focus is on boutique vineyards so you are sure to taste some excellent wines that you may struggle to fins elsewhere. Generous pours, tasty food pairings and a relaxed time frame made for a perfect afternoon.

Anuva wine tasting. Best experience in Buenos Aires! 5 different wines to taste - all delicious. Wonderful pairing with traditional Argentinian food too.An intimate experience, with the perfect amount of education but still allowing an independent experience. Definite must!

A great evening!. We had a great evening at Anuva wine tasting, getting the chance to taste some boutique local wines.Staff were knowledgeable, and the food was matched perfectly. The Small group meant there was plenty to go aroundWe would totally recommend Anuva if your in Buenos Ares

Great Experience. Anuva was a great start to our trip. Diego is both friendly and intensely knowledgeable when it comes to wine; he'll walk you through everything from the origins of the grape to the prime age of the individual wine. We ordered an entire case (customized to taste) and will be making another stop at Anuva before we leave. A must in our opinion.

Definitely do this if youre in BA. Diego is a very knowledgeable and friendly sommelier. You will leave learning a LOT about wines even if you're not an expert (such as myself). The combination of foods was outstanding. I ended up buying a bottle when I left. Very educational.

Outstanding experience. My friends & I did a tasting at Anuva while on holiday in Buenos Aires. The setting is beautiful, the overview was educational and just the right amount of time and I felt that we got to experience a lot of quality wines. I particularly enjoyed the wine & food pairings which just elevated the experience. Having attended many wine tastings around the globe, I thought that Diego hosted one of the best - the perfect balance between sharing information and letting us enjoy and go at our own pace. Both novice and experienced wine drinkers would enjoy this - excellent price for the quality of the experience. I would definitely go again.

Mendoza Wine in downtown BA. Very good and simple to understand wine appreciation of Mendoza and Argentinian wines. Three ladies who ran it for us were terrific, Cara in particular who was the lead presenter. Knowledgeable, and passionate about her subject. Would do the event again when back in BA without a shadow of a doubt.

Great time and amazing wine!. My sister and I had a blast tasting wonderful wine and eating great food. Diego was a great host and very knowledgeable about the region and the different wine we were trying. We loved it so much we sent our friends there the next week! I ordered some wine and the wine arrived before I even got home! Will have to order more soon since I am drinking it fast! Great time all around and I wouldn't miss this in BA.

Loved the Tasting!!. This wine tasting came recommended from a friend of my daughters who lives here in Buenos Aires. My husband, daughter and I went for the tasting and had a wonderful time. The wines were paired with delicious appetizers. Diego was very knowledgeable about the wines we were served but also helpful with tips for our time here in BA. I would highly recommend you do this when in BA.

A "must do" in BA for any foodie/wine lover!. This was a wonderful way to learn more about the wines of Argentina! The wines offered a great range, the food pairings were well done and Diego was very knowledgable. An added bonus is that the location is tucked away in a really fun and interesting part of Palermo so if also offered a great chance to see a different part of the city.

Above and beyond your average wine tasting!!!. Absolutely loved my experience at Anuva Wines!! I went on a solo trip to Buenos Aires in Feb 2016 and wanted to do a nice wine tasting since I was not going to make it to Mendoza. This was the absolute perfect experience. Diego was incredibly knowledgeable about all of the wines and Mendoza region. Each of the wines came with a paired tapa. All of the food was delicious and paired so perfectly with the wine. I learned so much about food pairing from this. Diego made sure everyone felt included at the table and it was fun interacting with all the other guests. Great activity to do before a dinner or before you head out on the town for the night. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Do this - don't hesitate!. What an enjoyable couple hours at Anuva Wines. Diego and the other people who work here are knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and just fun to be around. The space is beautiful and we enjoyed meeting the other people at our big square table. Wine and food are both wonderful. Highly recommended!

Just do it!. We booked a tasting for our first evening in Buenos Aires. We arrived in the city in the morning after a 10 and a half hour flight. I thought that after a nap, this might be a perfect introduction to Argentina. We took a cab across town, arrived a bit early and walked around the neighborhood. The door is unmarked, you ring a bell, give your name through the intercom, and someone comes to fetch you. It is a bit like going into a speakeasy but instead of going into a windowless basement, you ascend to a light filled loft. We tasted about 6 wines with food pairing. Diego was a great teacher and his love for his country's wine and food shined through. You are able to purchase wine with free shipping to the US. We bought a case and it arrived at our house when we did two weeks later!The loft is also used for a pop-up dinner on weekends. If we could have fit it into our schedule, we definitely would have. All in all, I'd say wine tasting at Anuva is a must do!
FANTASTIC WINES!. We booked the wine tasting for our last day in Buenos Aires and it was just great! The wine was delicious, excellent service, a must go!

Excellent enjoyable afternoon!! It's a must!. My boyfriend and I attended a group wine tasting in anuva wines with Diego as the guide and the whole experience was excellent. The wines are amazing, and each tasting comes with food pairings to really bring out the flavours in the wines. Having been to BA four times this has been one of most enjoyable tours!

Good wines, knowledge and food as well. We booked this direct with the company to spend a pleasant afternoon before a cruise starting In B.A. We took a taxi across town, they provide directions after booking and be sure to print them out and show the taxi driver. Ours appeared to know exactly pulling up directly outside the door. They rang for a taxi for afterwards to return to our hotel in the Puerto Madero area. Our host was Bertie who had a very pleasant way of getting us to learn and taste the flavours of Argentinian wines along with some interesting food.  The two of us along with three Canadians and two Americans had good time. About 90 mins if I recall. All in all a great afternoon and as it was raining outside so it worked well for us. I may well have purchased but they don't ship to the U.K. only the U.S. coupled with the fact we had to get on a ship and knowing their rules about carry on booze that ended that idea.  AuroraUK

Fantastic introduction to Argentinian wines . We booked the wine tasting for our second day in BA and we're so pleased we did. The wine was delicious and the food pairings perfect. We learnt heaps about the different varieties and regions, and it was lovely to meet other travellers with similar interests. Highly recommended!

Don't miss this...!. A fantastic place where you are in tasteful local get to enjoy fine wine from some of Argentina's wine-provinces. The tasting is led by knowledgeable and pleasant person and the atmosphere is comfortable and familiar.

Enjoyable. This was a lovely way to spend an afternoon in BA, the wine was good and the information provided was excellent. The host was very knowledgeable and the food pairings were great. Upon reflection though, it was a very expensive afternoon for what it was, either the food should have been a meal or there should have been more types of wine to justify the cost. Overall, it was nice and pleasant but with the rate of the USD, not sure it was worth it. I would have preferred if they offered an option to pay in pesos.
Best Saturday afternoon. Lovely way to wile away a couple of hours drinking wine and snacking on tapas. They offer 5 wines and 5 tapas and for us that was lunch. Host was knowledgable and charming.

Great Activity in BA. My friend and I were just in BA in Palermo Soho area and were looking to do some wine tasting. We found Anuva and walked over to their store. If you do not make an appointment, do not hesitate to ring the bell. We were greeted by Diego who explained the tastings & times. We came back a few hours later and were pleasantly surprised with the tastings. Each wine came with a food pairing that was amazing and focused on local dishes. Diego was very informative about the wines and foods we were tasting. The tastings were generous and there was no pressure to purchase any wines. That being said, if you are like me and enjoyed the wines tasted, Anuva offers very reasonable shipping prices. I had a great time here and met some fun travelers. I would definitely recommend Anuva to anyone who is interested in local Angentinian wines and foods.

Perfect!. We loved this wine tasting experience. Not only do you get yummy wines, you also get great food to go with it. The wines are reasonable (under $30) and if you get a case, shipping to the US is free. We really enjoyed Diego-he was perfect. This is a great way to spend some time in Argentiba

Fun and informative . We had a nice afternoon here. Bertie knows his stuff and gave us some good and interesting info about the wine regions and the wine themselves. I also liked the tapas that complement the wines (and the information why that is). If you like the wine, they have no problem to pour you some more! We were the last to leave and they didnt give us the feeling we had to go even though we passed the given time duration of the tasting. Thank you guys. Ps. We were with 6 and we enjoyed our tablemates.

Recommended. Diego was the main reason.. The wine and flight tasting was good. The wines they chose matched well with the tapas.The structure and location of the tasting was very good. Very clean, cultural and professional at the same time.This tasting is a little bit more than what what we would normally pay however we minded less due to the expectional service by Diego. Such a knowledgeable sommelier and also went out of his way to help us understand the best way to purchase wines for us to be able to ship to Australia.

Unexpected Delight. Anuva Wine Tasting is a well appointed venue that allows its attendees to sample different wines while tasting foods that are recommend to accompany the six types of wines offered. I found the guests to be extremely sophisticated and my daughter and I enjoyed the entire presentation. Diego, our host, is a gracious gentleman who is very generous pouring as much wine as we desired. I do recommend this particular wine tasting as a must see when visiting Buenos Aires.

Ok tasting but DO NOT buy wines from Anuva. Had an acceptable wine tasting led by Cara, an English woman living in Buenos Aires. The price was fine for the amount of wine, food and explanation they provide, but she was quite pushy with wine sales. We bought a few bottles to ship home to Chicago, and really felt betrayed and scammed when we entered wine shops later in the week and found the exact same wines for a fraction of the price Anuva charges. See attached pictures for evidence.For example the Mairena Bonarda Anuva we bought for USD 25/per bottle (shipping not included) was 110 pesos (around USD 8) at a wine shop in Buenos Aires. The Laborum Torrontes Anuva sells for USD 20 was going for 185 pesos (14 dollars and a buy 2 get 1 free promo). Be aware of Anuva trying to rip off unsuspecting tourists.

Nice wine tasting. . The table mates were delightful. The wines were good. Tapas were nice. The room was extremely warm They cooled it down a bit. I personally think the price was a bit high in relation to value.
It was ok... Not what we had expected, 20 people to 1 host on our visit. Not great value for money as others have said. Education was very limited.

Perfect wine tasting in Buenos Aires . We had two hours of tasting at Anuva, learning not just about the wines but also the districts. We also were served local dishes along with the wines, which made the experience even more amazing. We went there two days before going back home, but I would recommend visiting them in the beginning of your stay because you get great tips on where to eat, good bars, etc. Highly recommended!

Tasty and informative wine tasting!. I was looking for an afternoon tasting close by to Palermo and this was perfect!The host Cara did a fantastic job! She was funny, and very knowledgeable! The food parings were a perk as well. I enjoyed the other people within the tasting, good way to mingle!Highly recommend!

An exquisite wine tasting experience. This is one of the true Argentinian wine tasting experience you shouldn't miss. Great venue, amazing hosts and outstanding Argentinian wines. The tasting consisted of five wines in total, three red Wines and two white ones. Anuva Wines paired them with an appetizer and explained us with what food should be paired each one. Extremely recommended and worth it. Thanks Anuva for the amazing experience!

Wine tasting in Buenos Aires . A hidden gem! We rang the doorbell on a plain door in a busy neighborhood, and we were warmly greeted and welcomed in to an elegant setting. Diego is a great host and extremely knowledgeable on the wines of Argentina. He was well supported by the rest of team who cooked and served delicious Argentinian food. The wine, ambience and experience was so enjoyable we shipped a case of wine back home to USA. Jessica & Jason

Absolutely superb wine tasting. Booked this wine tasting for a short trip to Buenos Aires and have to say it exceeded all expectations. There was a small group of really friendly, interesting people, keen to learn about wine. Diego was very informative, super knowledgable with a lot of experience. The food that was produced was utterly delicious and it was clear a lot of thought had gone into the evening. We tasted some excellent and unusual wines that we all promptly bought at the end - good value too. I went with my brother who has lived in Argentina for 6 years who agreed it was brilliant. Would highly recommend.

Good pairings, excellent wine, ample knowledge. If you dig wine, this is a must. Excellent private venue featuring small batch wines that are not exported, and they will ship to the states for free, even offer a wine club. The chefs is very good and the wine knowledge and pairings by Diego are really good. Also check out their partners Steaks by Luis.

Lovely wine tasting!. My boyfriend and I did a wine tasting here with Bertie. He was absolutely excellent, very knowledgeable about the wines as we tend to be very inquisitive and eager to learn more about all the different facets of a wine. The pours were generous and each tasting was also paired with a food tapa/tasting that were absolutely delicious. It included foods typical of the argentinean cuisine like empanadas as well as the traditional meat and cheese plate. The place is very sleek and well lit with natural light. I would definitely recommend the tasting.

Good wine and company. I was traveling solo and a wine tasting seemed like a good idea. Five different wines all paired with an Argentinian specialty. Our Sommelier, Diego was knowledgeable and interesting and poured a healthy glass of wine. A very nice early evening and teh other guests were all fun and interesting.

Herts Seniors Cricketers enjoy some wine.. 17 of us stood on the pavement outside and rang the bell. Expectations were low. Up the stairs into a warm and friendly environment. It was all set up just for us.Cara was welcoming and easy to understand with her Tenterden accent.Her enthusiasm for the wines and the accompanying food was infectious.If you liked a wine you were offered more. The best tasting I have ever been to.DWE Sports Tours.

Great Experience All the Way Around. Two friends and I went and had a great experience. Diego was great; he offered us great wines with great descriptions. What a nice, intimate setting. We would recommend it to anyone who wants to drink good wine and a knowledgeable and engaging sommelier.

Great Boutique Wines. Great introduction to Argentinian boutique wines. Diego, the sommelier, was very knowledgable about the wines and also paired each wine with tastings of great food. Also, got to meet a nice group of people. I ended up ordering a case to send home for the holidays. Looking forward to enjoying the wine with friends.

Amazing Wines. The wines-awesome. Packed 4 away in my suitcase to bring back to Canada! The food pairings were homemade and delicious. Our sommelier was entertaining & knowledgeable. A good way to spend a couple of hours before heading out for supper.

Tasty wine experience. Great overview of a sparking, white and three red wines from various locations around Argentina. Diego was knowledgeable about the wines and generous in servings of wine and nibbles. Lots of fun with a small group of fellow travellers and worth the cost.

Good place to visit. I enjoyed the tasting and pairings but found the pricing of their wines to be twice to be two to three times more than any wine you would ever buy in Buenos Aires or Mendoza. The tasting groups are small but our sitting included a family with children. The children only watched but it created a different environment for sure. Absent the minors present, we met a really nice couple and a woman who came alone. If you are in Argentina and will not make it to Mendoza, give this place a try. If you are going to Mendoza, I would suggest skipping it.

A lovely experience to try new lesser known wines. Cara was very knowledgeable and personable. We had a small group which was lovely the wines were excellent and the pairings we're perfect. I would definitely recommend this for wine and food lovers.

Wine tasting at Anuva Wines. What a wonderful experience we had thanks to Cara and her crew. We had a large group that is known to have fun and she not only welcomed us warmly but also shared her knowledge of exciting Argentinian wines. The Chin Chin sparkling wine was the perfect start. The Malbecs that followed were further enhanced by traditional tapas that were beautifully paired. It was my son's birthday and this was his most memorable evening of the entire trip. Thank-you everyone that made this night so amazing.Linda

Fantastic tasting of Argentine Wines. I loved that we tried wines from different regions all around Argentina, not just wine from Mendoza - Salta in the North and I think a Malbec from the South in Patagonia? All the tapas that were paired with the wines were delicious and the perfect amount of food. I learned a lot from Cara, the sommelier, especially in how to articulate descriptions of wine.  I went with my father who was visiting Argentina. He also loved the afternoon at Anuva Wines and it helped him appreciate Argentine Malbecs as we went out to dinner the next few nights trying them.

Great wine and service. The wine and food pairings were all great. Cara was very knowledgeable and helpful for both the experienced wine drinkers and the beginners to tasting (such as myself). While they do not ship to Canada yet, the shipment option for the wines is another reason to choose Anuva Wines. If you are an American or a Canadian who can ship to a US address this is a great way to efficiently bring great wine home.Her and the rest of the staff were also a good help in recommending some other good restaurants and bars in BA. Highly recommend this experience!

Best Part of Buenos Aires. We booked this wine tasting last minute because we didn't have time to make it to the wine region of Argentina and it didn't disappoint. It was by far one of our most favorite parts of our time in Buenos Aires! Florencia was incredible, so friendly and extremely helpful. Not to mention the wine and food were delicious. We ended up buying some bottles and they were waiting at our apartment by the time we got back from our honeymoon. We've even taken some of what we've learned and put it to use when ordering wine at restaurants now.

Best wine tasting ever!!! great expirence!!!!!. This is must if you are visiting BA!!!!This wine tasting was awesome. Cara was our host and she was super nice and helpful. You get to try five different wines and they are paired with food.We loved the Malbecs I highly recommend...
Start your trip here!!!. I went to Anuwa Wines the first day and it was excellent, exceeded all my expectations, Diego is the Best! Highly Recommend!
Wonderful wine tasting. The was tasting was amazing! The food was also excellent . It is really worth the price. Nothing bad to say about this place :)

Excellent Introduction to Argentinian Wines. Overall, everything about the tasting was really fantastic and I would say there is very little room for improvement. I loved the map of Argentina and felt like it helped put everything in perspective for climate/flavor of the wine. Cara was very knowledgeable about all of the wines being presented and overall just a very cheerful host. The tapas were pretty filling and delicious, especially the empanadas and corn stew. We were allowed many "top-offs" if you are worried about getting your money's worth. I would definitely recommend to others visiting Buenos Aires!

Favorite BA experience. Wine lovers-- go to Anuva! This was perhaps my favorite evening of my entire BA trip. Flor was an amazing, generous, and very knowledgable host. The wine and food pairings offered a delicious introduction to Argentinian wines. I ended up shipping 12 bottles of home so my friends/family could have a taste.

fun time, bad wine. The host, a young american, was friendly and welcoming to the group, but the actual wine, why we booked the tasting, was very subpar. No one else in the country had seemingly heard of the wines. The food pairings were nice and quite filling, but again, the wines were among the worst we had in Argentina.

Great introduction to Argentine wines. We visited Anuva on our second day in Buenos Aires, and had a phenomenal experience - the tasting room is in a great location, in a second floor loft in the trendy Palermo area of the city. The wines were both delicious and unexpected, as the company highlights wines which are only from smaller vineyards and types of wine that you'd normally never find back home in the States. The presentation and food pairings were great, and Florencia (the sommelier) was knowledgeable, friendly and spoke impeccable English. Definitely worth a visit if you enjoy wine and are in Buenos Aires.

Unique experience in Buenos Aires. I strongly recommend this experience in Buenos Aires. It is an amazing class about wines in Argentina. The wine degustation with foods is amazing! Florencia was our teacher and she is perfect! I talk about it with everyone. If you are in Buenos Aires, you have to go there! We bought excellent wines there!

Great wine and food pairings!. My husband and I recently visited Anuva Wines on our vacation in Buenos Aires. We had a great time. The venue looks a little shady from outside, but once upstairs, the building was very nice and modern. Florencia was our sommelier and host and she was very personable and knowledgeable. We tasted a sparkling wine, a white wine, and three reds. Each wine was paired with a delicious tapas. Our server was actually an American and he was also wonderful to talk to. We sat with some very friendly people, all from the States, and really enjoyed our time there. We purchased a case of wine and it almost beat us home. Great experience!

Fun experience, Great wine. One of my colleagues arranged this very nice surprise for us whilst we were in Buenos Aires over several days for work. We sat around a large table with another group of folks and had a great time tasting wine and eating some delicious food that went with it. The sommelier and his assistant were very personable and we had a lot of fun with him. The tasting, drinking, and eating were very well paced. The food was almost more of a highlight (for me anyway) than the wine. I liked the wines quite a bit even though I'm not a huge traditional wine drinker. I loved the white, the champagne, and one of the reds. I took advantage of what was on offer and ordered 6 bottles for delivery at home in the U.S. (rather than bother with lugging them around for the rest of my trip in South America.) They arrived as indicated in less than four weeks. A great experience; nice way to spend an afternoon in B.A. and I highly recommend.

Ran a bit long. In general we had an enjoyable afternoon with Anuva in Palermo, but both my partner and I felt the tasting was too long, almost 4 hours. The day we went it was very warm in Buenos Aires and sitting for so long got tiring, and also the building it is located in was like a huge greenhouse that got very hot and everyone including the friendly staff was sweating! Really appreciated all the tips for other things to do in the city. The milonga was a great place to see tango.

Sketchy wine tasting in Buenos Aires. Here is what the Anuva Wines experience was like for us:After booking on their website we showed up at the address provided in the confirmation email. No sign, a black metal door with gang graffitti covering it and a broken sidewalk directly in front. We rung the doorbell half expecting it was a scam at this point. A young woman answered the door and introduced herself as a study abroad student that would be conducting our wine tasting...Hmm, wine expert...So the tasting began and it quickly became very clear that the full intent was to sell sell sell wine. Obviously it is nice to be able to buy some wine to take home, but are all those signs saying they ship wine and including it in the script every 30 seconds really needed? The wines were quite mediocre in our opinions. In London we get much better wine from Argentina. Do yourself a favour and just go to a wine bar and order a few different glasses of local wine.

Great wine tasting experience!. I was in Buenos Aires for business and my visit to Anuva was arranged through the conference-- it was great to try boutique wines-- since most of the other events that I attended only had large wine companies-- things that I can buy in the supermarket in the US.The service was great, and Diego, the sommelier, was great at explaining the wine, the region, the grapes and pairings.Would highly recommend it.

Fun evening, led by qualified enologist through 5 tastings. We were seated around a large table seating 11 guests. Up front were maps of Argentina and Mendoza. Diego introduced himself, passed out cards for our wine notes, then got started with the first wine, Las Perdices Extra Brut, right away. As he discussed the wine, we sipped, then tried it with the first of five appetizers. On to 2 whites and followed by 2 reds. I live near Napa so I've done this kind of thing before, so I was surprised that I learned some new information. The pours were generous, glasses were refilled and at the end we could ask for more of any of the wines. The wine was delicious. The cost, $52 USD each, was very fair for such generous pours and the 5 food pairings, with the excellent wine presentations as a great added bonus.We were invited to order any of the wines at the close of the program, without any pressure.The room is attractive with lots of natural light coming in through large windows. We were upstairs, and there was a balcony we could step onto. Everything was very clean. Everyone's English was excellent.Before we went I was confused about the food: While certainly adequate, the food pairings did not constitute dinner. Anuva is upstairs behind a black, unmarked industrial-looking door, and it is easy to miss. The directions we were given were good though, so no problem.The four of us had a great evening and we are very glad we went. Salud!

Anuva Wine Tasting and Food Pairing. Great experience and a wonderful way to learn about and sample wines of Argentina and also how to best pair them with food. They also group you with fellow English speakers.Diego was very knowledgeable and he also accommodated a special wine tasting request on a late reservation.I highly recommend this event if you want to learn about Argentinian wines and meet some new friends in South America.

Great experience!. As a "newby" to this sort of thing, I didn't really know what to expect but Diego was fantastic in explaining all the wines and particularly about the areas in Argentina where they come from and what makes them unique. The food accompaniments were also better than expected. Great night. If I had to comment on 1 thing, it would be that at times it felt slightly rushed. Other than that, great night with a great host!

Wonderful experience!. We had an excellent evening of wine tasting at Anuva. We tasted 5 wines, all from boutique wineries in the Mendoza region, including an absolutely incredible malbec, San Gimignano Roble (I believe) that rivals any I've ever tasted around the world. The food pairings were also delicious and the perfect complement to the wines.You are seated at a communal table with other guests (mostly tourists) which makes for a collegial and fun atmosphere - especially after a few glasses of wine!Diego and his team were top-notch professionals, very friendly and knowledgable about the wines they presented, and extremely generous in their pourings! Asking for seconds (or thirds) were not only expected but encouraged...from past experience, this is a rare (and very much appreciated) service indeed!It's not cheap at $52, especially by local standards - but if you can afford it, it's worth every penny. I highly recommend Diego and his team at Anuva!
Great wine tasting. A great night of wine tasting. The wines were fantastic, Diego was a great teacher and the food pairings were delicious. Definitely worth a visit if you have a free evening in BA

If you are in Buenos Aires and love wine, do not miss this!. We tasted some really good wines, with an interesting explanation about each of them. The wines were not cliches from major wineries, so we did learn something to expand our wine catalogue. The food pairings were very good too, obviously chosen very carefully for each wine.

Fantastic Wine Tasting in the City!. My friends and I enjoyed a fabulous wine tasting in the city, thanks to Diego and his staff! The atmosphere was absolutely warm and charming in a lovely loft space. The three of us were fortunate to be able to share the experience with other travelers as well, which made for fun and interesting conversation. Also, the food was delicious! To top it off, we were able to easily order wines to be shipped to us in the US, which was a bonus! While we were unable to visit the Mendoza area to experience an actual vineyard (unfortunately, that region is a day's drive from BA) this was an excellent alternative!

Very informative wine tasting, with unique wines and delicious food pairings. We weren’t sure what to expect at Anuva and were pleasantly surprised with the high quality of the wine tasting. We drink quite a bit of Argentine wine at home and have visited Mendoza, so were already familiar with many of the local offerings. Regardless, the sommelier hosting our tasting provided us with tons of new information about the different varietals and wineries. It was a great opportunity to try wines from smaller Argentine producers that we weren't necessarily familiar with beforehand. The pours were all generous, with seconds on request. The accompanying food was incredibly delicious and certainly paired well with all the wines. We purchased a couple bottles to take home and wish they shipped to where we live! It was very easy to reserve online, although it would be nice to know what their availability is before entering credit card information. We’ve included photos and a bit more description on our blog for those interested: http://swansoni.blogspot.com/2015/07/buenos-aires-then-and-now.html
Don't miss it. Diego was a perfect host and very knowledgable about the wines and food pairings. The wine was good and they poured freely, allowing you to have another taste of any that you like.

"Best wine tasting I've ever been to". We would highly recommend Anuva Wines if you are traveling to Buenos Aires. Located in the trendy Palermo Soho, this loft is filled with class and character. Diego the sommelier was incredibly knowledgeable and gives a hefty pour. The food pairings were delectable. One of the most fun parts was trying the different wines with the different food pairing to see what you liked most. Did we mention Diego's Humita (heavenly stew) recipe was mouth watering?!? Totally worth $52USD!

Fun tasting in Palermo. Had a nice time at the Anuva Wine tasting during my recent business trip to Buenos Aires. Enjoyed the final wine the most. Only criticism would be to tone down the sales pitch a bit, and make it a bit shorter, since after the 3 hour mark the group was getting a bit restless.

Delicious and Wonderful. My husband and I loved our experience at Anuva. We don't know too much about wine but we still enjoyed the experience very much. Anuva does a good job of showing you how different types of wines and foods compliment each other in a way that brings out the best flavors. The tapas and wine individually were quite delicious, but together, just a great afternoon. If you like wine, you can't miss this. If you are a wine newbie, like us, it is still a great experience.We ended up buying two bottles of wine to take home (since we are from Canada) but there is option to ship a crate to your home if you live in the US.

Great wine and foods. Went to the wine tasting and dinner at Anuva at their Palermo location. Enjoyed the wines and little foods, but the soup was cold and the sparkling wine had no bubbles left. Host Diego very tall and funny and knew something about wine.

Don't Miss This Opportunity!. Attended a wine tasting here while traveling in BA solo. What a great decision. Met some outstanding people--fellow travelers and Anuva staff. The wines were incredible--better than any Argentine wine I have bought in the U.S. Each was paired with both delicious tapas (one of them our sommelier's personal recipe) and well-informed history of the region, wine making process, and ideal foods for pairing. The pours are generous, the atmosphere both intimate and informal, and the location clean and elegant. The group I shared the event with enjoyed the experience so much, we all continued the evening over dinner together after the wine tasting. And our host Diego even joined us! Great wines. Great company. A truly memorable BA experience. Diego and Anuva wines may just have a customer for life.
doesn't get much better. Lovely environment, tasty wine (including some surprises), yummy food and useful information - a powerful combination!

Wonderful Afternoon of tastings!. My husband and I had the pleasure of attending an afternoon tasting at Anuva Wines for our anniversary trip to Buenos Aires. It ended up being a private tasting with just us which was wonderful! Flor, our host, was incredibly knowledgable and personable and truly took time to learn about our backgrounds, tastes, and wine knowledge. We learned so much from her about the incredible wines, much more than I have learned on tastings in Napa! Flor's food pairings that we had were perfect and we left feeling content and full. We loved our visit so much that we sent ourselves some Argentine wines to enjoy upon our return home. We will highly recommend Anuva Wines to our friends and family!

Excellent experience. Went to the 6pm wine tasting with Diego.An excellent, informative exprience. We tasted 5 wines which were paired with some lovely tapas.Diego was extremely informative and knowledgeable which was even better. I learnt a great deal!

It worths every cent!. Our host was kind and gentle. Me and my girlfriend had a wine tasting only for us (lucky!) and it was incredible. The food is great and unique! They have their own recipes and it tastes as wonderful as their local wines. Productions of only a few bottles that you cannot find it not at Anuva!

Excellent evening of wine tasting and learning about the different wines of Argentina with Anuva wines.. The venue is a little hidden gem behind a black door in Palermo. Climb the stairs and you enter a warm and airy area surrounded by wines. There are several tables that can host upto 8 persons each. We were introduced to the history of Anuva wines by our hosts and the evening's tasting was explained in detail. Each wine was accompanied by a freshly made tapas to bring out the best flavour of each of the wines. Our host was extremely knowledgable and spoke fluent English and of course Spanish. Our questions were easily answered by her. The whole evening was extremely enjoyable, relaxed and informative. I have done the wind visit 3 times now, on each visit to Buenos Aires. I cannot recommend Anuva wines or their staff highly enough!

Wonderful wine tasting.. Wow just wow. I have been to several different wine tasting in several different countries and this is the first one to pair food with the wine. Diego is awesome and such a great guy. I am not much of a wine drinker but I have found a wine or two that I actually like. When I tasted a few of the wines before trying the food I didn't like them but then when I tried the food and then the wine I liked the wine. It is something about the different foods that brings out a different taste in the wine. I highly recommend a wine tasting here. Check it out for sure.

Great wine tasting and pairing. I was only in BA for a limited time so I could not go to Mendoza for a wine experience in Argentina. I wanted something in BA that would allow me to experience the wines of Argentina and the Anuva wine experience was perfect. I found it on trip advisor and after reading the reviews decided to try it. There are quite a few wine tasting alternatives but this was the only one that offer food pairings and was more affordable than the others. I absolutely loved it. The wines and food were great, and our sommelier was excellent and she didn't make any of us feel like we had to know a lot about wines. I recommend it for anyone who likes wine, food and doesn't have time for a longer trip to the wine region.I wanted to learn about Argentina wines and this experience allowed me to experience both wine and food.

Bueno Vino Buenos Aires!. My friend Denise and I were recommended to enjoy a great wine tasting while visiting Buenos Aires during a recent trip and so we chose Anuva Wines in the chic Palermo Soho neighborhood. The location was amazing and we loved it so much, we went back to the neighborhood three more times during our stay. The team at Anuva, led by our own sommelier Florencia, did an amazing job with the tasting, explaining each in detail and pairing it nicely with food. We tried five different wines, beginning with a sparkling white and ending with a delicious Malbec. The wines were all Argentinean and were from the Mendoza region, including Salta and others. We liked the tasting so much, we bought a case to ship back to the US. I cannot say enough about their professionalism, their thoroughness and their ability to make you feel right at home in their gorgeous venue. Well done Anuva and well done Argentina!

Wonderful time!. Their wine tasting was very informative, fun and full of delicious food and wine. We were with a great random group of people from all over and were able to chat, laugh and ask questions. The room is beautiful and we ordered some bottles for delivery, which arrived about a week later! They were also able to recommend a milonga tour company to us which was great as well!

Wonderful time. One of the highlights of the trip!. We had a wonderful time at Anuva Wines. The wine was PLENTIFUL and the food was delicious. We met some great people and really enjoyed ourselves. It was a relaxing and fun experience not to be missed.
Great boutique wine tasting. Wonderful and informative afternoon tasting and learning about unique boutiques wines from Argentina's Mendoza wine region in western Argentina.

Boutique wines with food pairings. The sommelier spoke English which worked well for our group. Most were knowledgeable about wines, so there wasn't a lot of time spent on the basics. I've been on wine tours and tastings, but this was the first one I've done with food pairings. The combination with food made such a huge difference and really highlighted how this can affect the wine's taste. The food was good and the pours plentiful. We also received excellent recommendation for dinner.

Put this at the top of your list!. We booked our Anuva wine tasting on the first night of our visit to BA and we were so glad we did. It was a fun, relaxing way to start our trip. 5 great wines paired with fantastic food. Diego was our host, he was fun, informative and relaxed. Just enough information about the wine and region without being stuffy or snobby. He provided helpful tips and suggestions about restaurants and activities for the rest of our time in Argentina. The venue is a hidden gem behind an unmarked door. Great value for a truly enjoyable evening!

Such tasty wine!. Diego was a great host and the wine was delicious! The place is a little bit hard to find so I would recommend giving yourself some extra time before arrival. We tasted 5 different wines paired with 5 different foods--so come hungry! This was one of the highlights of my trip to Buenos Aires and I definitely recommend it!

Amazing wine tasting. We booked a tasting in the afternoon and it was wonderful!The place is really welcoming, very well arranged and especially, not intimidating, for beginners like us.The host was extremely enthusiastic, fun and knew her products really wellWe had an amazing time there and we learned a lot.We would definitely go back if we were to return to Buenos Aires.Don't miss out!

Fantasticks wine tasting. Wow! This wine tasting was awesome. We booked through Viator and it was very reasonably priced. Cara was our host and she was super nice and helpful. You get to try five different wines and they are paired with food. Don't eat before you go. We loved the Malbecs and even became members of the wine club. I highly recommend Anuva Wines.

A must when in Buenos Aires. Book online for a wine tasting.Diego is so knowledgeable and a great host. The surroundings are beautiful. For your package $26 you get 5 wines and delicious nibbles to complement the wine. The wines are amazing. Tour started at 3pm or 6pm. Really recommend it with friends to enjoy a tasting.

Absolutely incredible afternoon of Argentine wines.. My fiance and I spent our first afternoon in Buenos Aires at the stunning Anuva Wines loft for a wine tasting, which completely exceeded our expectations. Along with an incredibly knowledgeable sommelier to guide us, the range of wines was absolutely stunning, as were the delicious accompanying tapas. Not only did we enjoy drinking the wines, we also learned a great deal about Argentine wines and the South American wine regions. If you don't have a chance to make it to Mendoza while in Argentina, this is definitely the next best option!

No time for Mendoza? Do Anuva!. My husband and I are by no means wine connoisseurs, but had the best time here sampling the wines of the region! We heard about Malbec and its history in Argentina and were incredibly excited to learn more about wines from an expert. Another couple was scheduled to do the tasting with us, but canceled, so we had the afternoon to ourselves with Samantha. Samantha ran our tasting and you could tell that she was passionate about her work and wines. With each wine tasting there was a food pairing - chocolate truffles from Ecuador, empanadas, and sorbet. We had a later flight that evening and started our day off with this experience. Down the street are many beautiful shops, so you really can make a day out of this. With every wine we tasted came a beautiful story from Samantha about its origin. We had bottles shipped to us back in Chicago with no worries. Every time we opened a bottle we thought about this special trip. Highly recommend this, as it was a great afternoon and way to experience the wines of the region if you don't make it to Mendoza.

Highlight!. This is a very special experience in Buenos Aires. A great education and great fun. Wines and tapas were delicious, we learned a lot, and they pour very generously as well as offer refills as you wish at the end of the night. Go!

Very interesting evening. We got there late because it took almost 45 min from Obelisco and we were not aware but just in time to not disturb the other 2 people who were already there for the wine tasting as well. The place is nice. It looks like a big kitchen in a loft. Diego who presented the wines spoke Portuguese which was a plus because my partner does not speak English. The wines were amazing and really helped me to get to know the wine culture in Argentina. The tapas were really tasting and I loved the fact that you could drink more wine if you wanted to. I left there quite happy. We enjoyed the time we spent there and I really recommend it.

Excellent evening!. Great venue, excellent hostess (Cara) she was very knowledgeable about both the wines that we were tasting and Argentina as a whole. Good selection of wines and you can learn quite a lot about the wine making process and all sorts. Would highly recommend this evening to anyone and would not hesitate to attend if ever back in Buenos Aires, excellent for a complete novice such as myself and all other levels of wine enthusiasts.

Great introduction to Argentinian Wine. A couple friends and I went to Argentina hearing lots of things about their amazing wines, but we didn't really know what to look for when we were there, other than "Malbec." Based on TripAdvisor recommendations, we decided to do a tasting at Anuva, and we weren't disappointed. We tasted (and sort of drank a lot of) 5 different wines, and were led on our wine "journey" by the wonderful Florencia. We tasted 1 torrontes, 1 bernardo, and 3 malbecs, and each wine was delicious and very well paired with the food items they were served with. Between the three of us, we ended up buying 2 cases of wine to be shipped back to us in California (and they had a great free shipping deal too)! Florencia also gave us some great food and drink recommendations around town! Highly recommended for anyone who wants to learn about Argentinian wines from wine experts!

Great experience. If you are in Buenos Aires and can't make it to Mendoza, this is the perfect outing for a wine tasting. Not only do they select quality wines that you would be hard pressed to find otherwise, but they do a good job of selecting a wide variety that represents all that the country has to offer, from Torrontes to Malbec. The food pairings are also well thought out - we had everything from cheese to quince paste to empanadas. I ended up buying a bottle which I plan on enjoying in the future.

FUN AND FABULOUS!!. I have done of wine tastings, however have never had quite the experience as I did at Anuva. Cara was so energetic and enthusiastic and clearly showed her passion for wine. Each accompanying tapas was carefully selected and they accomodated my dietary preferences. The venue was perfect for the event as well. Very comfortable and casual seating, and the wine pours were more than generous, with refills as you pleased. I have read concerns about the venue, specifically, no sign on the door, however when you make the reservation, the email confirmation is very clear on what to expect and what to look for. The evening was relaxed. Very much worth the value.

Perfect Experience. My husband and I have participated in a few wine tastings, but none had the charm of Anuva. We arrived in a beautiful loft and were warmly greeted by Cara. Her explanations of the wines was witty and gave us the right amount of detail. She was always available for followup questions and, most importantly, refills =)I recommend this tour as a must see in BA. You won't regret it. Take the time to explore Palermo after.

Great Wines Great Evening. We went to Anuva Wines based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The way all the wines are explained is great, and there was ample to drink. Also the little tapas on offer worked really well with the wines. On the whole a great evening and we would recommend this to anyone who enjoys their wines and wants to learn a little more about the amazing local wines in Argentina.

Amazing evening with gorgeous wines. This is a must if you are visiting BA. The wines we tasted were all lovely and very generous! We struggled all week prior to our visit to find a white that we liked. The sparkling and the White we tasted were out of this world. It was also really interested to try 2 very different Malbecs. The food that accompanied the wines was delicious and we were a little merry when we left! No headaches the next day either! The address is slightly tricky to find but we used a free location app which took us right to the door - www.cearch.netWe would love to see Anuva shipping to the UK.

Great experience!. This was a highlight in our time in B.A. We were unable to make it up to Mendoza, but this was great substitute. We sampled 5 wines: a sparkling, a white, and 3 reds, all of them excellent and all from small, family-owned wineries in the Mendoza area and each accompanied by a delicious, complementary food. Our hostess, Cara, was very knowledgeable and quite a show-woman the way she managed the experience. We especially enjoyed learning about the uniquely Argentinian grapes. We ended up buying a case of wine and we're going to recreate the experience for friends at home. It really was quite fun!

Second time to Anuva Wine Tasting. Last year I went to BA, for fun... And we went to this wonderful taking experience. Fun, education, great wines, with little tapas to add to the experience. I ordered a case of wine to remind me of Argentina once back in NYC. This year I needed to go for work, and I made sure to squeeze in a tasting. It was superior yet again. Few different wines tasted, different host, so different stories, met some cool people... And this time I ordered 2 cases! This way I can share some of this yummy wine with some friends. Do this!!!! Highly recommended.

Great time had!. I very much enjoyed my time here, and bought several bottles of wine that I just got in the mail! The staff was lovely and knowledgeable and I loved all the food that was served. Well worth the money, Highly recommend!
Great addition to an Awesome trip in Buenos Aires!. Knowledgeable, fun and helpful staff. Great food and of course amazing wine! Met great people there as well. Highly recommended!

Anuva Wine Experience . It was a pleasure experience, where we could taste some wonderful wines combined with delicious snacks and also meet people all around the world. The explanations were really nice and have made our interest about wine grew.
I'd recommend this experience for everyone.

Brilliant, boozy afternoon!. Really great way to spend an afternoon. We arrived to the tasting room which is beautifully decorated and greete warmly by our sommelier for the afternoon. the 5 wines we were tasting were written on a blackboard for reference. The selection of wines was great, all from boutique vineyards that the sommelier was very knowledgeable about. Not your average wines either! One sparkling, one white and 3 reds, showcasing the best of Argentinian wines- not limited to Malbec! (Although the Malbec was fantastic). The food pairings were lovely and enough for me and my partner for dinner. When we went there were 7 other people (9 total), mostly couples in their twenties or thirties so there was a really fun atmosphere, not at all stuck up of stuffy! All in all, my favourite place to try wine in BA.

great way to spend an afternoon/evening in buenos aires. We were sadly unable to fit a trip to Mendoza into our Argentina itinerary, but this wine tasting with Anuva Wines was the next best thing during our short stay in Buenos Aires!My husband and I participated in a 5pm tasting with Cara at Anuva's lovely loft in Palermo. It was an intimate setting (only four other people participating - we greatly enjoyed chatting and discussing the wines with them) and Cara was warm, charismatic, and very knowledgeable. The wines were all delicious and demonstrated the rich variety of wines from Argentina which go beyond the standard Malbec. I was also pleasantly surprised to try a couple of Malbecs that had lovely flavor profiles that were really different from the Malbecs that I have access to at home. We ordered a case of wine, taking advantage of the free shipping to the US.The tapas offered during the tasting were delicious - the perfect appetizer before strolling through Palermo and enjoying a delicious dinner there later in the evening at Social Paraiso (recommended to us by Cara). All in all, a great experience and an excellent way to experience Argentina's wine culture without traveling all the way to the wine-producing regions. Of course - now we are eager to plan a trip back and visit the Mendoza botique wineries that Cara introduced us to.!

Great wines and a fun experience. Anuva specialises in promoting the wines from small boutique wineries across Argentina and we were not disappointed. The selected wines were well matched with the accompanying Argentine Tapas and expertly and enthusiastically introduced by Cara who clearly enjoys sharing the best of what Argentine viniculture has to offer. The venue, in a Palermo Loft is ideal for small group tastings and our hostess created a fun and relaxed atmosphere in which to experience new tastes and make new friends. Booking via the website was simplicity itself and confirmation of our same day booking was swift. Those with mobility problems should be aware that the loft is accessed via a long steep staircase. Overall - a great experience for both the Argentine wine novice and enthusiast alike!

A delightful day out!. My partner & I had a lovely day wine tasting @ Anuva.We were unable to go to Mendoza on this trip but were delighted to learn that Anuva bring some of Argentina's best wines to you!Cara was an amazing host. We have done many wine tours before & managed to learm lots of new things from Cara. She was very knowledgeable & had fantastic charisma.The wine was top notch & food pairing sensational.We did the 2pm session then took advantage of the rest of the afternoon to stroll around Palermo Soho which is a gorgeous part of town.I'd highly recommend this to all the wine lovers out there visiting Buenos Aires!

Good wine, great fun!. Our group of 6 had a fabulous time at Anuva. Our hostess, Cara, was amazing! The wines chosen for our group were delicious, and she shared such great history of the wine and answered all our questions. The food pairings were also a lovely treat we all enjoyed. Highly suggest if you'd like to taste wines from small, family wineries in the Mendoza region.

Great Wine and Great Experience!. We enjoyed a great afternoon of boutique wine of Argentina. Presentation was great and the wines were some of the best we have tasted. The food pairing matched perfectly with the five wines tasted. We ordered two cases of wine with free shipping to the USA. A wine experience that one must visit when visiting Buenos Aires. Thanks You Anuva.

Lovely setting, great wines and food pairings. Thank you Cara and all at Anuva for a great evening, and some yummy wines. It was great to learn more about the various wine regions in Argentina, and that it's not all about Malbec! The food pairings really bring out the different tastes, and help deepen your appreciation for the generous pours of wine! Thoroughly recommemd others to book this wine tasting, and also take some time to explore the local area which has some real gems.

FIVE STAR WINE TASTING EXPERIENCE. I found out about Anuva Wines while staying in Buenos Aires surfing on the internet for wine tasting venues. I'm glad that I did a tasting here because they offer an education, tasting of five different types served with tapas. Then you can purchase wine to go based on the listed price or order it for delivery to the United States. I still get promotion emails this day. All of this access for a one-time fee of $65. It is worth it to have the connection Argentina. FYI just look for the BLACK DOOR because there is no sign outside identifying Anuva Wines. Happy Travels!!!

Fabolous experience. This place is a fantastic experience to get to know boutique wines from Argentina, and not only Malbec....great presentation of wine, accompanied by delicious finger food.... You can buy a box of wine with free shipping to the U.S, awesome ... difficult to find in Palermo, but it's worth the effort!!!
