Boutique wines, delicious pairings & fantastic staff. My husband and I visited Buenos Aires this January, and had the opportunity to partake in the food and wine pairing lunch at Anuva. The experience was an absolute delight!There was not a wine in the bunch (and we tasted a total of six) that we did not enjoy - everything was very good quality. It also seemed that Anuva takes great care in curating their wines, with many varietals from all over Argentina. (While malbecs from Mendoza are wonderful and you should definitely drink many of them, we appreciated getting to see other sides of the Argentine wine world.) We ordered a case of wine after our tasting, choosing from wines we had tasted and wines recommended to us by the sommelier, which was shipped to us for free. Based on the costs of shipping we saw at wineries in Mendoza, this alone is reason to spend an afternoon with Anuva.On to the food... Delicious! Again, it felt like everything was very carefully curated, with much thought and care put into each dish. And these are just small bites either, you'll definitely fill up while you're here. I also appreciated how accommodating they were with my vegetarian diet - even though I was unable to give them advanced notice, they were able to whip something up for me even when the planned pairing was a meat dish. We especially loved the humita paired with a delicious torrontes.Good wine, good food, what's left? Good people! Anuva has that too. Our sommelier, Diego, was an absolute wealth of knowledge not only about the wines we were drinking that day, but about the entire Argentine (and Chilean) wine industry. He expertly weaved information about the wine itself (tasting notes) with stories of the wineries and wine makers, making the tasting interesting and informative. As we were departing for Mendoza a few days after our visit to Anuva, we asked Diego if he could give us some dining and wine tasting recommendations. He gave us a detailed list of wineries that they work with at Anuva, wineries that serve lunch, wineries we could bike to, and much more. We went to three wineries he recommended, and all of them were excellent, and very different from each other. He also gave us a wine tour company recommendation that we booked and had a phenomenal time with.The $52 USD / person is well worth it for a wonderful company and delicious food and wine in the heart of Palermo. Make a reservation & enjoy!

Awesome Wine Tasting in B.A.. My girlfriend and I had an awesome wine tasting here. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. They serve well researched wines and good accompanying food paired along with it all. Would definitely recommend this spot.

Wonderful wine tasting experience. Our short stay in Buenos Aires would not have been complete without tasting some local wines and this fit the bill perfectly. The wines were excellent and accompanied with some lovely tapas which were beautifully paired with the wines. The venue was lovely and the staff were very knowledgeable and friendly.

Terrific food and wine pairing experience. We had a great time tasting some nice wines paired with small plates specially created to enhance each wine. It was very interesting to taste something that was delicious with one wine just to find that it wasn't nearly as good with another wine. The best pairing was chocolate with malbec! Soooo good! Diego, our host, really knew his stuff. It was the last thing we did at the end of a three-week trip, and it left us with a wonderful memory of Buenos Aires.
Fun and Informative Evening. Thoroughly enjoyed our evening. Good wines and even better food. Our hosts were knowledgable and friendly. Learned a lot about different wines and foods of Argentina.

Good times, great wine. We had a lovely afternoon tasting with Anuva Wines. It was a nice chance to sample an array Argentine wines while in Buenos Aires and the food pairings were a treat. Our host was very knowledgeable and friendly and made the experience quite fun. Also- if you buy a case of wine, they will ship it to the US for free!

Fantastic introduction to Argentinian Wine. I did the wine tasting hoping to gain some insight into Argentinian wines beyond the standard Malbecs which are so commonly found around the world. The Anuva tasting went above and beyond! I can not recommend this experience enough. Both the food and the wines were terrific! Moreover Cara, who hosted the tasting, was perfect! She was knowledgeable, engaging and very comfortable to speak to about all things wine related and beyond. She made the whole experience fun and casual, yet informative and educational. I have been to many wine tastings and this was a real stand out for me! Thanks again for a great time!

A treat for the tastebuds!. The Anuva wine tasting was an absolute pleasure from start to finish. First of all, it seems like the experts are obviously very knowledgeable on the wines, but they will only provide/disclose enough education as comfortable for the specific group. If you're a big wine expert - you'll learn a lot. If a casual drinker, like my partner and I - you'll also learn a lot, but feel comfortable without being bombarded with terminology you have no idea about. Our host Diego was terrific and extremely friendly - made us feel at home. The tapas that go with the wines are just fabulous and really do go well with the different types of vino. The wines themselves are fantastic and it was great to try as much of our favorites as we desired - with top-ups welcome . We couldn't leave without purchasing our favorite bottle to enjoy on the remainder of our holiday.

Anuva Wines is a must if you like wine!. A friend of mine bought me a wine tasting at Anuva Wines in Palermo, Buenos Aires. Everything was excellent from the beginning. Walking into the loft I was pleasantly surprised at the decor...was very clean and inviting. The temperatures outdoors were also very hot and I was happy to find inside was nicely air-conditioned. We were greeted us with enthusiasm and kindness by Cara. She was great, able and willing to answer all of our questions about the wines we had. The wines were all paired with tasty tapas style dishes. I thought there was plenty of food and wine for the experience and I didn't leave hungry! I am not a very knowledgable wine drinker, but there were a variety of people at our table and I think we all enjoyed the experience. I would definitely recommend the experience to all who are curious about this wine tasting, from newbies to experts. The only concern I had was there was a case of stairs to climb to get to the loft. One of the guests had two canes to walk with but he made it up with some assistance.

Great tasting and enthusiastic host. I really enjoyed the wine tasting (accompanied with original Argentine "snacks" that fit the different wines) at Anuva wines a lot. Our host Florencia was really enthusiastic and had a lot of knowledge. She explained the history of Argentine wines, their development and the wine regions and did that in a very entertaining way. We tasted wines from different vineyards, they were great and tasteful and Florencia wasn't generous when pouring the wine. Finally, the ambiance was really good and I thought it was nice to have the chance to taste with other people in the group from all over the world and share our experiences. This wine tasting is suitable for people with any level of wine knowledge: most important is that you enjoy good wine and good food.

Amazing wine and experience. As our time didn't allow a side trip to Mendoza, we chose this experience to taste some of the wonderful Argentine wines. The food that was paired with each of the wines was perfect. Our wine education was limited previous to this visit, but we felt comfortable in the atmosphere of learning that now encourages us to taste wine with new eyes. An extra bonus was the connection they have with a distributor in the US, so we were able to order wine back home!

A lovely tasting led by an engaging and fun expert. I was lucky enough to do one of Anuva's tastings last week and thoroughly recommend it. The loft in which the event was held was tasteful and light and our guide (Diego) was a charming and lovely presenter who led us expertly through five different (but equally enjoyable) styles of wine: A sparkling, a white and three reds, including malbecs. I thoroughly recommend the experience, including the beautiful tapas that accompanied each wine. Thank you, Anuva', for a lovely and informative experience.

Fun wines and great knowledge!. The wines we tasted were delicious and the space was beautiful. In the heart of Palermo, the open studio was perfect. We bought a few bottles to go, which were priced well and still tasty back home!

Fun and educational wine tasting experience. The wine tasting takes place in a sunny, spacious loft space. Each wine was paired with a particular food, all excellent. It was an interesting group of people, and the sommelier shared good information about the wines. Anuva will ship wine back home for you, so it was great to have a bit of vacation arrive for us after our return home.

A must do and wonderful experience!!. I was pleasantly surprised and extremely happy with my experience attending the Anuva wine tasting. The wine and pairing foods were top notch and the sommelier was very knowledgeable and kept it interesting. The wine selection was so good, I brought back bottles for my family members. If you are visiting BA, do not miss visiting Anuva wine tasting, a 5 star experience!! Dr. Kenneth Woliner

Outstanding Experience in Buenos Aires. My dad and I were looking for a place to taste good Argentinian wines on short notice and we were able to book a wine tasting with Anuva wines. The experience was outstanding and one I would eagerly repeat! Diego was our phenomenal host and not only did he speak flawless English (among several other languages), but he knew an exceptionally large amount about the wine produced in his country. And not only did we enjoy tasting the wine, but the tapas provided were surprisingly excellent as well. The food paired well with the wine and was very well-prepared. My personal favorite was the chocolate at the end! We enjoyed the wine so much we had two cases shipped back to the U.S. for us. I would highly recommend a trip to Anuva Wines - you won't be disappointed!

Hidden Gem-- Best Wine Tasting EVER!!. My boyfriend and I were visiting B.A. for a few days and didn't have enough time to make it to Mendoza, so we opted for this wine tasting instead. It exceeded all expectations. I can honestly say this was one of the greatest highlights of our trip. I'm not even sure where to start, but I'll give it a try:1) Diego, a very knowledgeable and personable sommelier who educated us on the various exquisite boutique wines at the tasting (which included extra brut, torrontes, bonarda (bet you never heard of that one before), syrah roble, and a malbec reserve);2) THE PORTIONS!!!! Generous portions, like I've never seen before, with optional refills (we got way more than our money's worth);3) The FOOD!! Each wine was paired with a different small bite. This included empanadas saltanas, humaita, assorted cheeses and more. Absolutely delicious and the different bites really did bring out the distinct flavors of each wine. The food was also generously portioned, and my boyfriend and I agree that the empanadas were the best we've ever had. You will leave the tasting more than satisfied -- this can either suffice as dinner or you should plan to eat a very late dinner many hours later (you will not leave hungry, I promise);4) The WINES!!!! I'm not an expert, but I know what I like, and these wines were damn tasty. So much so that we ordered a case and had it shipped to us in the U.S. -- it just arrived!!.All in all, it was a delightful time and a lovely tasting in a beautiful loft (don't be put off by the graffiti'd building exterior, the inside is spacious and beautiful!!) It was an educational, fun, and delicious experience!!! If you are in Buenos Aires, you MUST make a reservation!! I trust that someday we will be back in B.A., and when we are, we will most definitely return to Anuva.

A perfect evening of wine and food in the heart of Palermo. I came here with family because we didn't have time to visit Mendoza. And any thoughts of disappointment over that faded as soon as our evening began. We loved the wine, we loved the food and we loved our sommelier Kara. I even shipped a bottle of each back to the U.S. so I can share them with my friends in our own mini wine tasting. It was a fantastic evening, on of the highlights of our trip and I highly recommend spending a few hours in their loft, you won't be disappointed!

Wonderful experience! . Diego, the sommelier was very knowledgeable and interesting. Anuva specializes in boutique wineries & gives a great tasting for beginners & experts alike. The small food pairings were delicious & they even accommodated my veggie dietary restrictions. Diego was also helpful with information on the city. Thanks again!

Salute!!!. My husband and I were honeymooning in BA and attended the Anuva Wines, wine tasting in Palermo Soho. The loft was a very cool and intimate space. Our host and wine sommelier Diego was welcoming and friendly and extremely knowledgeable about Argentina and it's beautiful wines. The tasting included a variety of wines ranging from sparkling white to a robust Malbac. The food pairings were also delicious with many different options. We enjoyed the wine so much we had a case shipped back to New York. The price is very reasonable for such an awesome tasting!!! Gracias, to Anuva Wines for a memorable experience!! Catrina and Joseph DiPasquale Brooklyn, New York

Well-Done Wine Tasting. Lots of wine bars in BA, but this was the only real wine tasting we could find - and it wad a good one. The presenter was funny and knowledgeable: enough info for us wine geeks in the crowd, but enthusiastic and fun for others who want a more relaxing experience. The food pairings were delicious and they were generous with the pours. And the wine itself - really good. Small labels and varietals I wasn't familiar with. The tasting room is also very nice. They offered the wine for sale with shipment to the US; we did take advantage of the offer, but did not feel at all pressured to do so. You must contact them in advance for a reservation (though we only signed up one day in advance), but this is really worth it.

Great experience!. Our sommelier, Kara, was fun and knowledgable. The pours were generous (top ups each taste) and the food pairings were great. Highly recommend to wine lovers and those dabbling in the sport!

Expensive, but a great wine tasting experience. Anuva Wines has a monopoly on the wine tasting market in Buenos Aires. There is nothing else like it, so you don't really have a choice if it's something that you want to do. We tried to attend a wine tasting offered by a hotel in Palermo the night before, and it was canceled sometime during the 15 minutes that we were walking from our hotel to the wine tasting (our hotel had called ahead and made reservations). And some of the other places we called seemed to have a wishy washy answer as to what time the tasting was and whether or not they had space (if we "came now" they could fit us in but not sure about what time it would be the next day...). So, the only reliable place to taste wines is Anuva. Which is why they can charge $52 for a tasting.Everything here is conducted in US Dollars and they have a strict reservation requirement (which includes a $52 deposit per reservation). They also have a strict start time (since the other people in the group will be waiting on you if you are late). About the highest level of organization I came across while in Buenos Aires. Reservations are made online and a detailed confirmation email is sent out - make sure to read those directions carefully because it is hard to find (there is an unmarked black door; you need to push a button to have someone come down and open the door for you).Our 6 pm tasting included light bites as pairing that left us hungry for dinner immediately after, but not hungry enough for a large dinner.The loft and the pairing were lovely, and the sommelier was very knowledgeable. The tasting included a sparkling white, white, and 3 reds (with as many refills as you like, but be careful, as I got quite tipsy). LAS PERDICES Extra Brut (sparkling white) paired with a CrostiniMAREINA Torrontes (white) paired with strawberry and mango sorbetThe 3 reds are served together:MAREINE Bonarda - paired with a meat and cheese plateSAN GIAMIGNANO Syrah Roble - paired with a beef emapandaCARINAE FNCA DENEZA Malbec - paired with dark chocolateThe experience was great - the loft beautiful and everything presented well, BUT I did not love any of the wines. The sommelier seems to have "moved on " from Malbecs but for most of us, we have not yet moved on and probably would have liked to try more than one Malbec. We bought a couple bottles on his recommendation, but discovered we had been ripped off when we got to duty free (we paid $39 for a $22 bottle) so be careful of that. He recommended a dinner spot to us (Freud & Fahler) and said his friend would take care of us when we got there, but his friend didn't actually work there anymore. Oops. It was okay, but not great.So all in all, it was a fun experience that I enjoyed, but it didn't help me discover any new wines (or restaurants).

Great ambiance & nice wines!. We had a great time at Anuva and enjoyed their wines! They provide very generous pours (more than most American tastings) and even provide refills if you want for each one. The loft is lovely and decorated very charmingly. The sommelier was very friendly and knowledgable. The food was good, although I wouldn't call it gourmet. Overall, we had a good time, met some lovely fellow travelers, and liked the wines enough to have a case shipped home! (They do offer free shipping to the US if you get a full case - nice marketing technique, but well worth it for us!)

A hidden gem. When we arrived outside Anuva Wines, we and our driver thought we had gone to the wrong place. In fact, he phoned back to the office to verify the address, as the door gave no indication whatsoever of the business that lay behind it. The staff were welcoming and knowledgeable, the wines were glorious and the food pairings inspired. A little more chilled white wine would seem a sensible precaution as not everyone can cope with red wine - I have no problem, but my companion does and she should realistically have forewarned Anuva. They tried really hard to solve this issue, full marks to them.Alas, they have no trade with the UK so we couldn't ship wine home; instead we bought some bottles for consumption whilst still in Argentina (they slipped down effortlessly).This is not a place you can wander into and they don't advertise anywhere but they do have a Facebook page. Our travel agent knew about it, because she used to live in Buenos Aires, hence the booking.

Mendoza wines in Buenos Aires. We were bummed that logistics did not work out for us during our trip and couldn't make it to Mendoza. However, this was a great way to have Mendoza brought to us in Buenos Aires! The Sommelier Cara was quite fun, knew her wine and was excited to share her knowledge with us. The wine was great as was the tapas pairings. It was great fun to get to know other travelers and discuss the wine with them as well. We originally booked a time that no one else had and the staff at Anuva asked if we would like to switch to a time when others were available as well, we did and did not regret it. At the end they allow you to order their wines and others that they work with and have it shipped home or to take it with you. Unfortunately they do not have the other wines available to taste and you just have to order them based on your best guess. I can't wait to get our case and hope I guessed deliciously!

Great wines, fantastic pairings, and educational!. My wife and I recently enjoyed a great tasting experience at Anuva. The selection of wines and accompanying tasty treats were outstanding, and Cara did a fantastic job of educating our mind and our palates to the spectrum of Argentine wines. Certainly encouraged a visit to the Mendoza region where we might get lost for several days!!! :) A very engaging and fun experience that was one of the highlights of our visit, and we are now enjoying our selection of wines that were conveniently shipped back home to our doorstep.

Amazing Wine tasting. I loved my tasting at Anuva! Cara is very knowledgeable and personal and the wines were incredible. I ended up buying a box with free shipping in the US too. The food was excellent and the space very beautiful. Highly recommended!

Excellent stopover in BA. Learned a lot about wines from Mendoza, since we were unable to take the long trip to their vineyards. Anuva wine tasting provided a great overall experience that even my college aged children enjoyed. The staff was wonderful and knowledgeable, the place was clean and personable. The groupings were small and personable. The food was just right with the wine pairings, but the wines are the attraction that's worth the visit. Highly recommend it.

Great way to taste and learn about Argentinian wines. We really enjoyed the wine, tapas and people at Anuva. We ordered a case and it was shipped to us in the US for free. We will probably order more soon. It was a great experience and I highly recommend taking the time to schedule a tasting while in BA.

A truly wonderful experience.. The wine tasting we had at Anuva Wines was a truly wonderful way to learn more about Argentinian wines and culture. Our group was very small (only 3 in total) so we had a lot of personal attention from the sommelier, Diego. He was very passionate about the wines and made the experience very fun and interesting without any pretension. Make sure you don't miss this one when in Buenos Aires.

Wonderful in every way. Such an enjoyable evening. And the staff is excellent. I loved every part - the wine, the food, and all that you learn. Its worth every penny. You'll come away with a knowledge and appreciation of the Argentinian wines that is beyond value. I also ordered some wines to be shipped home to me. Now I get to enjoy delicious wines at home. This tasting night is an experience every visitors to BA should make.
excellent evening in BA. Wonderful way to learn about wine. Great food and wine. Highly educated staff. Great overall experience. Would highly recommend to another person visiting BA.
Excelent. A beautiful work, excellent wines, competent somelier.When in BA do not let go.Recommend with praise!

A fun experience. Two of us are in Buenos Aires for a week, rainy weather for a few days. I looked at suggestions on line for indoor events. We went to this wine tasting. It was one of our top 3 events of our trip, rain or shine. Excellent presentation bt Kara. Her knowledge as well as her personality were perfect for this tasting. 8 others at event. All Ifun and knowledgiable. Sharing wine knowledge as well as their travels. Put this as a must when you visit. Moly

Amazing wine experience in BA. Well, that was simply a brilliant experince. Amazing wine, Cara, the english expert, was nice, fun and knoweldgable. Small groups, delicious wine, lots of information and beautiful surroundings. Really nothing negative to say :)

Can't get to Mendoza? Come here!. We were on a short trip to Buenos Aires and our itinerary did not permit a trip to Mendoza. Anuva provided a wonderful introduction to the wines, serving five wines and pairing them with excellent "tapas". Our hosts were very knowledgeable and engaging. Don't be put off by the modesty of the black door entrance, the loft where you are served is spacious and airy. We enjoyed the afternoon there thoroughly.

Nice wines and informative presentation. I really enjoyed this wine tasting. Diego (the host) was really friendly and informative about the wines and the paired food. The wines combined with the food pairings were very delicious. Definitely worth a visit when you are in Buenos Aires!

Great experience. If you're looking for an informative and tasty experience, this is the place to go! The hosts spoke English, were very receptive and had great personalities. A large group of us came to this wine tasting and they were very accommodating. They even allowed us to add a person to the group at the last minute without issue. The wine presented was spectacular. They had a large variety of wines to purchase at the end of the presentation. But my favorite part was the food pairings they presented with the wines! TALK ABOUT DELICIOUS! I hope they publish recipes and pairings online because it was absolutely to die for.In summary - THEY ARE AMAZING!

Nice wines, questionable food pairing, steep price. The location is good, the hostess very friendly, the wines are adequate representations of good Argentinian wine making if not great compared to what I tasted in mendoza a few days later (but that's all taste, right). The paired food wasn't anything worth remembering with the exception of the torrontes (lovely wine in its own right) paired with two overly sweet sorbets, which I found horrible. It literally left a bitter taste in the mouth and the ice cream closed my taste buds for the wine that followed. Reading back on tripadvisor later it seems I am not the first to write in negative terms about the sorbet and wine pairing. Apparently they do not change the combinations much but in a tasting at a too steep price for Argentina (so aimed at north-American tourists, I presume) gourmets would probably find this below par. For me, the tasting just didn't recover after that

Fun and informative!. Thank you Anuva, I thoroughly enjoyed your wine tasting. All of the wines were excellent, the food pairings were delicious, and I feel that I learned so much. I decided to sign-up for the wine club (a really good deal, considering the shipping rates and the quality and variety of their boutique wines) I look forward to receiving them!

Great wine, great bites, friendly people. My boyfriend and I did this in the middle of the week with another couple and had a great time. It starts off with a brief talk about Argentine wine and goes into a tasting of 5 wines with food (a variety of tapas-like items) pairings. The food pairings are substantive enough that you won't need a very large dinner, if any, after. The wines were all interesting and mostly from relatively small production runs, and our tasting included a sparkling white, a white, and 3 reds. At the end, you can then order bottles of what you've tasted or any of the other bottles they currently have in their rotation (they will even ship them to you if you are in the United States). Was definitely a bit expensive ($50 per person) for those travelling on a budget, but is a fun and interesting splurge if you are interested in wine (and you can ask for as many refills of the glasses as you'd like, so on a per glass basis, you may even come out ahead). The people at our tasting were all very interesting travelers, and you have plenty of time to interact, so it is also a great way to meet some new people as well.

A great oportunit to taste wine and make friends. You will be presented to 5 different wines in a good place with more 13 persons. It takes almost 2 hours and all the presentation is made in english by a sommellier. Important : It has stairs and don't have elevator.

Fun times, great wine and great food!. From the minute our hostess, Kara, greeted us at the door, to the last drop of delectable wine, this was the perfect way to spend an evening in Buenos Aires. The food and wine pairings, as well as Kara's effervescent personality (reminiscent of the nice sparkling Hom that we sampled) created a fun, delicious, and enlightening evening. Coming into the evening with a limited wine knowledge was not a hindrance, as we learned enough fun facts to wow our friends (they may be more wowed by the presents they receive since we ordered a case!), but not too much to feel overwhelmed. A fun time was had by all!

Ok tapas and ok wines, but expensive for the quality. Just ok really. The tapas were simple and unusual for the wines - sorbet with a Malbec? The wines were all very young, and all had a similar flavour profile of maraschino cherries, which was unusual. To be honest, all the malbecs we have ordered in restaraunts have been better. At 100$ us per couple it's very steep for what you get. All in all, better off getting 2 high quality steaks and a 50$ Malbec in any local parilla , it's far better value.

Wine Tasting City Style. Can't make it to Mendoza? No problem! Anuva brings Mendoza to you right in Palermo, BA! Diego, our Wonderful host described each wine with food pairings. We walked around a bit before tasting to experience Palermo - great location! Make a reservation... You won't be disappointed!

Wonderful evening with Anuva. Last night a group of about twenty of us attended the Anuva wine tasting evening in Palermo. Our host Cara was fantastic. She was both knowledgable and engaging. Besides having a wonderful sense of humor, she has the balance just right between interesting information about the wines, the regions, the winemaking process and the profiles of each wine. All the time making the guests making feel very welcome and involvedA wonderful introduction to Argentinian wines, expertly delivered, in a warm and fun setting.

Excellent wine tasting in Buenos Aires!. I attended a wine tasting with Anuva last Saturday and I can really recommend it! I went by myself and it was really great - nice people, cool looking venue, the wines were excellent and also perfectly paired with food. The last Malbec was perfectly matched with dark chocolate :-) Our host Diego did a great job in explaining the different wines and answering all types of questions from his 9 guest this evening. We tried 1 sparkling, 1 white and 3 red wines and there were plenty of re-fills for those who wanted that. We even got to try an additional red Malbec that he had open at the very end.The event started at 5 PM and lasted for about 2 hours. All wines could be purchased and shipped, but there was no pressure to buy anything. (...but of course I needed to bring back some of that perfect Malbec :-D)As I have coeliac it was really appreciated that they had prepared gluten free food for me - even empanadas! Great wines, great service, great evening! :-)

Melbac and More. My husband and I had a wonderful evening at Anuva. Our sommelier and hostess Samantha was an absolute delight and her knowledge of wines was impressive. Can't wait for our case of Torrontés to arrive in the mail.

Great Wine Tasting Experience in Buenos Aires!. I really enjoyed my time at Anuva. I am not much of a wine drinker, so don't know much of it, but the experience as a whole is very nice!. I know that for people that are from Buenos Aires, like me, will sound weird to go and have these kinds of experiences, but price is not high, and the wine quality you get is pretty good, and the 5 different "tapas" are very good as well.. It only takes about 2hs, and you get to have a fun moment. If you do it in English, you will probably get Cara as you sommelier, and she is just great, funny and knowledgeable.. Definitely a must while in Buenos Aires!!

Fun and informative wine tasting with excellent food & wine. I attended this wine tasting last week, and thought it was amazing. There were only 8 of us there, which meant that we got a very personalized discussion of each wine and the food pairings from our host, Cara. I was attending on my own, but never felt awkward or left out. Those running the show clearly are invested in the overall experience for each guest.I was a little worried that I wouldn't be able to find the location, but the directions sent with my confirmation were very clear, and I was able to get there without a problem. They suggest taking a taxi, but you could as easily take the Subte and walk about 20 minutes from the closest station, or the 140 bus which runs along Cordoba and will get you within a block. The space itself is gorgeous--a light-filled loft in a beautiful neighborhood. Though the space is large, the set up still makes it feel cozy, almost like a dinner party with friends. The wines were fantastic. They are all from small wineries, so you're unlikely to have encountered any before. We tasted one sparkling, one white, and three reds (with refills on whatever you wanted to keep tasting). The food pairings were delicious, and the relationships between each food and wine were explained really well. I'm a vegetarian, and they easily accommodated this, even though I booked at the last minute. One final note: you can ship home any of the wines you tasted to the US (and I think Australia?). I had really wanted to bring wine home, but wasn't comfortable brining it in my luggage, so this solved the problem perfectly. And with wines that are unique, and that I now know the backstory of, which will be great for gifts, and putting in my own stock.

Excellent wines, food and evening. We tried the wine tasting on a Saturday night as a couple and we met 5 others there.Diego was a great host and very knowledgable about the wine regions, history of the wineries and the wines themselves. The tapas that accompanied the wines were excellent in their pairings and really helped us to understand some of the subtle differences of the wines. It's an excellent way to taste and learn about wines in a relaxed comfortable and non-pretentious way, whether it's your first or tenth tasting. We can't recommend this enough for anyone who likes wine.

wine wine wine. They were very generous with their wine and it we learned a lot about local wine and culture. Met some great people that we ended up stumbling to a restaurant with afterwards for dinner!

Amazing experience in Palermo. My friend and I attended this tasting in Palermo and absolutely loved it. It is a bit deceiving at first because the location is in a nondescript building with no signs. Truthfully that adds to the entire experience. Our host was amazing and the tastings were generous. One of the best parts is that you get to sit at a table with other travelers which allows you the opportunity to meet others. Overall, a great way to learn about Argentinean wines and have a good time.

Grape Fun!. We had a wonderful time at the Anuva Wine tasting event. Our host was really knowledgeable and chatty and pitched the session perfectly to our group. Good wines and good food (lots of it!)

Great wines. We went with a friend from out of town. We had an amazing time! I love the feel to the place. The wine is tasty! - I really liked the buttery taste of the malbec. Also, the staff are a bunch of great guys that are very passionate and full of wine knowledge as well as very generous with suggestions for local spots to try. Thank you!

Great experience. A friend from my Spanish School recommended this place to me. The experience was great. They have a really nice wines and the people there are very knowledgeable about them. I would recommended.

Learned a ton! Great host, wine & food.. A friend and I went since we wouldn't be getting out to Mendoza while in Argentina. Our host was excellent and brought great energy and knowledge to the tasting. All of the wines we tried were fantastic and the food pairings were quite nice. I would recommend this to wine novices and experts alike.

Really nice! Informative and fun!. I had just a wonderful time with my tasting. Cara was kind, knowledgable, helpful and a lot of fun. I have done many tastings before, but I really felt comfortable making comments, asking questions and taking my time with this one. I didn't ever feel rushed, and Cara even went out of her way to help answer questions I had about Buenos Aires. The only hiccup I had was in ordering (and I should know better by now as I live in S.America)...the shipping time/processing took longer than expected and because of that I haven't received them in the time I thought I would for my once a year visit to the USA. So please, factor in the extra processing time when ordering- even if you pay extra for the 2 day shipping, that's after processing. Overall, the value for the food, wine, knowledge and company is well worth it. Definitely give this a try on your visit to BA!

Good quality price ratio. Someone from my Spanish school recommended me anuva. I'll say that the experience was great, lots of different wines and information about them. The service was professional and friendly.

Fun and informative!. Cara, our host for the evening, made this event wonderful. The information was fascinating and helpful-- we learned about different grapes and terroirs, as well as some fun facts about the origins of malbec. The wines were great, and the food pairings were delicious. We are so glad we chose to go to Anuva!

How all wine tastings should be. This was fun, informal and a great way to taste wine with different tapas from Argentina. Cara was funny and made everyone at the table relax. It was a great way to end our trip. We highly recommend.

Very Tasty Wines. Diego and all the wines he poured for us were excellent. The tasting room was more a tasting loft with big windows and terrace outside. It was the perfect way to spend an evening after having explored the city all morning and afternoon.

Great host, good wine. My partner and I decided to try Anuva wines while we were in Argentina as we didn't have time to get to Mendoza. There were 8 people at the tasting and the host, Kara, did a fantastic job tonne everyone feel comfortable and have a good time. Kara was very knowledgeable but not over the top! The matched food was also lovely and Kara gave us good tips for exploring BA. worth a visit if you can't make it to a winery.

Fun afternoon of endless wine. We would have loved to go to Mendoza to visit some wineries, but it was too far away for this trip! Luckily our city tour guide told us about Anuva Wines, which offers wine tastings in their apartment in Palermo. After walking up their daunting staircase we found outself in a lovely light tasting area with the table ready for us. The wines we tried were not the best we tried in Buenos Aires, but a nice introduction to the local wine none the less. The food pairings worked well with the wines.

Informative and very fun!. We visited in early May and had a wonderful time! The information was disseminated in a very informal and inclusive manner. I was very much a beginner to wine tasting and was hesitant to go but I am very glad I did. Our hostess was Cara and she was excellent. We also had a small group of 6 so we all got to know one another which I felt added to the fun. If you are thinking about a wine tasting you will NOT be disappointed in Anuva. I would advise doing the tasting early in one's visit to Buenos Aires as the information provided at the tasting about other attractions, restaurants etc. in Buenos Aires was invaluable!

Great Wines, Great Experience. Anuva Wines is not just a wine tasting with great wines. Although it had SO MANY great wines! But the effort that they take to make sure that it's a pleasant experience, and not just an ordinary wine tasting is noteworthy. I made my reservation and when I said that I was solo, Erika offered and assured that she would change my date to make sure that there was a significant number of tasters so that I wouldn't drink alone. The sommelier's knowledge was extensive and the food pairings were complementary and just perfect in size and quality. (It was supposed to be a dinner!)Cara was a good conversationalist, and very good at getting audience participation to make the experience memorable. It became much more of a pleasant sharing experience with the other tasters than any wine tasting I've attended. The long, long flight up the stairs was totally worth it.
Wine tasting. We thoroughly enjoyed our night at Anuva - interesting food, good wines and Cara led the tasting in a chatty, informative manner. We would warmly recommend.
So soboring. Not up to our expectations. Wines were not exceptional. The tapas nibbles were small and average. There are better ways of discovering Argentine wines

Amazing Experience!!!. It was outstanding to know this highly recommended wine distributor in US and Australia. The wine tasting sessions was very fun and enjoyable; we got to know the best wines in Argentina - always from small bodegas (you know, small are exclusive) with very exquisite, extravagant wines. The tasting lounge is a very fancy place indeed where we could spend quality hours with best wines, best food to harmonize - and as a gift we met new friends.Our "wine guide" Cara was very funny and thoughtful person, we really enjoy the few hours with her. really worth a visit - and also the wine takeaways!

One word: Boozey. We're from Australia and are accustomed to wine tastings. In Australia normally you get a small sample of the wine and can spit it out in a spittoon if necessary. This is not the case at the wine tasting by Anuva. We sampled a couple of white wines and a couple of red wines. A small tapas meal is provided with each wine. Personally speaking, I did not really like the wines and wanted to spit mine out. However there was nowhere to do this and I didn't want to be rude by not drinking the wine. Your wine glass gets repeatedly topped up so it is more of a booze-fest than a "tasting". My partner really enjoyed his wines and had no problems with the supply of wine... :)The food provided with the wines match the wines really nicely. The service was fantastic and the staff were very knowledgeable. By the end of the tasting I was pretty drunk and ended up feeling really unwell from the wine. If you book this wine tasting be prepared for quantity not necessarily quality. You definitely get value for your money.

wonderful intro to argentinian grapes/wines. after living in buenos aires for a month, i was excited to do a tasting with anuva wines because i wanted to know more about the wines of argentina. it delivered very well on that - i felt like our sommelier, diego, was very knowledgable and provided a great overview of the wines, the grapes and the regions where most wine is made in argentina. they were very generous in serving a lot of wine (most people got seconds of each wine if they wanted it and thirds and fourths were offered too!) the food pairings were great. very good way to learn a bit about argentinian wines, particularly the great ones you won't find in many of the wine shops or that you have to look a bit more for when you eat at a parilla go to the wine store.

Enjoyable and Relaxing Tasting!. One of the more enjoyable and informative tastings I've been to. The tasting room was a beautifully decorated loft with lots of light and comfortable large wooden tables for us to sit around. Our group of 4 was joined by another couple which made the experience all the more fun as they gave us plenty of free time to chat amongst ourselves both during and after the tasting. Our guide Diego was extremely gracious and you could tell from his wealth of knowledge that he was a very experienced sommelier. The wines that were chosen ranged from a sparkling white to a signature Torrentes to 3 different reds, one of which (Bonarda) was quite memorable with its spicy, peppery flavor; each paired perfectly with delicious tapas and unbelievably tasty sorbets and chocolates. The pours were generous and the information never felt scripted as Diego really made an effort to engage us with our questions and comments. Overall a great experience. Would definitely go back again!

Fun, informative and great value. We booked this wine tasting on a day when practically all of Argentina was on strike, so we were first of all quite happy that they were even open. There was a group of 7 of us there, all eager to try some great wines and have some fun. Between us we were generously served about 12 bottles of 5 different varieties of hard to find Argentinian wines, along with brilliantly matched foods. We were informed about the wines, regions, food matching and everything else we could possibly want to know in great detail and all had a great time. They then recommended a couple of wine bars around the corner for us to continue our night, and we all happily obliged!

Great wine tasting and fantastic group event. A group of 10 of work friends booked the wine tasting at Anuva and we all had a great time. The staff was fantastic and the quality of the wines was very good. This tasting is a great way to learn about the local wines and have a fun event at the same time.

Great experience in Palermo. I had an amazing time at the Anuva wine tasting. The location was right in the middle of Palermo, and the space was open and inviting. We sampled 5 different wines, 2 whites and 3 reds. The host did an amazing job describing the wines and the regions they came from. She had great energy and made for a fun evening. I would definitely go back again!

Christmas wine tasting. We were in Buenos Aires on Christmas Day and found that, unsurprisingly, a great many of the usual attractions (museums, historical sites, restaurants, etc.) were closed. What to do on a major holiday in a foreign city? We ran across the Anuva Wines name on-line and found that they had wine tastings scheduled, despite the fact that it was a major holiday. We submitted our request for a reservation mere hours before the tasting began and received a prompt e-mail confirmation.A couple of hours later, we were in a taxi, looking for the mysterious unmarked door in the Palermo district that led to the Anuva loft. We found the correct street number and the door, rang the bell and waited. It all felt very cloak and dagger, like something out of a novel or a movie. But once inside, we got a completely different vibe.The staff of Anuva are warm and friendly. The ambience is sort of an upscale industrial chic. The decor and layout of this place remind me of the loft apartment of a successful 20- or 30-something urban professional. We found ourselves seated around one of three large wooden tables, with a varied group of other travelers from around the world.But what about the wine? Well, I'm glad you asked, because it was excellent. Anuva features mostly lesser known boutique wines from around Argentina. We didn't see most of the brands they offered in the many wine shops we visited around Buenos Aires. And, like smaller wineries and breweries in the US, many of these labels are clearly overlooked gems. Too small to get major distribution (yet), Anuva has picked them up and is starting to market them to an international audience.Diego, our sommelier for the afternoon, was a knowledgeable and fun tour guide. There were five wines, each paired with different types of tapas, from meats and cheeses to empanadas to dark chocolates. They offer generous pours and will top you off mutliple times with your favorite wines. The variety of wines was intriguing too, as we went beyond the Malbec that makes Argentina famous and looked at several whites and a red blend or two as well. We had a wonderful experience and ordered several bottles to be delivered to us back in the US when we returned home. There is no high-pressure sales pitch, but a price list of the items we sampled was offered at the end.This was a nice Christmas present that we gave ourselves.

Mysterious wine tasting in Palermo SOHO, Buenos Aires. So the mystery starts when you try to book. Just where this interesting wine-tasting concept is located is not revealed until you pay for your visit. Even then, address in hand, it can be hard to find this well- disguised location. Although one of our group was frustrated iabout the hunt, I found it all part of the elan. This venue by a Portland, Oregon, man who visited Argentina and met his wife and co-owner, is intriguing in its mysteriousness. I guess the absence of signage allows for only those who are interested enough to pay for the experience to be admitted. Indeed, the ten of us who tasted that late afterrnoon all seemed much more than casually interested in wine and learning more about the esoteric boutique wines of Argentina.Our host Diego seemed as well versed in the wines he was showing as enthusiatic sales room denizens in other parts of the wine world. He was geneorus in his pours and not reserved in asking if folks wanted more of what he was pouring. He was sly in pouring one Malbec from a freshly opened bottle, then when retrieving more of the same wine that he had decanted earlier. Our fellow quaffers noted its improved nose. It was a great "aha" when he revealed why the wine seemed to have changed so quickly. We tried a sparkling wine made with Chadonnay but also Chenin Blanc grapes (a new blend for me). We then enjoyed a tasty Torrontes from La Salta, and then a Bonarda--an interesting new grape for me and I will need to learn more about it to love it. Then we were offered a Malbec roble from Maipu--Sangiminano (NOT vernaccia). I thought this was the star of the tasting. We ended with a Carinae Riserva Malbec. Each wine was paired with perfect tapas accompaniments ranging from lucious sorbets and truffles made of chocolates from Venezuela and Ecuador to lovely domestic cheeses and charcuterie, and even an empanada. These foods showed the wines, as you would bet, in the very best light. These pairings really established the value proposition for the Anuva tasting. Our group of four would go back in a heartbeat. The fact that case lots are delivered free in the US was also a great bargain, enhancing the decently priced selections.

Fun and Informative Wine Tasting. Such a fun afternoon. Diego ran this tasting and was informative and funny and professional. We had a nice group, tapas well well presented, pours were extremely generous. Well worth the price of the admission. Beautiful loft space in Palermo. Would do this again. Would like to try the dinner tasting next time. Well done!

If you want to go to a wine tasting, this is the place to do it.. This was one of the best experiences I had during my stay in Buenos Aires. All the wines tasted are boutique wines. The pairings were perfect. Our host was both knowledgable and funny. It was an intimate setting with a small group. Worth every penny. My boyfriend wasn't much of a wine lover, but this experience converted him. Highly recommended. They also have a wine club that ships to the U.S. which is great if you fall in love with these hard to get wines.

Fun experience!. My friend and I kicked off our arrival to Buenos Aires with a wine tasting at Anuva. We reserved online and didn't have problems finding the place (read your confirmation email for directions). There were three tables of about eight people in a loft and it was definitely full that night (6pm reservation). Cara was our wonderful and energetic host and we sampled five different wines (small wineries with limited production) with food pairings. Multiple pours were available and generous. Food was delicious but not enough for a meal. There was no pressure to purchase the wines and they were reasonably priced ($20/bottle; free shipping if you purchased a case which could be mixed and matched). Overall, a great and fun experience!!

An intro to Argentina's wines. Great time. Was seated at a table of 9 for a 5- wine tasting with appetizer food pairings. The hostess, Cara, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. Had a really fantastic time meeting fellow travelers and learning about/drinking the wine. Definitely a great way to start an evening.

Yes! You can't go wrong there!. The only somewhat "disappointing" comment up-front: you will NOT get to try the most expensive argentinian wines there. So you will still have to buy these icon bottles yourself :-)BUT, this is in no way any criticism, because Anuva will take you a VERY long way for the budget they are charging. Actually they are providing a very honest value.The wines they showcased were deffinitely "the good stuff" and are good value.The food accompanying the wines is of surprisingly good quality, too.What made our evening however was a very energetic young lady from the UK, who was not only real fun, but was a thorough proffessional who knew her stuff.When she started off I was a bit suspicios, because she seemed to be overdoing things. I realised however quite quickly that she is simply very extrovert and that she's actually being herself. In that moment I relaxed and let her do her magic. She was not only fun and charismatic, but also extremely informative in every aspect.My wife and I loved the whole experience and especially that UK lady!

A hidden treat in Palermo!. Fantastic afternoon! Our Sommelier, Diego, was a great host and very knowledgeable…..he really made the experience and even gave us some great info for travels to Mendoza. The wine was excellent and the food pairings were perfect. We were lucky we had the whole place to ourselves. This was a terrific way to start our afternoon on Valentine's Day. Highly recommended!!

Great wine tasting. Fun evening trying 5 different Argentine wines with great food pairings. Not enough to make it your dinnner, so plan on eating after. Good atmosphere too - not too much pressure to buy bottles. We met a few other couples at our table and ended up going to a nearby bar afterwards.

Wines of Buenos Aires introduction. Sandra Gutrejde of www.batravelguide.com arranged this wine tasting event. As with all of her recommendations, this one was terrific. Diego not only was a gracious host; he encouraged all of his guests to learn about Argentinian wines as well as to understand how the tapas interrelated with the varietals. The whole experience was that of a glorious house party. We enjoyed it so much that we shipped a case of wine home.

Great Wines, Service and Knowledge!. We were unable to go to the wine region of Mendoza, as our time was short in Buenos Aires.It was wonderful that Anuva Wines was recommended to us by another guide. Diego and Samantha were wonderful hosts and we were able to experience a variety of the Argentinian wines. We live in in the Napa Valley, California and wine is an important part of our life. I was truly impressed by their knowledge and their willingness to share it with us. The food was an added plus. We were able to ship a mixed case of the lovely wine home. Thank you, Anuva.Cheers and Adios..

Great Experience. We went to Anuva Wines Tastings and the experience from the start to the end was really good. Nice place to discover some boutique argentine wines with high quality. Very kind staff with lot's to teatch about the grapes and details of the argentine wine industry.

Great atmosphere and wines!. Because we weren't going to be in the wine country at all I was happy we found Anuva Wines in the city as it was a first class setup for a tasting. First, the room is very quaint and Diego made the experience a great one with his knowledge of Argentinian wines, endless answering of questions and generous pours. All of the wines were very nice and the pairings perfect as they truly were well thought out to bring out the characteristics of the wines. I would recommend this to anyone who loves wine and wants to know more about the great wines in Argentina. We also met some great people and had a ton of fun socializing. We are excited that our wine just shipped and can't wait to break some open!

What was a plan B in Buenos Aires became a must!. I actually went to Anuva because I couldn’t include on my travelling plan a trip to Mendonza, or any other wine region in Argentina. What was originally a plan B, actually became one of the most interesting things I made while in Buenos Aires.It doesn’t matter if you’re a wine expert or just a casual drinker as myself, the degustation is suitable for every level. Really well organized and well guided by your host and located on an extremely comfortable and cosy setting.The wines are very, very good and they allow you to go around Argentina in 6 bottles. Another great plus is that every wine is combined with an Argentinian delicacy taking this tasting to a whole other level.I definitely recommend it.

Fun but expensive. We had a great afternoon at this place, learned about the wines and had some nice nibbles. I just would have liked there to be bigger servings....for the amount you pay you could buy MANY bottles of lovely Argentinian wine! The food was good but again just too small. I would recommend it but don't expect to feel full or tipsy afterwards. The area it's in is lovely - worth a walk around before or after.

A great activity to do in BA. The wine tasting at Anuva Wines was a great way to spend an afternoon in Buenos Aires. Our host was very knowledgeable about the wines of Argentina and we were able to sample some great champagne, white wine and red wine. The wines came paired with some delicious small plates. Our host gave us recommendations for wines at the restaurants we'd made reservations at, and his advice also helped us pick out some great wines at the airport. A great experience and well worth a visit.

Relaxing and Informative Experience. Cara was a fantastic "wine guide"! She was extremely knowledgable about every wine we tasted, and also just wine in general. The space was great as well. Modern and intricate, yet intimate. The food pairings were some of the best food we had on the trip! My girlfriend really wanted to tour wineries in Mendoza, but we were unable to get there. With this option, we really felt as if we had gone. Great assortment of wines, and very much worth the price. Hard to find though - just a plain black door!

A great afternoon. My husband and I really enjoyed the wine tasting event at Anuva a few days ago. Cara led the tasting in a relaxed but informative few hours. We were introduced to wines that we would not have tried otherwise and the food pairings offered with each wine enhanced the experience. The price was very reasonable for the quality. I would definitely recommend.

Great Experience!. A great way to taste a variety of wines from Argentina paired with tapas. Our sommelier and host, Diego, was very friendly, knowledgeable and the pairings were wonderful.I would recommend this to anyone looking for a unique experience in Buenos Aires.

Worth it! . This was one of my favorite things we did in BA. I learned do much and I actually retained the information. Kara explained everything so well and she delivered her presentation in a fun and entertaining way. The wine and food pairings were brilliant. It was really wonderful and so worth the money!

Wonderful Experience at Anuva Wines. My husband and I decided to do the wine tasting at Anuva Wines for our anniversary. It was an amazing experience from beginning to end. Everyone at Anuva Wines was extremely friendly, professional, attentive, and knowledgeable. There were many more people at the tasting than I had expected yet it was still so personal. The wine was absolutely delicious with generous pours and refills. The food was also amazing. They even were able to provide me with a vegetarian empanadas as a last minute request. It was also a great way to meet other people. I can not recommend Anuva Wines enough and would definitely go back.

Outstanding Experience!!!!. I am not much of a wine drinker but I really enjoyed the anuvo wine tasting. My wife made the arrangements for us to attend. If you are not able to visit mendoza this tasting is a good way to not only sample Argentine wines but also enjoy.

Great way to taste wines if you can't get to Mendoza. From the moment Cara greeted us we knew we were in for a treat! She led us through the wine tastings with a relaxed yet informative manner that made the entire experience very fun and personal. There is no pressure to buy but if you do the prices are very reasonable - especially the shipping within the US. If you have a few hours and enjoy wine, this is a must in BA!

amazing experience. Ive been to Anuva wines 2x and I would go again - the wines are amazing - the ambiance is beautiful. I was lucky enough to have the Owner Daniel Karlin as our wine host - he knows his stuff!! the stuff.... WOW friendly and very attentive (very unheard of in BA) HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Great way to socialize. Diego, our sommelier was a highly knowledgable and super funny. But, the best part about Anuva is the environment (how effectively they create a relaxed, social setting). Yes, you get to taste some great wines (and learn a bit along the way... Whether or not you remember much is up to you...), and you may even buy a little vino (you probably will...), but these folks do a great job all around. Recommend.

Wines were delicious but the host made the experience. I booked Anuva for my first day in Argentina and it was a great introduction to BA. Our host, Samantha, has a degree in the field and was extremely knowledgeable about the wines, the vineyards they came from, and the business of producing and shipping wine around the world. Samantha was as detailed as we wanted her to be: the tasting was informative but also accessible. It was a pleasure to learn from her.We tried two white, one rose, and three red wines. Each was produced in Argentina (some Mendoza; some not) and each is not available internationally; many were not even available in restaurants and wine shops in Buenos Aires. They gladly poured more of any wine we especially enjoyed, and paired all the wines with appetizers. (They are correct when they say it's not a meal but you won't be disappointed with the appetizers.) The group was about eight, with a couple from the US, a family from Europe, a solo traveler from Australia, and me.I had a case of the wine sent home and I know others did as well. Anuva also offers wine clubs and you can order most (if not all) their wines from the USA and some from other locations as well.I can't end the review without commenting on the beautiful space -- a well-decorated private loft in the trendy Palermo neighborhood, just a few minutes' walk from Plaza Serrano. Like many businesses, this started out in someone's home before expanding into its own dedicated space. Highly recommended.

Great time at Anuva. I discovered Anuva Wine tasting on the web while preparing for a trip to South America. The reviews we positive so we gave it a try. WHAT A TREAT. The location was near our hotel and we were warmly greeted led upstairs to a nice bright room. There were two tables of six and we had a nice mix at our. Tomaso did a great job in presenting the flight and the food parings were noteworthy. There is no sales pitch (I finally had to ask for a price list). We meandered through the nice neighborhood and stopped for dinner before heading to the hotel. A must do when in Buenos Aires.

One of the BEST international travel events we EVER booked!. I cannot say enough about how AMAZING the Anuva Wine Tasting was!My husband and I were traveling to B.A. for a week, but would not have time to got to Mendoza (the wine country of Argentina), so I was looking for a way to bring the wine country to us... could not have done better!5 courses that to us, were the perfect size. Every item on the tasting was excellent and very enjoyable and really did compliment the wine. 2 of the other guests at our table had dining restrictions (vegetarian & lactose intolerant) and had let Anuva know in advance, and were pleasantly surprised when special food items were brought out so that they were accommodated and could try the same wines with us.Our host was British, but had lived in B.A. for years and had a degree in this field. She was knowledgeable, personable, and friendly. Her presentation was interesting and moved along beautifully. She even had visual aids!We were also able to converse with other guests which was great fun and really enjoyable.The wines were excellent, from boutique vineyards & original, and learning about them really made us enjoy them all the more. The information provided helped us identify what it was we were liking about a wine, a useful tool for the rest of our B.A. visit as every restaurant seems to have an extensive wine list.At the end they give you an option to buy wines... I read other reviews about this, but please know that from our side we did not find it pushy AT ALL. We were grateful to have an opportunity to orders wines for ourselves and as gifts and to have them shipped back to us in the States at unbelievable prices. I even joined their wine club when I got back to the States as I really feel after the experience, that I can trust both their selections and the quality.My husband and I kept saying the rest of the trip that we could have booked the Anuva wine tasting for every night of our stay, and both fully agree that it was one of the best events we ever booked in all of our travels.

Private and Comfortable Wine Tasting Experience. I love wine and had a day to myself on my vacation since my niece had to work, so what better way to spend a few hours of my day. It was interesting to find the black entryway door and ring the doorbell to enter. The steps led to a beautiful loft where I was greeted by Cara and made to feel at home. With only 4 other people there, it was such a personalized experience. I never felt like I was by myself because Cara, who shared her expertise about the white wines, and Diego, who spoke about the red wines made you feel at home. Also, the other people at the tasting were so friendly. You don't have to know a lot about wine to come to this tasting, whether you just started learning about wine or are a wine geek. Also, they served such a variety of food pairings, from cheeses and sausage to sorbet. There was no pressure to buy any wine after the tasting, but since they shipped the wine to your home, I took advantage of that.

‘Educational & enjoyable wine tasting experience in a private friendly setting’. A very warm welcome by the host Cara at a non-descript black door leading up to a beautiful loft. Cara made it feel as though she’d invited a few of her best friends over for a wine tasting. The wines were superb and the food matching perfect, all prepared on the premises. I certainly benefited from Cara’s encyclopaedic knowledge of wine in general and Argentine wines in particular. Educational for those like me who appreciate wine but lack a broader knowledge. Very pleasurable experience.

Great, fun experience. The setting is intimate and the people were all friendly. Cara is a great wine enthusiast! We we're able to try great wines and the food was simple but with great pairings. This isn't a destination, so plan on eating before or after the event.

Best wine tasting yet. Anuva wines was a great experience. I have been to a few other wine tasting events in the city and this one was by far the best. The staff was friendly and professional, the wine was tasty and I love that they have a shipping service. No longer will I be burdened with multple wine bottles in my bags when I fly home to the US to visit. From now on I will just send the bottles directly to my destination ;).

Great wine tasting Buenos Aires. Saw reviews on tripadviser and booked before we left to go on holiday - excellent communication when booking and as I had enquired about restaurants in Buenos Aires they gave us a list they recommended with location and type of food (we went to Spiro which was excellent). Got a taxi there so found the black door with no problem. The loft is very stylish and comfortable. Host was very knowledgable and funny. Wine and food were excellent with plenty of offers for top ups after tasting the 6 wines. Opportunity to buy wines but no hard sale (don't ship to Uk). About 16 people at two large tables. Had a great evening and would recommend. Host even came out onto the street and hailed a taxi for us!

The next best thing to flying to Mendoza..... Even though we were a week in BsAs, we had booked fully into a hotel. Therefore, flying out to Mendoza was not an option. Instead, we spent a wonderful afternoon at Anuva Wines, tasting and learning about Argentinian wines with Cara. At first we were a bit skeptical as our wine-tasting-table-mates seemed quiet and reserved... not us, by any means! However, Cara and her energetic, bubbly personality, ease, and genuine interest in the wines and our experience, soon had us all giving our opinions and opening up, just like the 5 wines we tasted. The food pairings were perfectly matched to bring out the subtle nuances of each wine. Although some have remarked the portions were small, our tasting started at 3, so it was a perfect snack amount. We learned a lot about the wine region, some history of BsAs, and, of course, wine!It was a fun afternoon, and we came away with more wine knowledge and 2 cases of wine (shipped free!)
great wine experience in buenos aires. great way to mingle and get to know the wine culture in buenos aires. food was delicious. Ordered a case of wine to ship back to the usa. highly reccomend it

Great experience. We a are wine drinkers but not wine experts. We loved the night Anuva planned for us. The wine was great, the food was fantistic (although I'd liked to have more) and host was very knowledgeable. She walked us through the tasting and pairing processes. We ended up ordering a few bottles as souvenirs.

Disappointing.... We had a bit of a hard time finding Anuva. There was no sign outside, just a non-descript black door. The staff buzzed us in...guess that kind of adds to the mystery and charm. The interior was bright, modern and attractive.Our presenter Sarah was friendly and accommodating, but honestly, she wasn't all that knowledgeable. Full disclosure, we are wine producers. But we made that clear when we booked our reservation. We should have been provided with a staff member who had more wine experience.Some cheese and light fare were served with the tasting, but we felt the price was WAY too high (and we are in the business!). The wines offered were modest, and the food...not much. For a charge of $48 per person, we found the experience just plain disappointing.

Excellent Wine Tasting. I went to a wine tasting with Anuva while visiting Buenos Aires. I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting especially those who don't have time to visit the Mendoza region while in Argentina. We had a lovely afternoon with a very knowledgable host, Kara, who made us feel welcome and relaxed. We tried 5 very generous measures of different wines all of which were paired with different foods to enhance the flavours of the wine. The wines and food were excellent, we were offered refills of any wines we particularly enjoyed and there was no sales pitch to get you to buy wines afterward. I did buy some wine as it was such great wine and Kara was even able to tell me how much wine I could bring back to the UK. A great experience I highly recommend!!

Awesome Buenos Aires Experience. Our group of 15 went to Anuva for a tasting with tapas last week. The presenter, Soledad, did an amazing job explaining the wines and the regions they come from. The food pairings were delightful. This winery is wise enough to know one can only experience the true nature of a wine when it's consumed with the food it was designed to be enjoyed with!

Good wines, great pairings. My mom came to visit me while I'm studying in Buenos Aires, and I wanted to bring her to a nice wine tasting. Anuva Wines had good reviews, so I booked with them, and I was not disappointed. The wines were pretty good, having been in Buenos Aires for a while I had found other better wines, but what I really loved were the pairings. Beautifully done, excellent taste combinations, and let's not forget how delicious everything was! Our "wine guide", Kara, was fantastic and gave off an air of friendliness as well as knowledge. If you are in Buenos Aires for a short period of time and want to have a really nice experience getting to try some good but relatively unheard of wines, this is definitely the place to go.

Best Wine Tasting!!!. I have done SEVERAL wine tastings over the years but the tasting we did with Anuva Wines was the best. Daniel and his team were awesome!!! The wine was exceptional and the food pairings were delicious. Great job, Daniel!

Not a positive experience. This was just not a very positive experience. Of course, I had fun with my friends and colleagues, but we would have had fun anywhere. The owner was our guide for the day. He was very brusque, rude, cocky and impatient. He made it very well-known when we walked in that he was doing us a favor. It was slightly awkward, nevertheless, we commenced our tasting. It is not necessary to get into specifics, but he was quite insulting to a very congenial group of university academics who were nothing but fun-loving and yes, maybe a bit chatty. The disrespect he should was embarrassing. It was a little bizarre when he told one woman to put her water glass down like she was a child and scolded another for picking up their wine glass. There are ways to tell people things. This left us excruciatingly uncomfortable. This does not seem to be the case when reading the reviews with the other guides. And therefore, for this portion of our experience, I'd say just make sure one of the others lead you through the tasting. As for the rest of the experience, I'd give it three stars. It was oh kay. We did learn some, but truthfully, I felt more than a tad bit like we were at a timeshare presentation. Later on in my BA visit, I went to fine wine shops and they had different takes on some of the information dispensed at the tasting. $52 US is definitely too high for what you get as well. Maybe we would have felt more justified had we not been treated so bizarrely and poorly. There are some amazing wine shops who can give you lots of knowledge (granted they may not have the wine tasting portion), but I would sift through and see if you can find other options that may feel a bit less like your being sold something super unique when there's lots of unique wine in the area.

Great Way to start a Buenos Aires Vacation. We arranged a wine tasting with Cara on the afternoon of our arrival (following a 10 hour overnight flight). There is no better way to ease into the lifestyle of Buenos Aires. We were served 6 excellent wines, treated to delicious food pairings and enjoyed the bright personality of Cara. I wish she could have been our food and wine tour guide for the entire trip. Her informative discussion and quick wit put smiles on all our faces. I cannot thank Anuva enough for starting our vacation with a bang!

What a great way to spend an afternoon!. We were excited to find this opportunity because we wanted to learn more about Argentine wines. Although we flirted with going to Mendoza during our stay in Argentina, we just didn't have the time...so we enjoyed a delightful afternoon at Anuva Wines. Cara, our guide, was informative and entertaining. We feasted on amazing hors d'oeuvres and drank generous glasses of wonderful varieties of wine. I highly recommend this activity during your stay in Buenas Aires.

Fun, educational and plenty of quality wines. An older couple where I was staying in BA recommended this wine tasting evening. Best advice I took whilst in Argentina. I learned a lot about the history of the Argentinean wine industry and grape varieties (note - the Malbec is the best in the world but they have great whites as well). The whole evening was really well run with numerous tastings and score cards provided so you could keep track. I ended up buying a bottle at the end of the evening for a song - I cannot remember the name of the grape/ winery but I will always remember the smoked bacon on the nose.

Must do at beginning of trip!. I came across Anuva wines while searching for activities to do in Buenos Aires online. I noticed on their site that they recommend that guests visit at the beginning of their trip because they love giving recommendations for restaurants and activities. This was the best decision I made.We scheduled a tasting for our first full day and it did not disappoint. The wine and food pairings were awesome and the portions were perfect. Daniel was super knowledgeable and willing to dish out anything we wanted to know about Argentina and their wines. He even had a list of his favorite restaurants in the city. We went to at least 5 of his spots and each was better than the next. His printout became our bible when visiting places and ordering food. We enjoyed our tasting so much that we ordered a case of wine to be shipped home! Dan even helped us pick out some different varieties we didn't get a chance to try based on our preferences. The case of wine was delivered perfectly packed and we can't wait to reminisce about our trip with these wonderfully delicious wines.I highly recommend adding Anuva Wines to your itinerary while in Buenos Aires!

Terrific primer on Argentine wine. We had a marvelous introduction to the scope of Argentine wines, thanks to Cara and Tomas. First, the selections they presented were unique and each was pared with a tasty tapa. Secondly, they each have insights on the vineyards themselves as well as the history of Argentine wine development. What a super way to spend an afternoon - learn and enjoy!

If you can't get to Mendoza...... The wine tasting put on by Anuva was excellent. We loved it ! Not only were the featured wines great but we enjoyed listening to all the information shared with us. Our hostess, Cara, is passionate about Argentinian wine, of which we knew very little. The tapas was great (complimented the wine) and the wine tasting area was very comfortable. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful wine tasting!. I went to Anuva Wines for a wine tasting and absolutely loved it! The wines were delicious, the space was super luminous, and the hostess was sweet and made the whole presentation very exciting. I definitely recommend it to anyone who is in Buenos Aires and loves wine!

Great introduction to Argentinian Wines. I was with my wife and two daughters 16 and 23 and we all really enjoyed ourselves at the wine tasting evening. It was the start of our week in BA and we knew very little about Argentinian wine so was the ideal opportunity to understand what to choose. The tapas were wonderful and certainly sufficient without spoiling our dinner. Great variety of wine including a very good sparkling white wine which we were't expecting. The whole experience was very informal, interesting and relaxed and the only disappointment was that they didn't ship to the UK.

"Great Experience". Argentina is famously known for its wines and I was anxiously looking for a place to do some taste testing. i didn't have time to leave Buenos Aires and head to the vineyards. I was happy when I discovered the Anuva tasting in the heart of Palermo. Six different wines, paired with different appetizers. The pours are more than generous and the food was just enough to support the wine but not enough to ruin dinner. Poppy was pleasant and very knowledgeable. We had a nice cozy group of people and we all enjoyed the flowing wine. I fully recommend this bubbly break to the day.

For us, we would not recommend to our friends. While we found Poppi, the person leading our wine tasting to be knowledgeable, we left Anuva with a "bad feeling".Yes, they do offer a fairly generous pour during the actual tasting.
