But as others have pointed out, the tapas are small (but we've done many wine tastings in California wine country and that is pretty typical). I will say, for the quality of wine you get, it is pricey. The Cakebread food/wine tasting is $45/person, and $20/person for wine club members), and what they served were no Cakebreads... The experience itself is nice. My partner and I were at a table of eight. As it turned out, 4 couples, all from the US. (one couple was a pair of college students studying abroad in Buenos Aires, so they were significantly younger than the other three couples). The way the wine tasting is done, it was very relaxing, almost like a get together with friends.After the wine tasting was officially over, they did do their "pitch" for their wine club and other wines they sold, which again was ok. What we did not understand and frankly, no on in the group understood was, why they would not let us drink a bottle of wine my partner and I purchased. On the one hand, they kept coming back to the table telling us to take our time and asking us if we wanted refills. On the other hand, when we asked them to serve us the bottle we bought, they told us they had another tasting coming in soon (well, they have three, probably more empty tables, we only occupied one table so we didn't know why that should force us out--they were also turning out the lights, which led us to believe they wanted to go home, and there was not another group coming in) and so we didn't have time to drink it. One bottle poured to the six of us would have been consumed fairly quickly!!! Not to mention we all stayed there at least another 20-30 minutes after they refused to open our bottle. And, when I asked for refills, of course the wine I wanted wasn't available. The three older couples continued our festive ways and continued on to another bar. We all discussed how it made no sense not to allow us to drink our bottle--they just didn't seem genuine about their "stay as long as you want and drink more if you want" message. We all agreed, don't tell us to take our time and ask us if we want refills, but at the same time, then not let my partner and I drink a wine we bought that we wanted to share with the group. It definitely made us question how sincere these people were, or if it was all lip service.We did order six bottle recently from Anuva. This was because the Sommelier at Aramburu recommended the wine and said the pricing was fair. We haven't opened a bottle yet, so it will be interesting to see what we think of the wine. It's unfortunate our experience left us with a bad feeling about the place. We wanted to like it, but actions speak louder than words, and their actions were definitely strange!!!

Great experience! A must do!. This was the PERFECT way to try great wine from true boutique wineries in Argentina! I booked this tasting after reading reviews online and was not disappointed! The staff was so nice, polite, gracious and truly helpful in making some great recommendations for food and entertainment for the rest of our visit in Buenos Aires. I don't speak Spanish and this was not a problem at all. We loved the pairings and the tasting! I went with a friend that does not drink and he had a great time, enjoying the food, the other people we were seated with and the knowledge of the wine presented. I did taste the wine and bought a case to bring home--it was that good! You try a sparkling, a white, and three reds. All delicious!

Great time with Anuva. We had a great time at the Anuva loft in the middle of Buenos Aires! The hostess Poppy was wonderful and the pairings were divine. We learned a lot on the wines of Argentina and go a good idea of the different wines they produce. It was a great experience and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Worth the price and the time! Thanks Anuva! Regards. M

Fun night. Did the tasting with Cara, who was knowledgeable and fun. Wines presented were tasteful and they do a great job in matching each wine with the proper tapas. Thumbs up. At the end, as in any tasting, you have the option of buying a few bottles but I did not feel any pressure to do so, which is something that I appreciate very much. The overall experience is a bit expensive per person but it is worth it. My wife and I really enjoyed it.

Best Introduction to Argentinian Wines. If you want to do wine tasting in Buenos Aires, come here to try some of the best the country has to offer. I thoroughly enjoyed myself during my visit to Anuva Wines for their wine tasting. This place offers tasting of wines from boutique vineyards (i.e. small production vineyards) in the Mendoza/Salta wine country region. My favorites are the whites (the sparkling Hom espumante and the Carinae torrontes) and the San Gimignano syrah. Our sommelier Cara was very friendly and knowledgeable about the wines and didn't make us feel bad that we weren't very knowledgeable about wines. Eat tasting was pared with some small bite tapas that complemented the wine. All the wines and more are very reasonably priced per bottle, can be bought by the case (I think mixed up too) and can be shipped to the U.S. Note - there are no signs to this place as the entrance is an unmarked black door. When you make your confirmation, they will give you the address. After my wine tasting experience here, I wish I made more time in Argentina to visit wine country at Mendoza and la Salta!

Great Time. At first we thought this would be a little hokie. But it turned out that my husband and I had a great time and ended up filling ourselves with nice wines and great tappas. We enjoyed this experience with a young couple we met there from Texas . AND also ended up sending home three cases of wine. Need I say any more.

Fun experience in Buenos Aires!. I went to an Anuva Wine's tasting with a few friends, none of us are wine experts, but we all love drinking it!Our host, Cara, was very knowledgeable and told us lots of little interesting tidbits, as well as explained each wine in detail. Her presentation really made the tasting excellent.We tried several whites, and several reds, each accompanied by a small tapas-like dish. The food paired really well with the wine, and it was interesting the way the food can bring out the different flavors of the wine!The space is fantastic, very clean and modern - and we had a fun time getting to know the other people at our table.All in all, a fantastic night - even left a little tipsy due to the generous pours! :)

Great Wine Tasting. My family and I went to Anuva for a wine tasting and loved it. Cara was incredibly knowledgeable about the wines we tried, the history of wine in Argentina and gave us great recommendations on other activities in Buenos Aires (Cara, we loved Las Cabras, great steak!). Ask about the San Gimignano bottle, it was my favorite. Anuva was a great experience and I highly recommend it to any traveler or wine lover in Buenos Aires.

Had a blast!. What a great stop in Buenos Aires! Our hostess, Cara, was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about wines, making it a fun and interesting experience. We were also pleasantly surprised by the quality of the wines that were available, and we will continue have wines shipped to us in the US. Needless to say, I strongly recommend that you see for yourself how much fun it can be.

Such fun!. We had a really great night at Anuva wines, with a great setting and knowledgeable staff. We were 2 of a group of 7, and the night was structured in such a way as to be unobtrusive, allowing us all to bond and continue drinking over an hour past the scheduled finish.

Excellent Experience. Definitely enjoyed the wine tasting experience. They had great wines and the host was passionate and knowledgable. It was a great learning experience and definitely worth a visit!

Expected more. I am an "experienced" Malbec drinker, and have been for 3 decades. Anuva's presentation of the wines and "tapas" were very good, as was the setting. Unfortunately, all three Malbec wines provided during the tasting were about as bad as I have ever tasted, and I had heard of none of them previously. Anuva's spin on this is that they have found "undiscovered" excellent little vintners with outstanding wines that the lucky customer can purchase from Anuva. Their business model appears to be to get you to believe the wines they sell are grand, and to have you order a case or three at the end of the tasting. For $52 you will be much better off going to a nice restaurant and ordering two or three bottles of something that is actually a good wine, plus pay for your bife de lomo. Also went to a wine tasting at Lo de Joaquin Alberti, which was much better, not the least because the wines were actually good. Lo de Joaquin are far more knowledgeable about Argentinian wines, and carry a broad array of classic and hard to find (but good) Malbecs.
Great wine tasting. loved the wine tasting experience. wine was delicious. worth it. especially if you cant make a trip to mendoza

Great wine tasting. Thank you for a great wine tasting. Awesome experience, greats wines. I went home with two! The people leading the wine tasting were extremely knowledgable. It was great learning about wines that were unavailable otherwise. I love learning about boutiquet wines.

Excellent wine tasting!. Private wine tasting experience with a very knowledgeable owner. We tasted and learned in detail about 5 different wines (not just reds) and the food pairings were nicely done.

Great way to taste fantastic wines. We had a fantastic time at Anuva. Cara our host was very informative and lots of fun. We tasted a variety of wines from the Mendoza region which were all very good. The group of people there that night were very interesting and fun to spend time with. The food pairings were unique and complimented each wine perfectly. The pours were generous and you could ask for seconds if you really liked the wine. We did this often. Highly recommend this place, it's a great place to try boutique wines.
Fantastic!. It was a fantastic experience. I tasted great wines and good foods. I will back soon and recommend it!

A great way to learn about Argentinian wines and meet interesting people.. Poppy was our host and she did a great job. The varied wines she presented were from boutique wineries and we enjoyed learning about them. The pairings really enhanced the flavors of the wines. We shared this wine tasting experience with a group of people from all over the world and it was so much fun to hear their perspective .

One of our Favorite Buenos Aries Experiences!. We had a fantastic time at Anuva, and it was one of our favorite experiences in Buenos Aries! Cara was a wonderful and charming hostess and taught us a great deal about Argentina's wines and wine regions. The pours were generous and the food parings excellent. We were also able to ship home to the states a case of wine with no shipping charges. I highly recommend their tastings!

Must do while in Buenos Aires, no exceptions.. Being a wine newbie, I was extremely impressed with the way our Hostess Poppy was able to manage the group of both more experienced "winos" and the less experienced. She was very knowledgable and guided us through each wine first letting us draw some conclusions and then pointing out the specifics that we weren't able to put out finger on.I also cannot say how beautiful the space is that they have set up shop, it's perfect. Intimate but not cramped, beautiful wood floors and furniture. This is a top notch operation.I do have to apologize for my pictures, they do not do the place justice. Also there is an extreme lack of pics during the tasting, we were just enjoying ourselves far too much to think about pics.

Love Anuva Wines!. I used to live in Argentina seven years ago, so when I went back last month with a group of girlfriends, I had a hard time finding a wine tasting that was English-speaking (for my friends) but was truly authentic to the wine culture of Argentina. I read about Anuva Wines in the Time Out Guide, made a reservation, and hoped for the best. Needless to say, we had an amazing experience! The space in Palermo is perfect -- excellent natural light in a beautiful loft without distracting decor. Poppy Wilson led the tasting and was incredible. She was extremely knowledgable of all the wines, was able to touch on the science of the winemaking, and made herself very accessible for questions and clarifications. The food parings were locally-made and well-thought out. Lastly, all the wines we tasted were available for sale. Anuva offers free shipping as long as you attend a tasting, so the wines are very well priced considering you can't purchase any of them in the US. All in all, we had a fantastic time and I will recommend this to anyone who visits BsAs!

Unforgettable Experience. This is an awesome wine tasting. It is hosted in a cool loft, and the hostess, Cara, is really informative and keeps the evening flowing.
Most of the wines were really nice and paired well with some delicious tapas. It was so much fun to talk to new people in such a unique space. Unforgettable experience!

Great value, great energy, great wines and information!. I visited Anuva Wines for one of their tasting evenings with my aunt. Our tasting was guided by a wonderfully energetic host who led us through the various flavors and production methods associated with each premier wine that we tasted. Each wine was paired with carefully selected and prepared h'ourdeuves, crafted to bring out flavors within each glass. The tasting was set up in a dinner party-format, encouraging conversation among the guests and creating an all-around good time! A great afternoon activity for any passing through Buenos Aires!

Great wines and fun experience!. After making your reservation, you show up to an unmarked black door on a side street and have to call upstairs. Right as you think you're being brought into an elaborate trap, you're let in and walk up some dark stairs to a beautiful second story loft, completely redone for the purpose of holding wine tastings. You sit at communal tables and taste five wines, each accompanied by a small food pairing. The wines were excellent and the also fantastic. The sommellier that walked us through the wines, gave a great combination history about each wine and grape, along with some instructive tasting notes. Her knowledge about wine was really impressive and she was a great guide through the new varietals. She also had lots of restaurant and activity suggestions for us.They do offer to sell you bottles of what you've just tasted at the end, but the wine is so good, you really don't mind buying it, and they don't pressure you at all to buy if you're not interested.A really fun experience I would absolutely recommend!

anuva wines was a highlight of my trip to BA. this was one of the most fun wine tastings i have ever attended. the host has the best personality and is extremely knowledgable! the tapas was fantastic and went well with each wine. i would highly recommend anyone using anuva wines while traveling to BA. i get emails regularly on wine specials that i order everytime. i loved this part of my trip!

Must do if you can not make it to the wine region in Argentina. This wine tasting was just what we were looking for since we could not head out to the wine region in Western Argentina. We easily signed up online, got the address and were headed out by taxi to taste some great wine. The employees were very friendly and knowledgeable. The others at our table were from around the world, and I believe almost everyone spoke English, including the host. Typically we don't drink white wine, but the two offered we great and we ended up buying some at the end of the evening. The small food pairings were tasty, the atmosphere was clean, comfortable and welcoming. After tasting 5 wines (2 white, 3 red) we had the opportunity to buy some and have it shipped home. There was absolutely no pressure for this sale. We took them up on the offer and purchased a case. Earlier in the day we had stopped by a large liquor store and inquired about shipping wine home to the U.S. They said they woudl not because it was too expensive. Through Anuva we got an amazing deal on shipping the case of wine and we are still enjoying the wine with our friends and family. I highly recommend this to anyone looking to taste some great wine as well as learn about each one from a company that is professional and knowledgable.

Great little Gem in Buenos Aires. I was in BA for business and had a free weekend and a quick internet search came up with Anuva. The price was reasonable and sounded like a good way to kill a couple of hours. As a bonus, it was presented in English (since I don't speak Spanish). I was blown away by how much fun I had - even as a solo participant. The location is a nondescript loft - no sign on the door or shingle to be seen. Once the hostess came down to greet us, we ascended the staircase to a spacious and bright loft with the table set for all of the folks attending. Our hostess was very personable and energetic and engaging. She poured the wine explaining the history of each one, the types of varietals used, and the notes we should taste and smell. Then a small service of food was presented to complement each of the five wines in turn. All in all, the food was great, the wine was better, and the presentation and hostess brought it all together. I can't recommend this enough for anybody visiting BA and wanting a sampler of local wines.

The Highlight of Your Trip to BA. I live in Buenos Aires and I am always looking for things to do when guests come to town. Recent houseguests cited our tasting at Anuva as the highlight of their one-week trip. The service at Anuva is friendly and welcoming. The setting is beautiful. The pours and tapas are generous. I do not find the experience to be pricy in the least, and a previous reviewers suggestion to simply walk around BA to get a similar experience on your own is laughable to anyone who lives here. Your average waiter/bartender in BA won't be nearly as willing to teach you about wine as the staff at Anuva. In fact, you'll be lucky if you even get them to bring you a glass within 20 minutes of sitting down. On the contrary, at Anuva, it's all about customer service and quality. Not to be missed.

Splendid Experience!. What do you do in Buenos Aires if you don’t care too much about Tango? Go to a wine testing at Anuva. Everything about the experience was wonderful...the location in trendy Palermo...the spacious loft with its terrace overlooking the city...the food, and of course, the wine. We discovered wines from small bodegas that are not available in wine stores. Thanks to Anuva, we also met wonderful people. The Anova’s experience was a highlight of our stay in BA. At the end, we were ready to tango.Paul

Unique Wine Tasting Experience!. The wine tasting I attended was absolutely wonderful. Everything from the venue, to the wines, to the presentation exceeded my expectations. Our hostess was very informative and answered any questions we asked. She was also very generous with the pours of each wine. We were even allowed refills in the end (can’t complain about that!). We were served 5 different wines (a sparkling, a white, and three reds) along with 5 authentic Argentine tapas including empanadas, sorbets, and local meats and cheese. YUM! What was unique about this wine tasting is the wines selected are from small boutique wineries, so you can’t find these wines just anywhere, which made the tasting feel extra special. It was also nice to meet and drink wine with other travelers with whom we were able to share stories of our Buenos Aires adventures! I would recommend this to anyone looking for a unique experience in Buenos Aires.

A Great Wine Tasting. I knew when I came to BA that I wanted to do a wine tasting. Anuva was recommended by my hotel. What a wonderful surprise. Not only the wine, but the food pairing with each type of wine. There were only four of us, but we had a delightful afternoon. Our host joined us and told us how he came into this business. The people serving the wine were extremely knowledgable. It was a great afternoon. Call ahead for reservations.

Lovely evening!. My boyfriend and I wanted to attend a wine tasting during our first visit to Argentina, so we reserved spots for one of Anuva's evening tastings and were welcomed into a beautiful, modern loft space in Palermo (definitely my favorite neighborhood in Buenos Aires!). Our group, which included about a dozen people, was seated promptly at two spacious dining tables, and the event was conducted entirely in English. Our host was gracious, knowledgeable, and very professional; I felt like I learned a lot of interesting facts about the history and reasoning behind various local winemaking processes. The wines were lovely, but my favorite part was the pairings—they were thoughtfully selected, with nice surprises from chocolate to empanadas. They also provide unlimited refills, which makes for great value!

Americans Abroad. My family and I were looking for a way to enjoy some Argentinian wines and came across Anuva Wines. With only a couple Spanish speakers in our group, we were nervous about how it would go, but we had no need to worry. The hosts are bi-lingual Americans living the dream in Buenos Aires and sharing their discovered wines with all guests in an intimate tasting room.They work hard to make everyone feel comfortable and pair great wines with very worth appetizers. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and guess that you will too.

Best Wine Tasting and Pairing I've done. A normal wine tasting involves 2-3 wines and some cheese. Anuva knows that people drink many different types of wine and understands that food and wine can complement each other very well. They serve food that people actually would eat with each wine pairing. Yes, that means different types of cheese with some. But they also have beef and chocolate to pair with other wines. You end up with multiple food tastings with each wine you sample. It is not a giant meal, this is essentially appetizers but the flavor pairings are excellent. On top of that, they will introduce you to some wines that you do not know - vineyards and grape variety. If you want a very different wine tasting experience and one that level of wine drinker will learn many things and have a very enjoyable time - try Anuva. The layout of the tasting is also set up where all the guests can talk to each other and discussion flows. Even the geography of the Argentina is discussed. I tell all my friends traveling to B.A. that this is the place to visit. Staff is very knowledgable and they take great care in selecting their wines to offer. What is great is you can do this tour six times, and taste all new wines each time. So first time or fourth time, you will still learn more.

Absolutely awesome - fun, interesting, & knowledgeable!!. My sister & I did this on our last day in Argentina but wish we had started with it!! We both had a really great time. My sister loves wine and knows a lot about it and I am a complete novice. The host answered all of my silly questions and also gave us great advice about other restaurants and sights to see on our trip. The wines were delicious, she gave us great tips about choosing wine & wine quality as well as a little history about each one. They also prepared scrumptious pairings and had a really nice view!! FYI - we got to taste 6 different wines and got to choose if we wanted all reds or a mixture. I definitely recommend to any traveler.

Great Wine Tasting Experience!. A wonderful way to taste a variety of wines from Argentina paired with tapas. We set up the wine tasting on-line prior to our trip to Buenos Aires along with our friends. It was both educational and entertaining. Especially liked the small size of the group which allowed everyone to interact while enjoying the wine. We purchased a case of the wine which was shipped directly to us back to the states at a reasonable price and enjoy receiving special e-mail offers to keep our wine cellar stocked.

Educational and Enjoyable Evening. This is an event for wine lovers of all levels that will introduce the young and the old alike to Argentina's wineries and growing industry. The staff is very knowledgeable and passionate about their work. Together, their passion and knowledge combines to create a great experience for everyone.I highly recommend Anuva wine tasting to anyone who enjoys good company, good food, and great wine!

A nice experience. My partner and I decided to do this tasting after reading many positive reviews on it. It was an enjoyable experience but too pricey given the duration and the tapas served with the wines. I think you could achieve the same by taking a self guided wine tour around BA. If you have a spare hour, and are not concerned with budgeting, then Anuva is a good option, otherwise I think your time is better spent exploring this amazing city by foot and by chance.

Excellent wines, beautiful location, knowledgable staff. Anuva is essentially a wine club, dedicated to hand sourcing limited production wines from South America. They host intimate wine tasting events in Palermo, introducing visitors to high-quality wines from small wineries, many of which barely export and are extremely limited in production. Their wine tastings are offered at a variety of days and times, and we opted for a 2pm Saturday tasting because we day-drink like that. We were lucky enough to book a time with Cara as our host. She knows her stuff. And she provides detailed background on wine regions, characteristics, and processes in a simple and approachable way, without making you feel at all ashamed for previously viewing Two Buck Chuck as a special occasion wine. Each wine comes with a small food pairing to complement and enhance the flavors. There is plenty of vino to be had and you’ll not be left wanting for heavier pours.

Great experience!. Great wine tasting in a very beautiful loft in Soho! I was pretty curious to see what the wine tasting would be like since it said it was in a loft but the loft has been totally renovated to be a wine tasting space. There are very nice dining rooms tables and big windows. Also was in a great location in Palermo Soho near plenty of shops to check out beforehand or afterwards. The wines themselves were great and they were quite generous with the pours. Definitely worth the money and worth a visit!

Great Wine and Food -- An Amazing Experience!. Anuva Wines was the total package -- tons of wine, delicious food and wonderful people! A few of us went after some people who worked at our hostel recommended over and over their wine tasting. I was a little hesitant at first as I don't drink enough wine to pay for a tasting and I didn't want to step in to anything too fancy or just full of older people. This wine tasting completely took me by surprise in a great way! Our host was very warm and friendly, and made a point to talk to everyone there as well as answer everyone's questions fully. What I thought was going to be stuffy and not personal, turned out to be super relaxed and really fun. A mix of all different ages and wine experts. I didn't really like wine before, but now I absolutely love it -- and know a thing or two! I 100 percent recommend Anuva Wines tasting, definitely my favorite BA experience!

A great way to learn about Argentine wine. Unlike most California wine tastings, the wine and food pairings keep flowing at this spot. Each sommelier is a native English speaker. The wines are from boutique vineyards, so you won't find them in most supermarkets/restaurants. And of course the quality of both the wine and the pairings were wonderful.

Fun way to spend a couple of hours in BA. We did an afternoon tasting at this lovely loft bar in the trendy SoHo area of BA. We were offered five wines paired with five tapas. The wines on offer were a sparkling, a white and three reds. The pours were substantial and our sommelier was more than happy to top up our glasses as much as we wanted. The tapas were well matched to the wines that they accompanied. The wines were offered for sale after the tasting but not in a pushy way. It was a fun afternoon and a great opportunity to try a variety of Argentinean wines that are not readily available in other countries.

It was fun, but pricey for what you get. Good wines and a nice atmosphere. Came here to taste some wines and the tasting itself did not disappoint. All of the tasters are all tourists, so this is very touristy. The wines are good and the pours are substantial. You are basically drinking glasses, not tastings LOL. Appetizers were nice but didn't do enough to soak up the wine. The good news is, it's timed before the dinner period and there are plenty of nearby restaurants.The not so good: The owner was a bit salesy and the tasting itself was pricey. They tell you they are the only wine bar in Buenos Aires, but there are actually many of them throughout the city. It was a good experience and if you have the time to do it and see the city, do it. But it's not a MUST DO.

Fantastic!. We landed in BA at noon and by 5 pm we were tasting some of the best wines of Argentina! What a great way to start the trip. Most importantly the wine selection was fantastic and there were lots of free refills included in the price. It was basically all you could drink of the five wines. The tapas were a perfect compliment- not a full meal, but enough to keep you full until a late night dinner. Would highly recommend to other travelers!
Great!. Great wines. Good pairings. Fun experience. The tasting was a bit pricier than I thought was appropriate, but overall still worth it.

Exquisite wines well presented!. Our group consisted of fellow South Africans, which was a nice surprise and other nationalities. The selection of wines presented was excellent and the food pairings equally good. It gave us good knowledge of the quality available, all in all an extremely enjoyable evening!

WINE Tasting 101. Since Mendoza was too far for us to travel we had Mendoza come to us. There were about 20 people there and all were American the day we went. Had 5 different wines and 3 food tasting. Cara was a wonderful hostess and told us a lot about the wine and area they were produced

Anuva+Cara= An unforgettable night. Visited Buenos Aires with my wife this past fall and made a reservation at Anuva Wines based on the Trip Advisor comments/ratings. I will say that I was not only not disappointed but was completely blown away. It was very laid-back. There were about 12 of us and it was nice to spend an evening chatting with fellow English speaking travellers. The wines were all excellent and the pours very generous. The tapas paired well with the wines.They were very small portions but aren't intended to fill you up. Cara, the presenter, did a wonderful job. She is witty and quick with loads of charm and knowledge. She not only presented all of the wines with in-depth commentary but also helped guide the conversation, dispensed invaluable advice on seeing BA, and most importantly-kept the wine flowing. Generous pours is an understatement. They also helped me get a case sent back to Hawaii without breaking the bank. We were able to have our own Argentine wine-tasting with friends when we got back home. If I'm ever back in BA,I'll be sure to look up Anuva Wines. Thanks again, Cara! That evening was one of the highlights of our time in BA.
Great !!. Wine tastings usually tend to get boring and sermon-like, however Anuva makes 5-rarely heard wines with food pairing a great experience...would recommend it highly !

Friendly hostess and good selection of wines. I really liked the Anuva wine tasting. 5 great wines from smaller wineries in Argentina, good refills, no stress at all.A very good explanation about every wine as well, and some well tasting snacks to fulfill the experience.Would go back for sure.

Tasty, Informative and Fun. One of my daughters wanted to go to Anuva for a wine tasting and I must say I was not very excited. But I was very wrong. Cara the sommelier, instructor and host did a wonderful job throughout the afternoon. The price is very reasonable and we met fellow travelers who shared our enthusiasm.
Wine lover's treat!. Terrific wines presented by Cara - a lively, very informed hostess. Wonderful & cool way to spend Christmas Eve afternoon in sweltering Buenes Aires!

enjoyable. The location was just round from our hotel, so 1 hour after we had arrived and unpacked we headed off for our pre-booked wine tasting. We had just arrived in Argentina so thought we would start off with wine tasting before anything else.  It is a small venue and we were lucky in that there was a great bunch of people doing the tasting with us. Everyone around our table was chatting away about where they had been/where they were going. It almost felt like a nice dinner party. If you are travelling around on your own then I 'd definitely recommend booking a tasting trip here as it is a good inclusive experience.Not sure I learnt a great deal about Argentinina wines but it was an enjoyable couple of hours and then we headed off to La Cabrera which is just round the corner.

Lots of fun. Whenever we travel to areas that produce wine, we try to go to a wine-tasting that offers samples of local wines. This one compares well with others that we have gone to. It is located in a loft accessed from a nondescript door on the street. They offer 5 different wines, as well as information about winemaking and the wines of Argentina. The food offerings for pairing with the wines were good. Unlike some places we've been previously, they offered top-ups from the open bottles, so you could have a fair amount of the wines that you liked. One nice thing was that if you enjoyed a specific bottle, they offer shipping if you have a US address. Note that you sit at tables of 8 people, so I guess your experience could depend a little on who you are sitting with; in our case we had very nice couples with us, which enhanced the experience.

Great Experience -- Went Back Twice!. Really, really loved the wine tasting at Anuva Wines! Was very surprised first time around that they were able to give me a reservation at the very last minute. Extremely helpful and answered all my questions right away. When we arrived I couldn't believe how gorgeous the room was, very class, but not in an uncomfortable way. Our host Cara was wonderful and knew a lot about the wines! The food was amazing, probably the best empanadas I've tried, and the wine, well I could have drank the whole bottle! After a tour we were supposed to go on got cancelled we all decided to head over to Anuva for another tasting, and was just as amazing! Can't repeat enough -- if you are in Buenos Aires you MUST go to Anuva! Totally worth the time, price friendly and very delicious!

Great last night in BsAs!. We were looking for a fun way to spend our last night in Buenos Aires and came across Anuva Wines. This was definitely one of the highlights of our few days in the city. The tasting was really fun, casual and informative. We really enjoyed getting to taste wines from boutique winemakers (and if you're interested in shipping back to the US, their rates are crazy cheap!). Very generous pours of each wine and tasty snacks paired with each one. The whole tasting probably lasted 2.5 and the wonderful British woman who led our class was kind enough to give us some nearby bar and restaurant recommendations for afterwards. Their loft is in a great location in Palermo Soho.
Very Informative. Excellent activity to do - we throughly enjoyed it! The lady who ran it (Kara, i believe her name was) was excellent!

Perfect Location, Great Wine!. After all the countless good reviews I read I needed to see for myself how good Anuva Wines was. It definitely did not disappoint! In fact I went to two other wine tastings during my stay in BA and Anuva absolutely blew them all out of the water. In fact I wish I had just saved this wine tasting for last, because the others were just a disappointment! Made a reservation for an afternoon tasting with a few buddies... who by the way, are definitely not wine people, and by the end they loved it! Our host Cara was awesome -- she definitely knew what she was doing and explained all of our wines with detail and interest. I could tell she really loved what she was doing and could easily relate to any of her customers! We tried a bunch of red wines that were so amazing, I don't think I can drink anything other than Malbecs now! And the food pairing? I don't know what to say other than I wish I could have ordered empanadas to go, they were delicious. If you're in BA you HAVE to go to Anuva! Totally off the beaten path of the normal tourist activities and just really unique and fun!

Delicious wine tasting - not to be missed!. My husband and I, and our friends loved this wine tasting. Cara was very knowledgable and entertaining, the food was delicious, the wine was amazing, and the pours very extremely generous! This is something that everyone should experience when they come to Buenos Aires! Thank you so much Cara!

Who needs Mendoza?. If you're staying in BA and can't find the few days you'd need to go to Mendoza, fear not. We were referred to Anuva by a friend who had been there, and found ourselves delighted with the whole experience! It was amazing to walk in off the street, in Palmero Soho, and realize that at the top of the stairs, there was a chic and beautiful loft awaiting for an afternoon wine-tasting! We were greeted so warmly and sat down at a table with many wine glasses set out before us. After the other guests arrived, we began our tasting. One wine was better than the next, and the food pairings that came with it were way beyohd the normal crackers or breads we've had in other locales. We had delicious empanadas, cheeses, smoked sausage, chocolate and nuts. It felt like being invited to someone's home for dinner!! Cara was so knowledgeable about each wine and she was able to answer any and all questions we may have had. I would go back to Anuva without hesitation!! Definitely, one of the highlights of our week in BA!!

It's all been said before...Anuva is great!. I love wine yet did not know much about Argentine wine until we attended a tasting here. Cara was wonderful, and we enjoyed an intimate gathering with just a few others--all from Australia, so obviously fun company!The wines were delicious and of course after the tasting I ordered a case to be sent back to US. The food pairings and education were great too. I also think the tasting was a good value too. Definitely do at the beginning of your trip to give you a little help w/wines during your stay. And be sure to explore the neighborhood of palermo/palermo soho etc. Great shops, pretty architecture, etc. And great restaurants!

If you love wine and want to learn more about wine in Argentina, do not hesitate to take this tasting!. Anuva wine tastings located in Buenos Aires hip Palermo Soho neighborhood, came highly recommended. It’s easy to see why. You enter a non-descript door and as you ascend the stairs, you find yourself in an airy loft with a table impeccably set for a wine tasting with food pairings. Your host, Cara, is a wealth of information and peppers the tasting with wit, while she tells you about the exclusive wines that you get to taste. You will taste 2 whites and 3 reds and there are small bites of food that are paired with each wine. Cara will answer any questions you have about the wines, which are exclusive because of their small production.  Most of the wines are not available in markets but you are free to make a purchase at the end of the tasting if you wish but there is no pressure to do so. We met some great people who shared the table with us, there were six of us in total. We planned to visit Cafayete & Mendoza, the wine growing regions in Argentina, so for us this was a perfect introduction of what was to come. If you do not have a chance to visit these regions, it’s the perfect place to get a taste without leaving Buenos Aires. Highly recommended.

Wonderful wine-tasting in hip Palermo neighborhood. We had a fantastic time tasting local wines from Argentina in this super hip loft space overlooking chic Palermo on a sunny weekday afternoon. Our gracious hostess was informative, explaining the delightful flavors in each of six wines from the Mendoza region. She and her team had also prepared a delicious sampling of tapas which paired perfectly with each wine. Perhaps we drank too much because we purchased a case of the wines that we sampled so that we could continue to enjoy the flavors when we returned to the states and share our stories over wine with friends and family. This was a great experience for our group of 3, but would also be perfect for couples or larger groups. We continued on from Buenos Aires to Mendoza City where we spent two days sampling wines directly at the vineyards. I would recommend Anuva wines for travelers who want a warm-up to Mendoza or who won't have the time (or money) to spend going their directly. When we booked our tasting we described which wineries we were planning to visit and our hostess made sure to share wines from vineyards where we weren't going to be able to visit.

Excellent Wine, Space & Staff. I'm a bit of a wine newbie and Anuva Wines was perfect to get started. Ended up walking away with four bottles, and definitely could have bought more! They send you the actual location through email -- which at first I was a little confused and they were super helpful and answered all my questions promptly. When we arrived we were greeted by the host Cara who was so nice and definitely better than any other service I received at other restaurants/bars in BA. She was really knowledgable about all the different kinds of wine and explained things really thoroughly. She answered everyone's questions and was super helpful. Overall Anuva was really on top of everything -- organized, nice and offered an awesome atmosphere in a gorgeous location. Their wine prices were excellent as well, had tons of different options and were stocked with everything! Loved my entire experience with them, recommend to anyone looking for a good wine tasting in Buenos Aires!

Excellent!!. I love wine, but I really don't know a lot about wine tasting, so this was an excellent experience for me. I went with my boyfriend, and we were both pleasantly surprised. I would definitely recommend. Their choice of wine, wine pairings, and insight into wine tasting was amazing. A must do. The wine portions were generous, and you could ask for second pourings if you wanted. I was not interested in purchasing wine and was in a hurry, so when the activity finished I had to leave immediately. Everyone was very friendly and many of the other guest stayed to purchase wine or just mingle. By no means do they make you feel that you have to make a purchase. To the contrary, our hostess was very professional and friendly.Nevertheless, it was a pity that I did not make a purchase,because two of the red wines were phenomenal.

It was fun - happy I went!. I took my mom to Anuva last week as a gift during our week and a half-long vacation in Buenos Aires. We were warmly greeted by Rachel upon entering the building and instantly felt like very special guests when we saw how beautifully decorated the tasting room was. The wines did not disappoint and neither did the tapas, which were all nicely presented and paired quite well with each of the wines. I’m definitely still a novice, but this experience was helpful in expanding my ability to detect new notes in wines and moving beyond describing only the taste and smell – I learned how to pay attention to weight and color as well. The conversation was very good too; we met some very interesting people and overall had a nice afternoon.The only con I would mention is that our wine tasting felt a bit rushed. I realize that we were scheduled only for a specific time slot, but maybe it would help to add some cushion time so it doesn’t feel like the conversation is being abruptly brought to an end at times. Other than that, it was professionally-run and the presentation and ambience were very nice – each detail was impeccable from the lay-out of the table to our hostess’s attire. Thanks, Anuva!

Beautiful venue.....couple with great wine. I first had to comment on the venue -- a very nice decor and ambiance to do the tasting. The woman who narrated the tasting (Cara) was very knowledgeable and had a great sense of humor.The wines (2 whites / 3 reds) were unique and quite enjoyable! The food pairings went well -- especially enjoyed the empanadas!! I liked the diversity of wines, and how the pairings complemented them so nicely.Overall, was well worth the cost for 90+ minutes for a great experience in Buenos Aires....A MUST do when you visit. Plus, a great way to meet new people as well!

Absolute Favorite Wine Tasting. By far my favorite wine tasting and host I have ever been to. Cara was spectacular from start to finish, answering every question with detail and enthusiasm. I went by myself and the group I was with ended up being pretty small, however by the end we were all hanging out like old friends! No joke when I say the food pairing was definitely the highlight! A lot of wine tours or tastings I have gone to just have you try a few and that's really it, but Anuva Wines was super relaxed and offered seconds to anyone who wanted. 150% recommend to anyone looking for a totally different wine experience, meet people and to learn a thing or two! I walked away with two bottles and a few new friends in BA, I really loved it!

Fun Times - Buenos Aires. I was a little apprehensive about going to the tasting as I consider myself a bit of a wine & food snob, but I really had a good time and thought the wines, as well as the food pairings, were good. I was surprised at how much wine and food we actually received based on some other reviews. We were able to have more of any of the wines we wished. The food, while not necessarily dinner sized, was appropriate for the tasting and didn't leave me wanting more. The presentation was informative and fun.I did not feel any sales pressure to buy at the end of the night, but the wines were certainly available for purchase. The loft was a really nice space and the directions for the location made it easy to find. I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone heading to Buenos Aires. It is appropriate for both couples or friends/business associates.

Outstanding wine-tasting!. The occasion was a gift from a dear friend of ours, our daughter's best friend, to celebrate an important birthday in the family. We loved the selection of wines accompanied by excellent pairings, as well as the professional and friendly hosts who took us on a "tour" to the province of Mendoza. This was not only a feast for the palate but also a most interesting learning experience.We highly recommend Anuva Wines-a must when visiting Buenos Aires!

Fun, unique experience. Looking for unique and cool things to do to, I perused tripadvisor's recommended activities in Buenos Aires and came upon Anuva Wines. The experience definitely lived up to the rating. Upon arriving at the Anuva Wines tasting room, you're seated at a casual yet intimate dining table with interesting, curious travelers from all over the world (all English-speaking). Then, an extremely knowledgeable and personable wine expert walks everybody through 6-7 different wines (coupled with nice, appetizer-sized food pairings). The guide provides a crash-course in wine tasting and peppers the conversation with interesting history and funny quips. All in all, the wines were delicious, the info was intriguing, the company was great, and the experience was most definitely a memorable one. At the end, you can even order some of the wines provided during the tasting. So excited to receive my Bonarda! Kudos to the Anuva Wine management and staff for coming up with such a cool thing to do in Argentina. Highly recommended.

LOVED It!. Really great wine tasting at Anuva Wines. It was a group of about 5 or 6 of us and it was so relaxing and enjoyable. It's hard to believe the amount of groups Cara does wine tastings with because she was so excited and actually interested! Thought that it was just a wine tasting and was so surprised when they brought out food to try with it! We tried more of the white wines -- and by tried I mean practically just drank because they pour quite a bit! They were also paired with a bunch of different cheeses and meats. Easily the best wine tasting I have gone too and totally unique and fun. Loved it and absolutely recommend it!

Great Wine Tasting Experience in BA!. What a great experience my wife and I had at Anuva Wine yesterday! Cara and team were wonderful. We tried 5 wines; Cara provided great descriptions of each l and also have a lot of background for each winery. The space was well appointed and very comfortable. The pours were more than generous and "seconds" we're even offered!! As mentioned! The wines are available for purchase, if you desire, and they do ship to the US for $43 a case - which is a GREAT deal. Really a great experience....HIGHLY RECOMENDED!!

A very nice before-dinner option!. We booked wine tasting just a day in advance over the phone. All together we were 7 people in a nice large room at a big dinner table. Very nice wine selection for tasting - sparkling, white and 3 reds with small canapes, cheese and meats matching the wine tastes! Friendly and relaxing atmosphere, well paced and quite interesting approx. 1.5 hours argentinian wine "journey" - fits really well into BA exploring itinerary before going for dinner. They also delivered wine that we bought to our hotel so we don't have to carry it around for the rest of the evening!

Fun Wine Tasting. What was so fun about this one was how much fun the host seemed to be having. The wines were excellent and each was paired with a different food (honestly, I wouldn't have thought of drinking wine with empanadas but it was amazing). I went on my own but you sit at two communal tables, and of course, once the wine gets flowing, no one's shy. Incredibly generous refills.

Enjoyable Wine Tasting. This was one of our favorite experiences in Buenos Aires. The presentation by Cara was informative and professional, accompanied by excellent wines and appetizers. There were only eight people in our group, so we enjoyed meeting and sharing the experience with the other participants.

Wine and Food. Lovely ambience and unhurried presentation. Each of the five wines is paired with complementing food, making for a memorable experience. Buy local when you are there as these boutique wines aren't available elsewhere.

Fantastic Wine and Host!. I went with my husband for an evening wine tasting and it was wonderful. We made our reservation at the last minute and they were really accommodating and didn't mind at all! Our host, Cara was so great and helped us with everything. Our group had people from all over and Cara made a point to talk with everyone and make them feel comfortable and answer all their questions. The food pairings were really unique and delicious, definitely something my husband and I have never seen before. It wasn't expensive compared to a lot of wine tastings I have seen and it was really nice and classy, but also relaxed. I recommend trying their Malbec, it was delicious!

Excellent Wine Tasting. The Anuva wine tasting was fantastic. The sparkling, white and 3 Argentine red wines we tried were all very good, and our host Cara knew a lot about wine. From the location, to the company of the other people at the tasting and the food tastings paired with each wine, it really was a professional and enjoyable experience and a great introduction to Argentine wines! Highly recommended.

A must do in BA. This was a great introduction to the wines of the region. We tried several wines each with a delicious snack that paired with it perfectly. The communal tables allow you to meet some new people and the staff is wonderfully friendly, knowledgeable, and ready to pour you some more wine! You can ship home any of the wines you try, which is a big deal because you cannot ship back to the states unless you have a license. I wish i had bought more! Don't miss this.
Worth the visit. This was a great experience. We had the opportunity to try some great wines and it was very informative.

So worth it!. Came here with a few of my girl friends on an early afternoon and it was fantastic! We happened to come go at a time when no one else was there so we had the wine tasting all to ourselves. Our host, I can't remember her name, was so nice and friendly and she knew a ton about all the different wines we tried. She gave us as much as we wanted to try and let us ask as many questions as we wanted. A lot of wine tastings I have gone to want to finish quickly to keep a schedule, but she was so relaxed and friendly, it felt like I was hanging at a friend's apartment, not a stuff wine tour! It was fantastic and I am definitely going to go again!
must do in BA. we were with only one couple and it was fantastic.CARA was amaizing- rely fun and knowledge.thanks for a great evening

Anuva Wine Tasting. Cara gave a very good background to each of the five wines that she introduced to us. She was knowledgeable and was able to answer all questions. The food served with each wine was delicious. The wine was for sale, but Cara did not pressure any one to make wine purchases. The setting for the tasting was very pleasant and comfortable. If you are interested in Argentina wines I would highly recommend Cara and Anuva wine tasting program.

Nice Experience. Very good wines poured by a young woman who really knew her stuff. We went as two couples who requested a red wine only tasting. We were joined by a younger professional man and the somilier integrated him into our group well. Our tasting was arranged in a couple of days and three or four emails. They ask for a $15 deposit due to no-shows, and that's certainly fair.The space for the tasting is very nice and in a good area. The wines poured gave us a good range of Argentina reds, and the food accompaniement was well matched to the wines. The pours were not stingy, and there were "seconds" offered for each wine.The $45 price is very fair. All in all, a good value and informative overview of Argentina's wonderful wines, and we'd recommend it to anyone with similar interests.

Easy and Price Friendly!. Went to an afternoon Wine Tasting, absolutely my favorite activity from my visit to Buenos Aires! When I started looking into doing a wine tasting, I was a little frustrated because it seemed all the information wasn't up to date or accurate, however Anuva Wines stays on top of everything. They helped me check in no problem -- the service was so fast and easy! Our host was really nice and knew so much about the wines they had, she even suggested others to try and a variety of different foods I can pair with each. The prices weren't expensive at all either. Very relaxed and absolutely worth trying!

A great introduction to Argentine wine. I checked in to Anuva wines for the 3pm session in early October, 2012. Our session was run by Rachel, a young (but very knowledgable) American woman with a prodigious passion for wine. The five wines chosen were mostly very good, although the opening bottle - a sparkling - did little to convince me of the merits of Argentine bubbly. Those that followed - a torrentes, a bonarda, and two malbecs - were all top-notch though; indeed it was quite wonderful to drink small-quantity wines of such quality, all superbly matched with food. Even as a solo traveller, I didn't find it an awkward experience at all, although I'm admittedly not the most retiring type. I'd recommend this experience to just about anyone - even those who (quietly) consider themselves wine buffs would find enough here of interest for it to be a worthwhile experience.

Great start to our trip to Buenos Aires!. We had a great wine tasting with host Cara and three other people. We have done a few wine tasting before and the thing we enjoyed the most was the hosts' knowledge of Argentinian wines and the wineries that make them.It was also interesting to try Torrentes and Borande two types of wine we have never tried before. I would also recommend doing this at the beginning of your stay as we were provided with great restaurant recommendations that we used throughout the trip.

Flavor of Argentina!. Not typically much of a wine person. I actually haven't drank much at all until I came to Argentina on vacation! Was recommended Anuva Wine tasting from some other guests at my hotel. I loved it! Our host was great and spoke English, as well she knew a lot about the wines they offered. I loved the food pairings also, they were the perfect amount so you didn't feel completely stuffed. Would definitely recommend trying the Malbec and buying a bottle to bring home, it was delicious!

Best Wine Tasting In BA. This tasting was SO much better than I expected. I went to a few other wine tastings with some friends and every time I felt like they were okay, but always really pricey, or not that great for what you paid. This one had a great tasting at a good rate and the food pairing was amazing! Not only that, but it was located in the Palermo neighborhood and had a really nice/relaxed atmosphere. When we went there weren't that many people, so it felt really personal and our host was so friendly and outgoing. I love wine, but I brought some friends who aren't really into it, and by the end they were super into it! I definitely recommend this for anyone, I really enjoyed it!

Highlight of BA. This one a real highlight of our trip to BA. The wines were beautiful and the pairing with food was really intelligent and added to the experience. Have already tried to recreate one of the pairings at home. Rachel was a fantastic host, very friendly and knowledgeable. The place is hard to find (look for the black door), but well worth the effort!

Good time enoying wine. Recently went to BA with a friend. We lucked out and got our own personal wine tasting as no one else was scheduled at that time. I haven't done a wine tasting before but really enjoyed myself. Learned about the region and their wines, about how to actually do a tasting, and got some delicious food!! Rachel was wonderful and knowledgeable. We ended up shipping a case home.

Great way to spend an afternoon.. We went there and had a really good time sampling wines and their pairings. They really know about their wines and what to mix them with in a way to accentuate their flavors. Certainly something worthwhile doing in Buenos Aires.

I'm so not a wine connoisseur, but I loved Anuva!. Enjoyed a wonderful wine tasting and food pairing at Anuva! I for the most part don't drink wine, but the Argentinian wines showcased at Anuva were exceptional and the food pairings were even better. I learned a lot about wine from the Anuva host (Rachel?) and highly recommend setting up a tasting if you find yourself in BA.

A 'taste' of Argentina!. This was an interesting and somewhat fun, if a little awkward, event. It's in a kind of dicey-meets-avant-garde neighborhood in Palermo Soho, and not particularly close to a subte station. Our hosts were British but had been living and working wine in Argentina for quite some time and their knowledge showed. The awkwardness I think came not from her but from throwing a number of strangers together - two couples and me (but I was glad they could fit me in), not sure what to say or when, how much wine to drink and so forth. It got looser over the two hours though. What I really liked was that they showcased five wines and none is available in the U.S., which meant I was trying wines friends had never tasted! I loved that it wasn't five malbecs, and that the host explained very well not just the region, but also the history, terroir (why some grapes worked in Argentina but not France, for example), information about the vintners, and so forth. I'm not a white wine person but the white chosen was amazing. The malbec was really good - I've had my share here, and this one was much softer and lesser tannens than most, which is a good thing. I loved that there were two flagship wines of Argentina (not malbecs). We were seemingly unlimited in the amount of wine poured. The pairings were chosen carefully and we were able to discuss the effect of the food on the wine, led by our host. I had registered that I don't eat pork, and they accommodated that request for me. (Well, they didn't substitute something for the sausages that others got, they just put separate cheese on a plate for me, although I could have eaten the cheese off the communal plate - but maybe some non-pork-eaters wouldn't even do that.)

Great experience surrounded by great people!!!!. I'm not really a wine kind of man....beer is normally my kind of thing but this was a great experience. Cara was a wonderful host, always smiling and very knowledgable about the wines of Argentina and surprisingly, I found myself really interested in ebverything she was saying. The wines themselves were delicious, espically that malbec so I bought a case of to be shipped home. All in all a very fun, social eveing to learn a little bit more about the wines of Argentina with great people and great wine! Thanks Anuva Wines!Sparta8

Entrepreneurial, Innovative & Delicious. The team at Anuva bring forwards a love of Argentina and its wines. If you enjoy meeting people with a passion, who love what they are doing and you are open to trying new flavours; a visit to Anuva will leave you inspired and smiling. The innovation lies within the wine \ food combinations - which work like magic. The food selections transform the taste of the wines and so the experience is not just a wine tasting, but a demonstration of food chemistry. Although I went on my own, I found myself at a cosy dinner party where wine and good conversation flowed freely. I loved it.

Great Afternoon Activity. Great introduction to Argentinian Wines. All info presented in English. All wines presented in pairings of compatible foods. Great staff, easy reservation system on line. Very enjoyable afternoon.

Greaaat experience!. Kara, our hostess was so nice, funny and knowledgable! Mmmm....wines were very good! We brought back 4 bottles. The pairing with food is the best part since you discover some new flavors. And the people that were part of our group were great as well, so we had an overall perfect experience!

Great Experience!. I recently did a tasting with my husband and friend at Anuva. We had a wonderful experience and learned a lot about Argentine wine. We were all so impressed with the experience and the wine selection that we each bought a case!

Awesome experience in BA. This wine tasting at Anuva was awesome. Cara, the host, was extremely knowledgeable without being your typical wine connoisseur and snobby. She was so down to earth and made the tasting very fun and relaxed. They provided five different wines and offered refills (and more fills) on all of them. The food pairings were very good and made a big difference when tasting the wine. I wanted more of each food pairing! Overall, great experience, and amazing choice particularly for Americans traveling in BA, as everything is in English, and they give you a detailed guide of food, wine, and restaurant recommendations.

Excellent Experience!. We did a tasting here in June. Fabulous staff with excellent wine varieties. We brought my 14 month old daughter and they were great with her. We ended up shipping a case of wine back home at very reasonable price. Beautiful ambiance!

Great way to start a BA adventure. I spent a wonderful first night at Anuva wines. Cara and her staff presented the best that boutique Argentinian wineries have to offer. Each selection was expertly paired with a food choice ranging from chocolate, sorbet and homemade empanadas. Pours were generous and refills constant. A terrific evening!

One of my favourite evenings in Buenos Aires!. I attended the Anuva Wines wine tasting a couple of weeks back and I would highly recommend it to anyone in Buenos Aires - tourists and locals alike! I have been living here in Buenos Aires for around 2 years and it is so so nice to go out receive absolutely excellent service, while learning about a passion... fine wine! I have spent a lot of time tasting different wines, but this evening was extremely informative, without impacting at all the level of enjoyment... I felt totally spoilt and will not forget this evening of laughter and great company! Thank you to everyone from the Anuva team!

Great afternoon or early evening weekend event. I came to anuva wines on Saturday afternoon and the tasting leader greated us at the door with an extremely warm welcome. We tasted five flights of wine, two white (one sparkling) and three red. The food pairings were bruschetta with a nice Roquefort with pear and walnut, amazing peach and lemon sorbet to accompany the white and a traditional empanada, cheese and salami, and chocolate to accompany the red. The pours are generous and refills are encouraged. Even through some rather dochey ramblings from my table mates about the wines and their flavors this was a wonderful experience and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good glass of wine, great food, and light history lesson about the history of wine in Argentina.

Highlight of our trip. We had a great time tasting wine with our sommelier, Cara. She was very informative, and enthusiastic. I had my reservations about this place since they wouldn't announce the address until after we had put down a deposit for a reservation. It was all explained and made sense afterwards. We lucked out and happened to be the only group at the time. We tried an espumante, white, and three reds. Each were paired with a food choice that was also excellent. It was also nice to see that they offered more wine after you were done your tasting. They also ship wine for you, which is great since not a lot of wine stores in BA offer this service.

Excellent!. This is a wonderful way to be introduced to the wines of Buenos Aires. Our guide, Cara, was very knowledgable, but fun in her presentation of each wine. All the wines were of very good quality, and the food pairing was fantastic. The location is a gorgeous loft in the Palermo neighborhood. I highly recommend this to anyone wanting to experience the amazing wines that Argentina has to offer!

Good wines, good service, good time. My girlfriend and went in for a tasting. Cara, the lady running the tasting was knowledgeable and friendly, talked to us about the wine but gave also gave us enough space to socialize amongst ourselves. We were given 5 wines to taste (definitely enough to get us tipsy) and Cara offered refills of the wines we liked, (I got some more of the Malbec Roble). There were a couple of Argentine style goodies to taste in accompaniment to the wines to make certain flavors stand out. Good way to get a little buzz, meet some other travelers and learn about Argentine wines at the same time.

Perfect wine tasting with food pairing. My friends and I did the evening wine tasting at Anuva while we were visiting Buenos Aires. I've done many wine tastings before but have never met such an informed and outgoing wine expert. We tasted 6 Argentine wines and had delicious food paired with each taste. We learned about the regions where the grapes were grown and also about the different wine making processes. The wine tasting is conducted in a cool loft in Palermo around a large table for 10 that makes it a fun, social experience.

Very nice; excellent value.. Very classy, professional staff, not pretentious or stuffy at all. Cara gave the "lesson" and helped us with understanding Argentine wines. She was awesome! Food was tasty. The building is a beautiful loft. Close to everything in Palmero Soho. We walked from our hotel. Only suggestion: that the owner, Daniel I think his name was. . . would have come down to the tasting to say Hello.

Great wine tasting in Buenos Aires. A delightful 2 hours of wine tasting and pairing in Buenos Aires. Cara is very knowledgeable about Argentinian wines and the wine tasting gives you a good overview of the wine types in Argentina. The wine tasting is at a non-descript building that has a lovely loft in Palermo Soho. If you're looking for something different to do after walking around in the neighborhoods and love wine, this is a good choice. You can purchase and ship wines at a reasonable price as well.

Good tasting. We had a great experience at Anuva Wines. Kara was informative and pleasant. The wines were great and we ended up ordering a bunch to be shipped home. The food choices complemented the wines and we learned a lot about tasting. Nice hidden loft in Palermo, it was a beautiful space. We had a great time and met some lovely people.

Great Experience. The evening was more than just a wine tasting event. It was also fun and educational. The presenter created a family like atmosphere and everyone in the group interacted and shared their stories. The wines they presented along with a sample of what to pair them with was very helpful and the pours were very generous.

Not worth the price. After reading all the reviews I thought this might be something fun and different to do in BA. A way to learn a bit more about the wines in this region. When you get to the address..its just a black door...no signs...no windows..nothing. You have to be buzzed in...and really not sure of what you are getting yourself into. You get lead up to a nice loft where there is a table with set up for the tastings. So my hopes were high...everything looked professional and the staff was very friendly. But once we started tasting the wines and the tapas I was less and less impressed. Each wine was on average just OK. Nothing exciting...nothing I would care to retry or even want to buy. Especially for the prices they were asking. I know I can find a nicer Argentinian wine at Trader Joes! And for the tasting fees of $45 USD it was not worth it. I would not recommend this. Rather just go to a local wine store and buy a bottle...you will be happier with the wine!

Slightly below expectations. I loved the loft and the wines were fine but the presenter was too businesslike and a little patronizing. The "tapas" were ok, not great. The pours were not overly generous and definitely not " endless". The group was the best part - met some really nice people at the tastng.

Best Wine Tasting in Buenos Aires. I've gone at least twice to Anuva's wine tastings. I could just buy their wine and skip the tasting, but then I'd miss out on the knowledge, the stories, the real boutique finds, getting to ask all of my questions, and meeting other interesting people.

Good introduction to Argentine wines!. We are here visiting family and decided to try out some of the wines from our country, since it had been a long time. The Anuva people were very nice on the phone, spoke Spanish very well (even though we all speak English), and even offered a tasting in Spanish. The place where the tasting is held is very clean, very nice windows, tables, and very modern. Our tasting leader knew a lot about wine and was very helpful in responding to our questions. The wines were, of course, delicious, as was the food.

Overpriced. Good introduction to the wines of Argentina but the tapas are tiny tastes. Don't go if you think you are going to have something to eat. They are there just to enhance the taste of the different wines.
Great wine tasting experience. We enjoyed the selection of wines we tasted at Anuva, none of which we could have found on our own. We were guided through the tasting by a very experienced person.

Great wine, excellent time, and awesome hosts!. We arrived with our party of ten, and immediately were attended to. We were greeted by Cara, our host for the afternoon. The wine and pairings were far more than I expected. Cara was very knowledgeable, and patient, as we asked many questions not just on the wines and pairings, but about Buenos Aires and Argentina as well. My wife and I ended up purchasing a case of various wines to share with family and friends back home. Would definitely go back when we return to BsAs. Salut!

very good tasting. booked same day and a very good tasting. disregard comments about this being a "sales" event - it's no more sales-y than any other tasting. don't know why they don't give the location until the confirmation email (the neighborhood is very safe - don't understand the security angle they owners talk about), however, don't let the last minute location reveal deter you in the least. confirmation email was a bit confusing because on saturday the tasting is at 5pm (but the email says 6pm which i think is for weekdays) and it seems like more money will be collected from you when you show up (that's only if you are group - it's $46/person and $46 reserves the entire group - so everyone else in the group has to pay their fee once they get there). nice group of people, very nice space, some of the best empanadas I've ever had. some comments complained about the amount of wine served - this isn't an open bar and the amount of wine served is completely normal for any paid wine tasting event that i've ever been to.
Good tasting. Good wines, good food, nice location. We met some nice people here and had an excellent time, overall. Thanks.

Great Experience at Anuva Wine Tasting. Highly professional group. Young, intelligent, knowledgeable. The wines were EXCELLENT; the food parings SUPERB. No pressure to buy wines---just EXPERIENCE THEM. A lovely way to spend 90 minutes enjoying food and wine.

Great experience. Wonderful experience for novice wine drinkers as well as connoisseurs. The staff was friendly, very well educated in Argentinian wines and was more than willing to help out with recommendations for restaurants, tango shows, etc. The wines were tasteful and the small food plates were delicious as well. The venue was very nice and the setting was intimate, allowing for conversation with some of the other guests. We stayed around for an extra 20 minutes chatting with some of the other patrons (some actually purchased a bottle and drank it there before leaving for dinner). Our original tasting was canceled due to flooding in the building. The staff was very apologetic, accommodated us into another tasting later in the week and gave us a discounted price for the rescheduled tasting.Overall, a great experience that I'd highly recommend!

Fun wine and food exploration. We found this a relaxed and friendly way to sample wines, eat some good food, and interact with others. Our tasting lasted almost 2 hours and provided a nice cross section of wines from botique bodegas.

excellent! a very classy experience. Anuva Wines is in a great location in Palermo Soho. It is set in a beautiful loft. Upon arrival I was impressed by the beauty of the venue and the beautiful table all setup for the tasting. It was a very classy affair. The group was small enough for good conversation and personal attention from the sommelier. It was an excellent balance of formal and casual. The service was excellent. Each wine was delicious and the session was very informative. The food that accompanied the tastings was very good. The tastings were generous as well. A great experience I would highly recommend!

Wine tasting was very informative. 12 guests sat around a large table and tasted the various Anuva offerings paired with lovely hors d'eurves chosen to match the wines. Very well done for the price. Don't let their new location put you off - we thought we were at the wrong address. Also, be prepared to climb a very long staircase. They, of course, offer a deal to ship wines to the states if you attend the tasting.

Best wine tasting experience. My friend and I had one day left in Buenos Aires, and found Anuva on Trip Advisor. We tried to book for the next day but they were full. They offerd to take us earlier in the day, and we ended up with an amazing two-hour personalized wine tasting experience. I have been wine tasting more times than I can count, but this was by far the most interesting, informative and in-depth session I can recall. We tasted five amazing Argentine wines, each served with a delicious food pairing. Our guide Cara was engaging and enthusiastic for the entire time. We even had the opportunity to meet the owner, Dan, an American expat from Portland. I highly recommend a visit for all wine lovers.

Felt like a wine "scam". At first, I had high hopes for the tasting, but once we started tasting the wines and learned more about the rest of the clientele, the experience felt more and more like an Argentinian wine "tourist trap". You're better off learning about true Argentinian wines at a Winery & Co location and talking to a friendly salesperson there. The wines that were poured were not very good, and a tasting for USD 45 is pricey for what is poured. Wouldn't recommended it.

Special experience well worth the money. This was a great experience from start to finish. They could not accommodate us on the day that we wanted, so instead, they offered to host us earlier, so we had a 2 hour wine-tasting session with the food pairings on our own. Cara was an amazing host and answered our questions and you could tell that she really knew her skill, having been to wine school. I learned a lot from the experience, and there were no wines that we didn't enjoy. It started with a sparking wine - Brut Hom, then a white followed by 3 reds. With each, we got to eat various foods, ranging from sorbet, to cheeses/salami to empanadas and chocolate. Cara helped us understand more about how to taste the wine, what to look for and gave us the basics so we know better how to match them with food. All around - this was an amazing experience, well worth the money. I would highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys wine.

Treat yourself!!. A mysterious door. A lovely host. A wine and snacks experience. We came aross this attraction through many medias, and had to try it out. It turned out to be a exotic must do treat in the buzzeling big city. We didn't know much about wines before we went, except we knew we loved it. The wine is accompagnied with perfect snacks that suites the wine. The wines were to us from unknown winerys, and they were in a great diversity. We left the place light headed and more wine orientated. The next morning the doorbell rang and our wines that we orded at the tasting arrived with a delivery. Aaaaa Buenos Aires and Anuva Wines.

Best wine tasting in Buenos Aires. We went to Anuva when our friends were visiting as they wanted to go to an Argentine wine tasting. I had read great reviews about Anuva and decided to give it a try. It absolutely exceeded my expectations. My friend's husband doesn't drink, but he wanted to come along and they agreed to charge him a lesser fee. The staff is very accommodating. They did five wine tasting paired with different foods and desserts. I loved the sparkling wine and decided to buy a bottle to take home. They put the bottle in a little reusable bag, which I use when bringing wine to a friend's house. Doing a tasting at Anuva is a MUST when visiting Buenos Aires!
