Excellent wine tasting with a professional hostess. This was my first wine tasting, and I had a lot of fun learning more about what to look for in a wine. We sampled 5 different wines, 1 white and 5 reds. Each had a food pairing, and they offered refills upon request. The hostess was very professional and knowledgeable about each of the wines. We enjoyed the wine so much that we bought a case to ship back to the US!

Wonderful wines to sample. Informative presentation. We were given Argentinian wines to sample. The hostess described how the growing conditions and the aging processes affected each one. These are wines that are produced in the range of 8,000 to 12,000 bottles, not cases. We were given food pairings with the wine which was very helpful in understanding the qualities we were discerning and how the wines are better suited to particular foods. I think that I actually learned quite a bit. Then we ordered a case of wine comprised of the 3 wines we liked the most. Shipping to the US is quite reasonable (around $45), so now we have more wine to look forward to in a couple of weeks!

A classy and insiders' journey into Argentine wines.. An Anuva wine tasting is really a must-do experience for anyone visiting Buenos Aires. Held in a brand new, bright and airy space in Palermo Soho, the wine tasting is hosted by a knowledgeable and super-friendly woman who can tailor the discussion and analysis of the wines to your level of interest and experience. And you get to taste boutique/"micro" wines you won't find outside the country. So it's a great introduction to Malbec, Torrontes, and Bonarda. But it also works if you're a wine connoisseur and want to delve deeper into what Argentina has to offer. The tapas pairings are simple and light, but they show off the best of the 5 flights.I went with my wife and her parents and we had a delightful experience. Thank you, Anuva Wines. It was one of the highlights of my in-laws' visit to Buenos Aires!

Informative introduction to Argentinian wines.. The location of the Anuva Wines wine tasting was in walking distance of the apartment we rented in Palermo Soho. Our host was from the UK and was well versed on the subject of Argentinian wines. The five wines we sampled were all excellent quality. The food pairings were delicious and carefully chosen to enhance the wine experience. Anyone with an interest in wines would enjoy this event.

Enjoyable Argentine Wine Experience. I very much enjoyed my recent wine tasting experience at Anuva Wines. Our host, Cara, was friendly, engaging and knowledgeable. She provided our group with useful tidbits about the Argentine wine industry and Argentina's signature varietals. The tasting featured very generous pours of five interesting, small production wines matched with tasty food pairings. Overall, it was a very relaxed and enjoyable experience. Cara also proved to be a great resource on other local food and drink hot spots!

Superb wine tasting experience. The Anuva wine tasting is the perfect storm -- all the elements you want in a good wine tasting. Most importantly, there are quality wines to try, not just from big bodegas, but from little boutique wineries like Carinae in Mendoza. I believe they change week to week, but on the day I went there was a good variety, Bonarda, Torrontes, Malbec etc to give you a nice overview of what Argentina has to offer. The nibblies they bring out are not going to fill you up, but are well-considered to pair with the wines you are tasting. Aside from that, the space in Palermo is lovely. Bright and spacious, it really puts you in the right mood. The lovely hostess Sarah really completes the experience. She is highly knowledgeable about the wines, speaks a great deal and without hesitation about every wine that is brought out, and answers questions in an equally confident manner, whether they are about the wine industry, Mendoza, Buenos Aires or Argentina in general. Very helpful.None of us in the group bought any wines afterwards, nor did we feel pressured to, though the option was there. Overall a really worthwhile experience.

Argentinian wines off the beaten path. Anuva gives you a delightful introduction to high quality, lesser known Argentinian wines in a lovely setting in the heart of Palermo. The sommelier, Cara, is superknowledgeable and open to discussion and questions from novices and experts alike. The tapas pairings brought out the flavor of the wines perfectly. In all, a wonderful experience. I brought my parents there and they were thrilled.

Self-Promoting, Over-Priced Tourist Trap. Perhaps we misunderstood the web site. It said that at Anuva Wines we would learn about "terroirs varietals, vinification'. and that here were "generous, endless pours". The web-site is very vague as to where they are located. Even when you ask them via email, they are evasive. This would be helpful to know when you plan your vacation. They have recently moved to a new location in Palermo. It is a nice place with lots of sunshine streaming in and a a long, steep staircase to get there.The set-up looked promising, all very clean and modern. It is nondescript from the outside; you truly wonder if you have the right address. Apparently, this is to prevent "walk-ins".We were greeted by David, a rather introverted fellow, who seemed anxious to get the whole thing over with, in my opinion. I asked if he was a sommelier. He said no and quickly changed the topic. Seems to me someone who is in the wine business and is giving a wine presentation should be properly trained. It was obvious he had a script to adhere to. He said a sentence or two about each wine, but not much about the terroir of Argentina. We quickly realized this was all about SELLING the wines they chose to present. The food pairings were interesting. When we finished the whites, the 3 reds were poured all at the same time. We felt rushed. I asked why they were all poured together, and David said that was so we could compare the colors; fair enough, but we never did talk about this. As for the endless pours, with a small group of about eight tasting a bottle , the endless pour consists of finishing said bottle. I do understand this is a tasting , not a dinner party, but do not be mistaken, no other bottles were opened.After his spiel, order forms were quickly distributed. How many bottles did we want of each? Perhaps the monthly wine club is more your thing? This is not a relaxing "Learn about Argentinian Wines" evening, this is a hard sell publicity stunt. That they charge you to attend is outrageous! If this is what you want, then I recommend it; but only IF if you live in the USA, because they don't ship anywhere else.I have visited other wine-tastings and have never been charged. For $46, I expected to learned something about the Argentinian wine culture, not just Anuva Wines export business.Perhaps if you know nothing about wines at all , you might enjoy this; other-wise, I recommend you visit "Terroir". They are an exclusive, very knowledgeable and helpful wine store.. Here you will find wines unavailable abroad or elsewhere.

Great spot to try wine from small wineries!. We visited Anuva in January 2012. The tasting included 5 pours of great red and white wines - as well as a sparkling. Daniel provided excellent background on each of the wines - which were well priced and from unique wineries. They even inspired us to go on a hunt for a sparkling Malbec (which we had no idea existed!)The pours were generous and the space was lovely!

Great fun. Two hour tasting with knowlegable native English speaking host, Sarah. Five wines (sparkling, Torrontes, Bonardo, Malbec, Red blend) carried by Anuva Wines, a distributor with exclusive license for North America. Very nice accompanying food--not enough for dinner but much more than ususal with wine tasting. The price is fair at $46US/person. They have just moved to a new setting which is very pretty. We will make this a weekly event as long as they can keep changing the wine menu.Wines can be ordered for shipment to US at reasonable cost.

Great tasting in Bsas!. Had a wonderful night of tasting and pairings, with Anuva. Sarah made us feel right at home with educating us in a fun way and generous pours! They even let us stay for awhile while the rain passed. The tasting is located in the perfect place to go grab a trendy bite to eat afterward! Thanks Anuva, had a wonderful time!

Great wine tasting experience in an area of Argentina not known for wine!. We enjoyed a very relaxing 2 hours with Sarah learning about some of the lesser known but higher end wines and wineries in Argentina. 2 whites and 3 reds including excellent food pairings for each. Very clean, comfortable, modernized setting in Palermo. Not easy to find but don't let that deter you. Being from California and having experienced many wine tastings, this was unique in that it wasn't at a winery. Regardless, this proved to be a great experience.Sitting fee was 46 USD, not limited to one glass of each. Average price range per bottle was $18-35. Buy 12 get 2 free. Higher than some, but not having a feel for Argentinian, this was worth the time. Shipping available at $42/case. P.S. Signage on the door would help!
AMAZING. In one word I can describe my experience....AMAZING.

Great time! Great wine! Great food!. One of the best wine tastings I have been to. I went with my aunt and cousin, and there were about 8 other people. Very intimate and classy atmosphere, each wine was paired with a small appetizer. One extra I loved was that they offered to pour more wine after you had had your first tasting! And at the end they handed out a restaurant suggestion guide for dinner. Perfect.

Little too expensive and they seemed to have selling wines as one of their main targets. The place was hard to find, although then very cozy. The person leading the tasting was very friendly but she didn´t tell us much about the wine regions, history or anything. When we asked about the backgrounds, she told she thought we only want chat together more than hear about the boring history. If you don´t know anything about the wines, this may not be your tasting.In the end of the tasting they wanted us to buy the wines, which seemed to be an important part of the tasting.As an event this was nevertheless a nice and reaxing experience.
Middling tasting. Wouldn't recommend it. Wine was decent, but food and presentation of wines, etc left much to be desired. Cool space though. Maybe it will get better as they move in...

Can't Get to Mendoza While Visiting Buenos Aires?. Try this easy-to-reach, English-friendly wine tasting. This is a perfect activity for travelers who want to learn about Argentine wines but don't have the opportunity to get to Mendoza. As a Buenos Aires resident, it was enlightening to learn about some of the smaller Argentine vineyards. As a visitor, you can't bat the option to purchase wine and have it shipped to you FROM THE USA, saving you a ton in shipping costs!

Fantastic experience. My wife and I attended a wine tasting at Anuva Wines with Cara as our hostess. It was a small tasting group (6 total) and we tried 5 different wines, demonstrating Argentina's wide range (a sparkling wine, a torrontes, a bonarda, a malbec and a blend). The wines were all delicious and they were each paired with something to compliment the wines (cheese, sausage, sorbet, empanada, etc.). And while I enjoyed the wines and the pairings greatly, the real highlight is the staff at Anuva. Cara was really good - she was what a teacher should be. She is obviously very knowledgable (she was able to answer every question with enough detail to satisfy the questioner). She was very friendly - not too formal, not too informal. I would definitely attend another tasting at Anuva (and likely will on my next trip to BA.

Enjoyable...But Expensive.. First, I should note that we are very experienced wine tasters, having participated in wine tastings all over the world. That said, we loved the wines, the pairings were just right, we had a really great group that interacted well and included serious foodies; the presentation was by a young woman from the U.S. such that there were no language issues; and the location was easy for us since we were staying in the Palermo neighborhood and could walk the couple blocks to the showroom. After the program, we were offered the wines for purchase. The wines we tasted were not cheap and the average price per bottle of the wines we purchased (including $42 shipping and $20 sales tax for the case) was $28. I was rather hoping that since we made a case purchase that at least a portion of the $92 ($46x2) tasting fee would be eliminated. That said, we had a very fun evening and will have a case of fine wine to enjoy as we reminisce about our trip to Buenos Aires.

Amazing wine and food pairings. We had a wonderful experience at Anuva Wines. We sampled 5 wines with food pairings (this ended up being a meal instead of just some nibbles). The location was in Palermo Hollywood, just a couple of blocks from our hotel. We were taught about the region of the wine, weather the grape was grown in, what to look for in the bouquet/taste and history of the the vinyard. We enjoyed it so much, we bought several bottles of wine which were delivered to our hotel. A great way to spend the afternoon in BA.

...not to miss when in BA!!. A perfect way to end the day after sightseeing this electrifing city. Anuva's wine tasting consisted of an excellent choice of both whites, (including one sparkling) and reds. Each tasting was complimented by a perfect food pairing. Cara, our sommelier with her charming English accent provided all the neseccary info on each wine selection, covering the different wines, wine producing regions, grape blends and so much more! A definite "must do" experience and I am told they will have a new location in BA's trendy Palermo Soho. Looking forward to another tasting in the near future!Bravo Anuva!jcbCanada

enjoyed a precious time. It was new for me to have time of tasting wine, but I enjoyed precious and confatable time.1. selection of wine : I found organizer's effort to find not majour but good wines. all selected wines are difficult to find at wine shop even in Buenos Aires. I don't want say all are great wine but some are.2.Atmospher: pretty relaxed. 3.staff : very kind and beautiful4. price: It is very good.

Experience depends on your group, Location is mixed.. We really enjoyed Anuva Wines. That said, your experience heavily depends on the group you will be with. We went as a pair and there was only one other couple at our tasting. Unfortunate for us, they were not hugely excited about being there. We loved the wine and experience but definitely dampened by our fellow tasters.Location: I believe Anuva's location is mixed. We were staying in BA's microcenter area, a 20-40min ride by collectivo to the Palermo location of Anuva. So, if you aren't staying in Palermo I certainly recommend that you plan your entire evening in the Palermo area. The specific blocks around Anuva are up and coming, so that is bitter sweet as well.Overall: Anuva exposed us to small, otherwise unknown wineries. Your tasting-guru should have wonderful storied about the wineries themselves and the formulations of the individual wines. I didn't find our 3 hours to be a typical wine tasting - like european style, but more a story and exposure to local wines. Fun and interesting.

N. Kosik Etiquette and Protocol expert rates Anuva Wine Tasting an excellent experience. Anuva Wine tasting is a wonderful way to spend your time buenos aires. The venue was lovely, and easy to get to. The evening was effortless from the start. The atmosphere was relaxing, chic, yet not pretentious. The participants who arrived solo, were made to feel comfortable from the get go, and the mingling amongst everyone was delightful. Our facilitator was both welcoming, and experienced in her field. You can choose to enjoy the evening simply sipping the wonderful wine selection served, listening, and learning as you go along, or you can choose to be inquisitive, inquiring about the wines served, or ask any technical question on wine tasting you would like. Our facilitator Cara, was very flexible in suiting everyone's needs. The tapas served alongside the wines, were not only delicious but paired perfectly.I also appreciated the opportunity to purchase the wines tasted that evening. The bottles were delivered to our selected destination well packaged and on time with no complications.Anuva wines made our wine tasting experience an easy one. Keep up the good work Anuva. Wishing you continued success. www.nkaipe.com
Fantastic. The girls were fun and extremely knowledgable and wine selection superb.

Excellent tasting, excellent wines!. English spoken. Refills poured generously. Small bites to enjoy with each wine. The explanations and details on each wine are excellent. Sarah led our tasting, very knowledgeable and entertaining. They feature smaller producers and harder to find wines. They ship to the States. Can't lose, put it on your "must do" list!

Great way to learn about wine in Argentina. Not being huge fans of wine, we signed up to do a tasting because its one of those things that you do when in Argentina :) The wines were quite good (way better than the few we had tried in the past), the food was exquisite, and the hotel where the tasting is held was impeccably clean and the perfect vibe for a tasting. We got some good suggestions for our trip to Mendoza, as well as suggestions for interesting things to do in Buenos Aires.

Very intersting and fun afternoon. The tasting was held around the corner from our hotel, so it was an easy walk over. The place was nice (french-ish hotel), clean, and comfortable as you would expect most boutique hotels to be. The wines were good, the foods that were given were delicious and complimented the wines well, and the hostess gave us some good restaurant suggestions + wine tour suggestions for when we went to Mendoza.

Perfect experience to my Buenos Aires vacation. I decided to take my sister to a wine tasting as our first activity in town and i am so glad we choose Anuva Wines. All of the staff first and foremost wine experts. The woman who lead the tasting explained the reasoning of why the wines had their unique flavors (diagrams were included too!) The group of people who were at the wine tasting were fun and all wine enthusiasts! Now it is fun going to restaurants in Argentina and having a better understand of the country's wines!

The best of Mendoza outside of Mendoza. I read about ths on TripAdvisor when I was planning the last few weeks of my study abroad experience in Buenos Aires. Having taken a group trip to San Rafael, I had already tried a lot of wines from Mendoza, but most of the ones here were not among any of the wineries or the big brands (like Norton), so it was interesting to try some more "exclusive" wines. The foods were delish, the hotel where it takes place was clean, quiet, and had friendly staff. The wines were delicious of course, and our Sommellier Sara was very knowledgeable and gave good advice on restaurants and activities for when my parents came. Definitely an A+ experience and something that really made me turn into a wineophile!

Great Wine tasting!. Anuva Wines chose five (5) small Argentinean wineries; which after the tasting you could purchase as well as others in their list and they will shipped to your U.S. address from Anuva's warehouse in Nevada. Anuva's tastings are held in the bar/restaurant at the Rendezvous Hotel, a tiny boutique Hotel in Palermo Hollywood. Our tasting had ten (10) people and it was very social, with lots of opportunity to compare notes not only on the wines, but also on the experience of visiting Buenos Aires.Kara did a wonderful job explaining the 5 different wines we were able to taste; and the small food pairings with each of the wines was perfect! Just enough to compliment the flavors of the wine. Thanks for the experience and we are looking forward to receive our 12 bottles of wine in December, so we can share with friends!

Good wines, nice time.. Wines were tasty but "food" was just a few small bites - we were under the impression the courses would be more substantial. All in all it was a fun couple hours, thankfully another couple joined our tasting time at the last minute so the four of us enjoyed a great intimate experience. Sarah was delightful, very knowledgable and helpful to provide some recommendations, directions etc. after we finsihed.

Amazing, fun, relaxed, and interesting!. This was a great beginning to the last night of our honeymoon. Although the daily tastings were booked, Sarah with Anuva arranged for a private tasting at a mutually convenient time. She was polite, enthusiastic, and very informative. We learned about the wines, vineyards, and pairings in a friendly, comfortable setting--and were offered refills on everything. She offered great suggestions on purchases and shipping options. We thoroughly enjoyed the time spent at the tasting, and would highly recommend this experience!

Interesting wines, lots of education. Anuva Wines has an interesting business model. They have relationships with a number of small Argentinian producers, whose wines they both offer for tasting and sale in Buenos Aires, and also import into the U.S.Thus, you can buy the wines you taste (or others on their list) and have them shipped to your U.S. address from Anuva's warehouse in Nevada. You must buy 12 bottles, but they knock off the price of the least-expensive two, which usually about pays for the $45.00 shipping fee from Nevada.Anuva's tastings are held in the bar/restaurant at the Rendezvous Hotel, a charming, tiny boutique Hotel in Palermo Hollywood. (Although Anuva's clientele is entirely English-speaking, from what I saw, the hotel's clientele seems to be French-speaking.) Our tasting had about 8 people; it was very social, with lots of opportunity to compare notes not only on the wines, but also on the experience of visiting Buenos Aires. The tasting was led by an American woman in her twenties who clearly knew her stuff. And I use the word "led" advisedly. She provided subtle but useful education and guidance to the less-experienced, explaining how to sample the wine, what aromas might appear in the bouquet, etc., etc. Our tasting started with a sparking wine, then progressed through a Torrontés to three red wines, one of which, a Bonarda, is not usually available as a single varietal. Each wine is paired with a few bites of a complementary food. For us, as diabetics, Anuva substituted Brie for the sorbet they would have ordinarily served; I think they can also do gluten-free (but ask).The tasting was a very pleasant way to spend a couple of pre-dinner hours. We learned something about Argentinian wine, and we bought some to have shipped home. Although you can probably select from a wider variety of wines to taste elsewhere in Buenos Aires (and certainly at The Vines of Mendoza, in Mendoza), I'd recommend Anuva for any American with an interest in Argentinian wines.

Superb wines!. We found about this tasting because the hotel where it takes place was right next to our homestay in Palermo. I don't drink a lot of wine, but it seemed like a fun thing. We signed up at the hotel, which was super clean, poshy, and definitely had a french feel. Such a cool place. The tasting was very good, the hostess knew a ton about wine and gave us recommendations for our trip to Mendoza. I had always thought red wine was a bit bitter, but I actually really liked the wines they served. Definitely a must do in BA!

Fun tasting experience!. We had a fabulous time at our tasting a couple weeks ago. Sarah and Kara did a wonderful job explaining the 5 different wines we were able to taste. They were all unique and I loved the fact that there was a story behind them.The smaller food pairings with each of the wines was perfect! Just enough to compliment the flavors of the wine. After our tasting Sarah sent some additional information to help with our time in BA and in Mendoza. I am so glad we decided to do the tasting - I think it is a good thing to do at the beginning of your time in BA, as they are very helpful! Thanks for an awesome tasting! Can't wait to get home and taste them again ;)

Very relaxing and fun tasting. A great experience! Our sommelier Sarah was really nice and knew a lot about Argentine wine and its history. The hotel where it took place was classy, clean, and had all the comforts needed for a great tasting. I loved being able to taste other Argentine wines besides Malbec. We tried a wine that I had never heard of before called Bonarda (sp). It was super good and we bought a case! I definitely recommend it!!

lots of fun & good for begginners!. super delicious wines! met some other great people from the good ol US of A, and the hotel where it was held was mega top! really good wines, especially since i had never really tried argentinian wines before. the place was really clean, the food was quite elegant, and the whole experience was great. definitely a must do in ba!

Do NOT do it! It's a rip off.. I see some people here complained about the tapas which were offered. But that was the smallest issue.A much bigger issue was the quality and quantity of wines on offer. Yes, they do say on the website that you get to taste 5 wines, etc. I think you want to think very carefully about whether you think 40 some USD is really worth it for two sips of those 5 not top of the range wines. Just to give a comparison: in Mendoza for 160 USD you get a car to pick you up, a knowledgeable guide, a visit to 3 wineries where you taste 5 of their top range wines in each, a 5-course gourmet lunch, and a trip back. You also get a guided tour of the wineries. Now you tell me whether Anuva is worth it. A rip off, I say. Ah yes, and if you wonder why there's no address on the website, it's because they don't have their own venue. They work out of a hotel lobby.

Loads of fun!. Fun wine tasting! I'm a beginner and they gave me soooo much good info on wine in ARgentina, including some awesome recommendations for our trip to Mendoza. Very informal setting (my first thought of wine tasting = snobs). The tasting room was in a nice, clean hotel with friendly staff. Very classy. The wines were of course delicious, and the food pairings were great as well. Highly recommended!

An enjoyable evening. We enjoyed the wine tasting. The wines were good and paired well with the hor'douvres offered. It was a great way to learn about the wines and the vineyards. The evening also allowed for an exchange of conversation about experiences in Buenos Aires between the group and the our hosts.

Could not be better!. Excellent experience, the sommelier was extremely nice and helpful. The ambiance was informal and extremely amusing. It gave us (I was in a group of four) the opportunity to discover the other side of Argentinian wines, which means, other than Malbec. The food pairings were well-chosen and at the right amount.Highly recommended!

Nice intro to Argentine Wine... We learnt a bit about Argentinian wine, got to try a variety of boutique wines with little snacks to accompany them. Friendly and informative but non preachy hostess. No hard sell at the end. Great way to spend a couple of hours in BA.

Very Enjoyable!. I went with a couple of friends and had a very lovely time. Like others have said, I was able to try wines that I wouldnt have ever selected on my own. The pairings were lovely-they are not a meal by any means, but they do just the trick-help bring out extra flavors in the wine that would otherwise go unnoticed. Sarah´s great-she´s super knowledgable, fun and will help explain anything you ask!

Fun wine tasting experience in Buenos Aires. We were surprised at the difficulty in finding wine tastings in Buenos Aires. With so much fabulous wine in the area, we thought there would be so many opportunities, but that wasn't the case. We chose Anuva because it sounded like a fun wine tasting. We booked just a few days in advance, and had our hotel telephone for us. The day we wanted wasn't available because there was a group scheduled already, but the 2nd choice of date worked out fine. We did not book ahead as we were in Buenos Aires for 10 days and had some flexibility in our schedule, but if you are there for a shorter stay I would suggest that you reserve from home on their web site. We took the subway to Plaza Italia and walked, because we wanted to explore the Palermo neighborhood. Everyone else arrived by taxi. Even though we were on the correct block, we walked by the Rendezvous Hotel entrance at least twice before we figured out where it was. The signs are small for many hotels here. There ended up being 9 people total on that day. Our wine taster, Sara from Ohio, was very sweet. She poured 5 different wines, and a few were paired with small tasting items- a spread on a toast, sorbet, small bites of cheese and cured meats, an empanada, and chocolate. We tried one sparkling, one white and three reds. They were all good choices, and we especially enjoyed the Bonarda, which we would compare favorably to a Cabernet Franc grape. We had never had that variety before, and started searching in out in Buenos Aires restaurants. Anuva Wines does distribute wines to the United States, and they offer a wine package or wine club that you can order. We did not order any wines, as we already have other wine clubs at home that keep us well-stocked for our needs at this time, but it would be a great way to keep trying wines from smaller bodgeas in Argentina that you would otherwise not be able to get in the US. We thought the price was a bit high at $46 per person, but it seems like things in Buenos Aires are always leaning towards very much less or very much more expensive than we would have predicted. We had so much fun at the tasting, and went for drinks and a light dinner after the tasting with 3 of the other people we met that afternoon, and that was so enjoyable. There was a handout with some suggested restaurants, and we had a great experience with Anuva Wine. We have experience with wine tasting in a variety of settings. Keep in mind that this is an overall educational experience learning about some Argentinean wines and bodegas, with an emphasis on the educational aspects, and not a swill some wine and move on type of thing. You'll be there for about 2 hours. It's a tasting, not drinking event, but I think between the 9 of us we did finish off just about all 5 of the bottles with refills as we were going along. I would suggest this outing for people who are already somewhat knowledgeable about wine and wine varieties, and who are willing to spend a bit more to get a thoughtful experience. I would not suggest this outing for the extreme budget minded tourists or someone with no wine background at all- you might not be able to appreciate the differences in wine styles and may come away dissapointed. We fit into the first category and had a blast. Choose according to your tastes and style.

The sommelier was very informative and the wine and food delicious. Our sommelier was an ex-pat And very friendly and knowledgAble about wines and BA. It was our first night in BA so we took full advantage of her suggestions as well as the paper they handed out with dinner suggestions. The tasting was at a really cute boutique hotel in Palermo soho and the food pairing was delicious. The wine selected for us was spot on and allowed us to get familiar with Argentinean wine. I had a great time!

Wonderful way to explore wines beyond the token Malbec. We did a wine tasting at Rendez Vous with another couple, and it was wonderful! Sarah, who spoke fluent English guided us through five delicious and different wines that we would otherwise never know or dare to try. Paired with each wine was a delicious amuse bouche - in particular the empendas were the best I had in BA! Plus, the pour was generous so we could go back and reevaluate our favorites and rediscover each wine after it had breathed. Plus, we were able to order the bottles delivered to the US! Could not have been a more enjoyable experience (and as a bonus, Sarah directed us towards great shopping!)

Great wines, good food, fun host.... The tasting at the Rendez Vous hotel was a fab time. Sarah, our host, was knowledgeable about the wines and was fun and funny. Ok, it helped that she speaks English (she's originally from the Midwest America), but she knows B.A. quite well and gave some great tips for local wine bars and other places to go. This was a 5 star experience.

Really fun, informative experience. Went with 5 friend to Anuva's wine tasting in Palermo. Hosted at Rendezvous Hotel. American Ex-pat host was very knowledgable about Argentina vineyards. Embellished the experience with great stories about the vinters, the grapes and the labels. Well worth the money. Bought an assorted case with a friend. Arrived at my US home in timely fashion. Good fun, good value.

Bonarda - Mairena - what a great story for an equally great wine. I recently was in Buenos Aires on business when consequently it was my birthday so our logistics provider was kind enough to have scheduled a wine tasting with Anuva wines. The group was quite large so they reserved a private tasting at a great little bar called "Magdalena's Party". It was a lovely setting and the pairings they provided for the six different wines we tasted were amazing. Each one was quite an experience. The wine expert we had at our table, Sarah Bons was just so knowledgeable and patience with us. We were quite a loud group of Americans from all over the United States and lucky for the bar owners, we weren't disturbing other people's meal or bar thanks to Sarah and her ability to captivate her audience. The wine I fell in love with was the Bonarda - Mairena which, according to Sarah, was named after the owner's daughter. It is a very robust wine made with cherries, plums and blackberries...the best wine to have with a steak dinner! it was so good I came back to the states and have plans to buy a case for the holidays...guess what everyone is getting for Christmas this year!?

Good for meeting people and an intro to the wines of Argentina. We met some great couples at our tasting and enjoyed the Palermo location. The facts behind the wines of Argentina were interesting and the snacks served with the wine were tasty. We did it at the start of our vacation so we'd be able to order the right wine at the restaurants we visited.It wasn't a hard sell, but they do try to get you to buy into their wine club at the end.

Fantastic introduction to Argentinian Wines. My wife and I went to Anuva wines on our 1st day in Buenos Aires. The hotel location is within Palermo (where we were already staying) and was a very cool interior. Cara was helpful and informative, and we went through 5 tasting that were each paired with food. The food serving size was not large, but sufficient enough that my wife and I felt we did not need to go out for a meal after. The wines were delicious, and Cara refilled our glasses upon request. The setting was quiet, which we enjoyed so that we could talk and meet the other patrons at Anuva.All in all, something I would definitely recommend early on in your trip to Buenos Aires! What made this experience special was that we really hit it off with another young couple attending the same wine tasting.

disappointed experience. went to tasting with 8 people who are wine lovers but none of us enjoyed the experience. environment: sitting inside a small hotel bar with a long table, it was uptight and totally NOT buenos aires.wine: they offered 5 wines but when we expressed interests in certain type of wine, there was no responds from the host, seems like, she was not into finding out what we like to try.also, the price point of the wine they offer is relatively cheap. after the tasting we went to Cabaña Las Lilas. the wine sommelier causally introduced a couple of red wine to us, and they were fantastic. considered spending $45 for 5 wine (tapas were just cheese and crackers, chocolate, etc. nothing special at all), you can get much better value in NYC paying the same price.

Must do for wine lovers in Buenos Aires. An excellent evening in buenos aires - five wines thoughtfully matched with different tastes... Definitely not dinner - portions are tiny bites (plus a hearty steak empanada each!) buy perfect pre dinner nibbles, carefully chosen to make the flavours of each wine pop.Sarah is friendly and knowledgeable - this is suited from anyone from absolute beginners to total wine buffs. It was great to try a bonarda and a torrontes - the five wines we sampled were a great intro to argentine wine before our trip to Mendoza. Definitely do this at the start of your trip, so you can look out for varietals/brands you enjoyed.Also wasn't too salesy at the end - you can ship wine or take bottles away with you, but neither were pushed on you. So glad we did this!

Informative, fun, and Delicious!. If you want a unique wine experience in Buenos Aires, look no further than Anuva Wines. These guys don't just know their wine, they are passionate about it. This makes all the difference in a wine tasting. Great selection of wine, great staff, and a great atmosphere. I would recommend it to anyone interested in wine that comes through BsAs, no matter how much/little you know.

A fun and relaxing way to taste wines. After seeing reviews here and elsewhere booked a reservation the day before with no problem. We were 8 people total at the tasting (6 of us together) and Sarah was knowledgeable without being pedantic or pretentious whatsoever. The right amount of wine, food, information, everything! Bought 4 bottles to bring back with me to Brazil and was able to pick them up next day which was perfect since we went out for dinner and more drinks afterwards. Would recommend to anyone!

Informative, generous pours, beautiful ambience, and delicious pick of wines. I love that the space is in a quaint boutique hotel. Sarah was friendly, informative and nonintrusive by over feeding us with information. The wines were delicious with little bites of pairing, although the empanada in the end was big and filling! Definitely a must-go if you can't drop by Mendoza and a lover of wines.

Nice evening. Nice evening trying some wine from Argentina. We're not really wine lovers, but this was one of the activities our concierge recommended. The wines tasted good, the food was yummy, and the hotel where the tasting took place was quite elegant. Nice facilities, nice staff, good bathrooms. We came to Argentina not knowing what to expect, and the city was insane! This was a nice little detour from taxis almost running me over, and we even got to learn a little about wine.

Good event to get away from the hectic city life!. Signed up due to recommendations from some friends who had done this. Our taxi dropped us off in front of a pretty quaint, inconspicuous little hotel. Girl at the front desk buzzed us in, greeted us in English, and directed us to the tasting.There were a lot of other tourists there who we loved talking to! The wines were great, the tasting room was clean and well prepared, and the food was a nice little snack before our big dinner at Las Cholas. Definitely a well needed rest after a few hectic days walking around BA and the 23 hour bus ride back from Bariloche!

Good Way to Experience Argentine Wines. Went to this wine tasting at a pretty nice hotel in Palermo. Hotel was clean, the woman at the desk spoke English quite well (thinks he told me she was French), and the facilities, bathrooms, and everything else was kept clean and tidy. We were seated at a table with a few other tourists, and were given a few wines to taste + paired with a small Argentine snack. The wines were quite good, my favorite being a "Mairena" malbec that I ended up buying a bottle of. The snacks were decent sized, quite good, however will not fill you up if you expecting dinner. The young lady leading the tasting was quite pleasant, and we were quite satisfied with the entire experience.

Wonderful, relaxed introduction to Argentine wine.. My wife and I signed up for an afternoon Anuva wine tasting on the second day of our recent stay in BA. It turned out to be one of the most pleasant afternoons of our entire trip. The registration (same day) was simple, the location at the Rendezvous Hotel in Palermo was excellent, and the host, Sarah Bons, was fun and very knowlegable. Most importantly, we were treated to five fantastic wines from smaller Argentine vineyards. There were four other participants during our tasting and it was really interesting to compare and contrast each wine with everyone else. I was hesitant going into the tasting that it might be a big sales pitch by Anuva to purchase the wine, but it turned out to be a very low-key approach. Of course they would like you to purchase wine, but there was absolutely no arm-twisting. In the end, my wife and I purchased two cases but it was simply because we loved the wine so much. Try this activity as a great introduction into one of the great wine regions of the world!

Great time! Informative and yummy.. Loved it. I had a tour guide tell me wine tastings in BA are terrible and to avoid them. I had already booked tasting and it was too late to cancel. I am so glad I went because it was fabulous. Great wine selections and snacks to go with. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff.

Simply Elegant!. Went here through the advice of some of the people at the Four Seasons. Was at a nice French style hotel in Palermo, with a beautiful "red" lobby, as well as a lovely staff who was quite helpful when I needed to find the bathroom! The wines in the tasting were plentiful, delicious, and I was truly surprised at their magnificent quality. The hostess gave us a good intro of all Argentine wines, and definitely made the uninformed feel informed. The food was great as well. When it was time to go home, the staff called us a taxi straight to the hotel, and we were on our way :)

Worth it!. We signed up online a few days before. I am a student, and did it with two friends. It is a bit pricey if you are on a budget, but a good price for the amount of wine and food. The tasting was at a funky boutique hotel. We tried 5 or 6 different wines. The food pairings were creative and tasty! This was my first wine tasting and I learned a lot about wine as well as Argentine culture. Sarah, the host, was great - very friendly and helpful.

Great experience. I received the information for the tasting at Anuva wines just days before leaving Argentina. It was the perfect way to spend a few lovely hours. The wines and the accompanying foods were delicious, and the setting was relaxed. There was no pressure to purchase, but the prices and shipping options were irresistible, and I can't wait for my wines to arrive now that I am back at home in the USA.

Delicious and Informative Wine Tasting. Wine is something which has always intrigued me about Argentina and I love perusing the shelves at supermercados and wine stores and selecting between high quality brands and various unique Malbec brands at extremely affordable prices.I felt like I wanted to start checking out the more high quality wineries which have an even greater selection but which charge higher prices as well. In order to truly know what I like and don’t like, and which bargains are better than others I felt like I could use some more hands on information. Everything I had heard about tastings and hands on wine education was outside of the city in Mendoza, Salta, and other wine producing regions which I didn’t have the time nor energy to go visit. A little more research and help from TripAdvisor found Anuva Wines and before I knew it I was at the Palermo hotel sitting down for a tasting.Anuva was truly excellent. It was easy to sign up and it offered some incredible wine from those same important and farther away wine producing regions which I had always heard of. I learned all about HOW to taste a wine, what to look for, and how to differentiate between common Argentine wines. Things I never knew before. The wine was delicious and varied, and accompanied by food pairings which “accentuate certain characteristics.” The info on the creation process as well as the wineries themselves was surprising and interesting. I would go back and do the whole thing again. Not to mention that the wine they offer is hard to find anywhere else in the city.

I wish I had done this sooner!. I've been visiting Buenos Aires for some time now, but I had never been to a wine tasting. Shocking, I know. I went to the 6pm tasting on a Tuesday and there were 4 other people there. We sampled 5 wines (2 white and 3 red), which were paired with either crackers/spread, chocolate, fruit sorbet, steak empanada or cheese. My favorite were the sparkling wine and the Caluna, a Malbec and Cabernet blend. Overall, it was a really awesome experience and I was very impressed with how professional and polished everything was. Sarah, our hostess, did a terrific job of interacting with the group and telling us about wines. Honestly, it felt like a sophisticated and fun get-together with friends and I wish I had done this sooner! The tasting lasted about 2 hours (enough time for refills and chatting with other guests), and afterwards some of us headed out for Happy Hour drinks at a nearby spot that the Anuva staff recommended. It was a great night.
recomended. That was a good ideia. The wines are great , the place , rendez-vouz hotel , is nice , and Sarah was very , very kind.

Fun afternoon learning about wine. My husband and I chose to participate in the 3pm wine tasting at Anuva Wines. The hotel was decorated well with modern tastes and the wine tasting lasted approximately 2 hours. We were the only ones signed up for the 3pm tasting, so we were able to ask all of the questions that we wished. We tasted five wonderful wines and discussed the wine areas of Argentina, types of grapes, processes used in Argentina for wine making, the foods to pair with the wines, along with many other topics about Buenos Aires and Argentina in general. It was great! We enjoy wine, but we are not wine experts by any means. We learned a lot in a short time and we purchased bottles to be sent back to our home in the States. We did not feel pressured to sign up for anything or to purchase anything, but we thought that they would make great gifts and we don't even have to carry them back. The foods were crackers, spreads, chocolate, sausage, cheese and empanadas. We imagined being able to host a small wine tasting party when we return to the States with our friends!

Great Hosts and Great Wine. My wife and I booked a tasting knowing that we had to try wine while in Argentina. While neither of us is a true wineophile, we love drinking the stuff and didn't want to miss out during our 1st vacation in over 3 years (don't ask!).The hostess (Sarah) was really great, answering all of our questions, and giving us some great recommendations. She was extremely knowledgeable not only about wine, but also Argentina in general. She recommended us some great bodegas to go to during our trip in Mendoza, and they turned out to be fantastic. The wine lives up to its hype, the food pairings were delicious, and we were overall quite pleased with the experience.

Great Pre-Mendoza Experience. My wife and I were vacationing in Argentina earlier this month and attended a wine tasting with Anuva Wines. We were a little hessitant to do it at first because we were traveling to Mendoza where most of the wine is produced in Argentina, but we are SO glad we did both! More than just a tasting, David taught us all about the terroir, history, and other incredible facts about Argentine wine. This was good to know when we got to Mendoza because none of the wineries talked about these facts, so knowing it before we got their gave us a much better understanding of what we were sampling, and made it more enjoyable!

Great Introduction to Argentine Wine. I went to an Anuva wines tasting with my wife a couple weeks ago while I was in Buenos Aires on a short business trip. We didn´t have time to make it to Mendoza, so we decided to go to one of their tastings. The tasting was very personal, just me and my wife, and the guide, David. I liked it because we tried some varietals that I had never heard of and rarely get exported like bonarda and torrontes. We ended up talking with David for almost 2 hours all about Argentina and what it´s like to live there. Overall it was a great time. We learned a lot, tasted some incredible wine, and had a relaxing and enjoyable evening.

Don't miss!. My girlfriend wanted to do something more "cultural" than just eat steak, so I booked a tasting with anuva per recommendations on this site. The food was great, the wine was awesome of course, and the hosts were fun and friendly. We ordered some wine for my girlfriend's parents in Las Vegas, and they were able to deliver for a great price FROM THE USA, so we didn't have to pay any crazy shipping fees from Argentina.

Delicious!. I'm not a big wine drinker but decided to try it anyways. All their wines were delicious and the food pairing was perfect. If you have a sophisticated palate this might be a bit amateur for you. But, for the value, I was very pleased and walked away with a few bottles. If you have some time, definitely try it out.

Ordered Two Cases. What can I say....Sarah conducted an excellent tasting. She was knowledgable about the wines, where they were produced & the food pairings! There were 3 of us & we meet 6 others. Turned out one couple actually lives in our neighborhood back home. Small world! We so enjoyed the wines & decided to order two cases to be shipped home. We plan to have an Argentina wine tasting when we go home.We also loved the location! All very well done!

Really Fun!. My husband and I have just gotten into wine tasting, and mainly enjoy wines from Napa or Bordeaux. A Brazilian friend of ours raved about Malbec from Argentina, so we knew we had to try it while we were down here. The Anuva tasting was very well done. The wines lived up to the big talk of our friend, and the staff gave us some great information on wine making in Argentina (we had zero previous knowledge). The pairings they provided were excellent (they need empanadas in Atlanta!), and the wines were of course very delicious. We also got to socialize quite a bit with the fellow travelers, and even ended up going out to dinner with a couple that just happened to be from Atlanta as well! Definitely an enjoyable and recommendable experience!

Comfortable, Relaxing Wine Tasting in BA. As I'm a big wine fan, I knew I had to try Argentina's Malbec and other varietals. I saw on TripAdvisor that Anuva had great ratings, so I signed up for a tasting. The tasting itself was quite professional, but relaxed at the same time. The wines were delicious (my favorite being the Bonarda, something that I had never tried before!), and the food pairings were quite good. The wine tasting was informative, but also a great social experience as well. I chatted with a couple from Sao Paulo, and Ron, a hilarious guy from Viriginia!Definitely recommended!

save your money. We went to the tasting after reading raving reviews on tripadvisor.The hostes was very knowledgable, but that was the only positive.There were only five wines on tasting, and the canapies that been promised to mach the wines were:Three quaters slices of cheese, three slices of salami, two teaspoons of sorbet, two half cubes of chocolate and one empanada ( lucky that we had lunch before).ALL THIS FOR $46.00 USD PER PERSON.The tastig run by wine export company and the mission was to sell the wines and itreduce the company.IT WAS MARKETING AND SALES EXERCISE.I worked for wine sales company before and we did this type of testing for the public for FREE! and there are many companies that are doing this tastings for free.IT IS RIP OF

Fantastic. We had a fantastic wine tasting with Anuva. It was just the 2 of us due to timing(we wanted to get familiar with the regions wines the day we arrived from TX), and Sara could not have been more gracious. We are not wine novices...but ARE to SA wines. All our questions were answered...any hesitations from Sara were met with "I'll get the info for you and email it to you." She was patient and the wine flowed freely. Tapas matched perfectly. Liked the experience enough to drop our Monterrey, CA club to go with Anuva. They ship out of Nevada. Nice. :)

Definitely Worth It. Being originally from France, I have a lot of experience 'tasting' wine ;). I had heard great things about Argentine Malbec (even though the REAL Malbec comes from Cahors, Francia, Sarah :), and knew I had to give it a shot. I haven't been to a wine tasting in over 10 years, and never in South America, but I had been recommended Anuva by a local friend. The tasting in set in a real swanky French-style hotel. I got to meet a really nice couple from Brazil, two Brits, and even two fellow French chaps, Lorene y Mohamed. They gave us five different wines from Argentina, and each was paired with a delicious little snack. The pairings were done well, and they definitely elected the correct foods for the varietal. Sarah and David did a great job as the hosts of the tasting, and I definitely got my money's worth in extra pours. They were pretty knowledgeable about wine, Mendoza, and where to go in Buenos Aires.Definitely a very fun but tranquil experience!

save your money. I wish I could give the same raving reviews as I below but unfortunately my experience was not that spectacular... in fact, I was really underwhelmed by it all. I took my boyfriend and uncle who is visiting from Australia at the moment and we shared the table with three others. Half our group were spanish speakers and the other half were english speakers. This made for a really disjointed discussion but my boyfriend and I tried to translate as best we could between the two conversations.The information we were given about the wines weren't any more than we could have read from the label of the bottle, even when we tried to encourage more information from the expert. We would have been better off putting our money towards some good bottles of wine and talking amongst ourselves. The accompanying food was really average as well. For the money it wasn't worth the visit. Save your money up and go to Mendoza or visit one of the great wine stores who will happily discuss the varieties of wines with you for free.

informative, classy, and fun!. I did a wine tasting with 3 of my good friends during a weekend afternoon. Because I live in Buenos Aires, I had already tasted a lot of different wines but Anuva introduced us to some really amazing new varieties and the food pairings were perfect. The atmosphere is very relaxed and whether you're a wine connoisseur or just want to enjoy some wine and conversation, it's the perfect venue. The hostess was lovely too, lots of energy and knew her stuff.

An all around great experience.. This was a fabulous wine tasting with excellent food pairings and a very knowledgeable staff. The pours are quite generous and the discussions can be as in depth or laid back as the group likes. They also give excellent recommendations on what to do and where to eat in Buenos Aires. Very reasonable shipping prices to the US too, if you'd like to bring a souvenir back with you.

A fun night out. I've been on many wine tastings at home and abroad. In comparison, in terms of the number and range of the wines we tasted this tasting wasn't great. It's also expensive (for Argentina) and they want to sell you some of the wine (which is the point of a tasting!). However, we had a fabulous night out and I'd recommend it to anybody except the complete wine buff. Sarah and David ran a good tasting and had chosen some really unusual Argentinian wines for us to try. We tried two grapes I'd never tried before and enjoyed some Argentinian sparkling and of course, some Malbec. They weren't shy at topping up and offered some tasty food pairings to accompany the wines. They also offered some great restaurant and bar tips which came in very handy.While they probably weren't the most knowledgable wine experts I've ever met they more than made up for it by being hugely friendly, laid back and good fun. Their approach really suits the Argentinian style and we met some really nice people who we kicked on for a few drinks with. What more can you want from a night out? Treat it more as a fun night out than an education and you will not be disappointed.

wow!. What a great experience! Tasted five wines with Noah and Peter from Anuva Wines last week and our whole group was very impressed. We learned a bunch about wine, laughed a lot and it was absolutely the highlight of our trip to Argentina!

Aunva was the BEST wine tasting I have ever done. I recently visited Buenos Aires with a couple friends and read reviews of a few wine tasting services in the city and am SO happy we chose to go to Anuva. David, who is really knowledgeable of Argentine wine, but also very nice, led the tasting. He prepared a small food pairing to go with each wine, and was able to recommend other foods that would go well with each grape, which is helpful for me. At the end of the tasting we got restaurant recommendations, which were the best places we tried on the trip. One other prop was that David was both completely fluent in Spanish and in English--I felt like a wine pro when I left, able to use some of the more educated wine terminology. Even better, I was able to buy some of the delicious wine to bring home--especially since it is currently not imported by the United States, where I'm from. Aunva was also located in Palermo Hollywood, in the heart of Buenos Aires' where all the best shopping and restaurants are concentrated. On Saturday's and Sunday's there is even a fair in Palermo so I'd recommend you do the wine tasting on the weekends (They are open seven days a week!), grab a bite for lunch, then walk around to do some real artesan shopping! The Anuva wine tasting was so much fun and I learned more than I ever imagined about wine, the culture of Argentina, and let's face it, the wine was pretty good too ;)

Marketing ploy to sell you wines, a rip off. Cost was outrageous for a wine tasting and small bites. Staff was nice and helpful, but $96 US to be sold wines? I encourage you to take a chance and order a bottle of wine at a restaurant, far less costly and you can find some real gems!

AMAZING Wine Tasting & Food Pairing!!. Since Argentina is known for its wine, we couldn't leave the country without doing a wine tasting! Anuva Wines put on a great tasting! The wines and food pairings were just perfect and we were able to buy some of our favorite wines after the tasting was finished. The instructors were great, very informative in regards to the wine and also gave us tips on where we should go during the rest of our stay in Buenos Aires. If you are in the area and looking to do a wine tasting, this is the place for you!! All around great experience :)

Great wine tasting!. Didn't have time to go to Mendoza but wanted to taste Argentine wine. Heard this was the place to go. Great wines, great location, great presentation. Food pairings were also very good. Noah and Sarah were wonderful speakers and great to talk to. Highly recommend this wine tasting to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Best Wine Tasting I've EVER been to!. Wow. My friend and I wanted to do this since we wouldn't have time to go to Mendoza on our trip to Argentina. We had read it was good, but were blown away by what we got!!First of all, we were unable to make one of their available times due to the time our flight was arriving (we were leaving early the next morning) and they worked with us to start at a time we could make. Amazing.From the beginning they were very reliable via email contact and answered all of my questions about shipping, timing, and confirmed my vegetarian pairing.When we arrived they were able to lock up our luggage for us (we came straight from the airport). They were very friendly, helpful, and made the tasting amazing. They explained each wine (very knowledgeable) and the pairings that went with them. It was not a stingy sample either. Very laid back with the wines!I've been to tastings in Napa Valley California, the Loire valley in France, Champagne in France, Italy, and Chile. This tasting was by far the best overall!!!Just a few tips.If you book, there is a minimum amount of time that you have to cancel by or they will charge you anyway (one of our friends couldn't make it last minute and we had to pay for her)If you want to ship to Canada they can't do it. But they were able to work with me to ship it to my cousin's place in the USA.Really fabulous!! Definitely do this if you're in Buenos Aires!!

Very nicely done--would recommend to anyone!. I was in Buenos Aires on my own for five days in February 2011. I booked a tasting with Anuva and was not disappointed! Sara and Noah (?) were both very kind and engaging and knew a lot about the wines they poured for us. The wines were varied and delicious, as was the food they paired with them. The group totaled 6 of us, which was a very good size, and the setting at the hotel was quite lovely. A great recommendation if you cannot make it to Mendoza to taste, or if, like me, you just love wine and need an excuse to try something new in Buenos Aires! Go if you get a chance....

Very good wine tasting - delicious wines and engaging setting. Anuva offered a very good wine tasting experience. Each of the wines we tasted was delicious, and the carefully paired and presented foods were a great touch. Sarah -our guide- was informative, as well as easy going - setting a great atmosphere to learn and to talk casually during the tasting. As well, the hip hotel lobby setting was comfortable and welcome.

Most relaxed, fun, and informative winetasting you'll ever experience!. My friend and I had just arrived in buenos aires when we did the wine tasting. It was the first wine tasting either of us had been to. Every wine and foodpairing we had was excellent. Sarah taught us a lot about wine in general and the specific wines we tried. She went beyond all expectations by telling us many useful tips about buenos aires (transportation, culture, things to do and places to eat). We actually went to an excellent restaurant she recommended right after the winetasting. I highly recommend this winetasting whether you're a wine fanatic or not.

A refreshingly genuine experience. While in Buenos Aires my boyfriend and I attended a wine tasting with Anuva Wines at their gorgeous tasting room in Palermo. We tasted 5 wines from small wineries not available in the US, and each was paired with a traditional Argentine food. All the wines were great, and a couple were varieties I'd never seen in stores or restaurants. My favorite part of the tasting was how fun, relaxed and un-pretentious it was compared to other tastings I've done before. Sarah and David (both fluent in English) who lead the tastings are extremely knowledgable of wine, and I'm sure could answer the most obscure wine related questions if you ask. They are also very friendly and made the experience feel comfortable, as if we were with long-time friends. Except we had the added bonus of learning all about Argentina in the process. I would HIGHLY recommend that everyone visiting Buenos Aires go to an Anuva wine tasting!

Yummy Wines, Good Food, and Fun People: Anuva Wine Tasting is a Must!. I love wine, so I was looking forward to the opportunity to try some new Argentinian wines that weren't from the major vintners, and that is just what Anuva shared with us. We sampled some interesting wines, most of which were very good, including a surprising new favorite of mine, a torrontes. I'm a red wine fan, but the torrontes immediately evoked summer sun and relaxation. As my husband and I and the other participants tried the wines and got descriptions about the vintners and the grapes, we were presented with delicious food pairings to complement the wines, which by the way, were generous pours!The two young women who hosted the wine tasting that evening were both knowledgeable, charming, and good at putting people at ease. Delightful hosts! We had a great experience with purchasing wine through Anuva, too. Our order arrived just a few days after we got home and was in perfect condition; it was shipped at a reasonable cost, and we were sent emails about its shipping throughout the process. It couldn't have gone smoother!Finally, the hotel the wine tasting was held in is a charmer too! We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would recommend it as a great introduction to different Argentinian wines.

Can't make it to Mendoza? Check out Anuva.. I was in South America for two weeks and unfortunately did not have enough time to get to Mendoza during my stay. Still wanted to learn about the flourishing wine industry, so I scheduled a tasting with Anuva. Met at a beautiful boutique hotel and was greeted by the friendly and knowledgeable guide -- Sara Bons. Enjoyed 5 different wines paired with 5 delicious appetizers, and learned everything from the history of winemaking in Argentina to anecdotes about the particular wineries. Highly recommended for beginners and enthusiasts alike.

Felt like I was drinking wine with a friend. I can't say enough good things about our wine tasting. The wines and pairings were excellent but it was Sarah who really made the event special. I felt like she was an old friend. She openly shared her tips for retaurants and fun events to take in while in Buenos Aires. We did a group tasting and really hit it off with another couple so it was a great way not only to learn about some Argentine wines but also to make some new friends. It is a very professionally run event, too. We ended up checking out one of the restaurants that Sarah recommended for dinner and were not disappointed. Defeintly check this out!

Wine Gem in Buenos Aires. My wife and I have been going to Buenos Aires regularly for years to visit her family. We have enjoyed tasting Argentine wines for years, but on our recent trip we discovered Anuva wines. We went to one of their tastings and were blown away by the quality of wines and knowledgeable, friendly and informative staff. We samples 5 wines which were expertly paired with foods. It was informal and not intimidating. The tasting can be in english or spanish. The hotel where the tastings occurred was modern and sheek in the Palermo Hollywood neighborhood of Buenos Aires which complemented the wine tasting perfectly. I would highly recommend Anuva wines for anyone who enjoys wine and wants to sample excellent hard to find boutique wines from Argentine while in Buenos Aires.

A "must" for wine-loving tourists AND for locals. My husband and I recently relocated to Buenos Aires from California and we were SHOCKED that the city has virtually no wine tastings! Wine bars that offer flights, etc are obsolete... thankfully, there is this tasting. We had a blast: the ambiance was great, (I think the hotel is really beautiful and chic), the wines were quality ones from very low-production, boutique wineries, and the tapas were a great accompaniment. The empandada was soooo good. Best of all was the host: she was a wealth of knowledge on Argentine culture, the city of Buenos Aires, the wines of Argentina... she was helpful with much more than just wine knowledge, which was a pleasant surprise! We connected with some tourists and made a few friends from the tasting as well, (a nice perk, and easy to do because it was such a small tasting) and have enjoyed trying all of the suggested restaurants that were on a paper they gave us. It was so nice to go to a wine tasting (I've missed them since I moved here!) and connect with people who love wine. We'll definitely bring our friends to this when they visit.

Great End to a Great Trip. On one of our last nights in Buenos Aires, my wife and I attended a wine tasting with Anuva. We are avid wine drinkers, and fell in love with Argentine Malbec on our trip. The choice of wines that Anuva provided was wonderful, all the food pairings were perfect (I'm addicted to empanadas now), and our hostess (Sarah) was friendly and knowledgable. We met a lot of other travelers from America, Europe, and some really friendly young ladies from Brazil. We bought a case of Malbec, and they are shipping it to our us in California for a considerably low shipping cost. We couldn't find anything to complain about.

Great way to start a trip to BA!. The Anuva wine tasting was great and so much fun! It was a great way to start our trip to BA. We arrived on a Friday morning and Friday night found ourselves tasting wine with Sarah at a cute boutique hotel in Palermo. It was great to learn about Argentinian wines at the beginning of our trip because we drank a lot of them while we were there for 10 days! Sarah was great; lots of fun and very informative, not only about the wines and wine regions but also about things to do in BA and in Mendoza. There was no pressure to buy any of the wines, though they were so delicious...we did! We thoroughly enjoyed it and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting BA!

Worth It. I’m addicted to wine clubs, so when the opportunity to join one during our trip to Argentina came along, I was thrilled. To top it off, Daniel graciously offered us the option to pick-up our wine in the Bay Area (at a warehouse we drive past monthly), instead of having it shipped from Buenos Aires – it was a match made in heaven. Eleven months later, $250 poorer and no wine to show for it, I was disenchanted with Anuva Wines, to say the least. Ok, REALLY disenchanted. Angry emails were sent, a dozen nasty names were called, threats were made, etc. (what can I say? Don’t mess with my wine). Just as steam began to pour from my ears, Daniel shipped us all 12 bottles of wine at his cost, along with a great, big helping of humble pie. I don’t know exactly what caused the confusion – my own assumptions, his changes in policy, neither of us asking the right questions – but in the end, good customer service, a deep devotion to excellent wine and a gracious host prevailed. I didn’t have the best experience with Anuva Wines, but I believe Daniel runs an absolutely awesome business that provides a great and hard to find product. Take in the simple, yet pleasant tasting, join the club and pay for the shipping – it’s well worth it. Daniel - thank you.
LOVELY EXPERIENCE. If you love wines and the history in each bottle, you must come to Anuva wine tasting and join precious SARAH in all her knowledge and enthusiasm!!!

A Great Experience. When visiting Buenos Aires with my wife and another couple, we attended the Anuva wine tasting on our first night as a way to learn more about local wines. We already loved the Malbecs but wanted more info before going to Mendoza later in the trip. The event was great fun. The host (Sarah) was fun and knowledgeable and she did a nice job giving us details about each wine. The food pairings were really good and the wines were excellent. A very nice way to start an evening before going to dinner. The information helped us be smarter when we did get to Mendoza. We did buy some wines but felt under no pressure whatsover to do so.

Something fun and different. My friend and I visited Buenos Aires for 7 days and most of our time was going to be spent in the city. We definitely wanted to be able to experience Argentina's wine and this is exactly what we were able to do with Anuva. The hotel it was in was very cool and in a great neighborhood, close to numerous restaurants. This was definitely a fun way to spend a couple hours, and at a great price. Our hostess (Sarah) was great and very knowledgable.

Wonderful option if you can't make it out to Mendoza. My friends and I had planned a trip to Argentina, but unfortunately did not have time to get out of Buenos Aires to wine country. We love wine and wine tasting, and were so happy to hear about Anuva. Anuva brings wines from small vineyards throughout Argentina to BA for you to wine taste in the comfort of a hotel bar. We signed up immediately for one night while we were in BA. The wine tasting location was easy to find (a very cute hotel in Palermo). Sarah led us through the 6 different kinds of wine we got to taste. It was so much fun! We had food pairings with each wine, and each food pairing was something Argentinean as well. The best part about Anuva (if you live in the US) is that they have a warehouse in the US filled with all of their Argentinean wines, so at the end of the tasting we ordered a case of wine each and didn't have to pay for shipping all the way from Argentina. I would absolutely recommend Anuva - even if you do make it to Argentinean wine country, it's a great way to get exposed to smaller wineries you may not have visited.

great wines, nice people but a little rushed. A friend and I recently visited BA and went to an Anuva Wine Tasting. Everyone was very friendly, the wines (and food pairings) were delicious and the staff seemed very knowledgable. Many of the reviews mentioned the heavy sales pitch, but I didn't really feel pushed into buying anything (although we went into it already planning on buying some so maybe that's why). However, it did seemed rushed. We had 6 full glasses of wine and large food pairings for each one, all in less than 2 hours. Particularly being on vacation, it would have been nice to take our time and just enjoy the experience. I felt as though the owner was pushing us out by the end, which considering we bought quite a bit of wine, was a little annoying. He seemed more concerned with us giving him a 5-star rating on TripAdvisor than enjoying the wines! But other than that, it was a nice evening and we really enjoyed the wine selections.

Great Wine Tasting. Thank you to my boss for offering me the opportunity of tasting Argentine wine.I'm French so for me, it was very important to compare the wine and in particular the red which is fantastic.Thank you againMarion

Great times, great people. During my stay in Buenos Aires I visited the wine tastings twice with Anuva. Both times the wine was great and we had an excellent time. The first time it was just host, my sister and her husband. The host was an expat from the US, she was knowledgeable in wines plus she was fun to talk to because she has been living in Buenos Aires for 3 years. The second time was with my parents and 3 other couples. This time the host was the founder and he was very good at making everyone comfortable. As soon as the wine started to flow and people came out of their shells we had a great time meeting people from all over the world. Highly recommend!

Great Wine Tasting Experience in BA. Was in Buenos Aires on business and had the chance to do a wine tasting at Anuva. New very little about wine in Argentina, and had a great experience at Anuva. Cute hotel, great presenter (Daniel) and really nice pairings. Would definitely recommend this as a great way to learn about wine and particularly about wine in this region.

Explore the best of Argentina’s wines with a gracious and knowledgeable host in a sophisticated but relaxed setting.. I thoroughly enjoyed myself at the Anuva tasting. A truly enjoyable evening. I met some lovely people, learned a great deal about wine making in Argentina, and enjoyed some phenomenal wines. It was one of my favorite evenings that I spent in the city.

Excellent Wine Tasting Event. I attended a wine tasting provided by Anuva Wines and I had such a wonderful time that I booked another one while on vacation in Buenos Aires. The wine tasting was held in the hotel I was staying at - Rendez Vous Hotel - a perfect spot for this event! What a delicious experience - the wines were delicious and paired with the perfect foods - tasty cheeses, empanadas, sausage and deserts. I'm traditionally drink white wines but I was thoroughly impressed by the red wines they had. The wine tasting was hosted by Daniel who had vast knowledge of where the wines originated and other interesting facts about all the wines - he and Coco were extremely friendly and this came through in the wine presentation. I bought several bottles of wine which was shipped back to my home address in Texas.  I highly recommend this experience and would definitely do it again!
Very nice. The wine tasting was very enjoyable, with good wines and nice little dishes. Definitely worth an evening.

Worthwhile, interesting, met cool people. We enjoyed tasting and learning about five Argentine wines that are not exported and not widely available in Argentina. We were also pleased to meet a couple of interesting, cool people at our table. We will likely join the Anuva wine club so that we can have these fine wines sent to Ohio after we return from our travels.

What a great find in Buenos Aires!. My wife came to Buenos Aires on a business trip, so I tagged along with her. She booked a wine tasting for us, along with some local friends, at Anuva Wines. We had an awesome time at the event. There were 8 people, so it was a great intimate setting. Dan from Anuva Wines did an awesome job of explaining the Argentenian wines to us, so we really felt like we got a nice education while enjoying some fantastic wines. On top of the wines, the food pairings were also great. We highly recommend Anuva Wines to anyone that either lives in Argentina, or is just here visiting.

One of the highlights of our trip - great experience!. This was a delightful experience, in a beautiful locale (lovely hotel). Dan guided us through numerous wines paired with tasty appetizers - empanadas, cheeses, sausages, and so on. The white wines were good, but the red wines were fantastic. Dan shared his considerable knowledge of the wines and wine-growing regions in a very friendly and relaxed manner. This was like going to a party with friends - and learning quite a bit in the process. I did end up buying some wine and having it shipped home but I didn't feel pressured to do it - I usually buy some local wine when I travel and this made it very easy to get gifts for friends as well as some for myself. I highly recommend this experience and would definitely do it again!

Anuva Wines - enlightening, delicious and fun!. After hearing and tasting some amazing wines throughout my holiday through south america i got to Buenos Aires determined to do some wine tasting to find out more about the range available. Anuva Wines were incredibly easy to book and go along to. Dan introduced us (a group of both spanish and english speakers) to six different types of wines, all chosen by a group of blind tasters from a variety of vineyards, all of which were delicious and unique. Each wine was paired with a different food to complement the taste, information about the wine, its region and history was explained and then the details were emailed to us (for those of us with fuzzy memories after the generous portions of wine we consumed during the evening!!). The people i met there were delightful, it was located in a safe and easy to find part of town and it definately satisfied my interest in the wines of south america. I would recommend it as a must do when in Buenos Aires. Thanks guys!!
