One of a kind. I went to a wine tasting evening with a group of students on a pre-arranged trip. As a non-drinker, I was hoping to understand a little more about types of wine, differences in taste, and the correct combinations of wine and food.Our host, Sara, met all my expectations - she was hospitable, attentive, helpful and knowledgeable, and gave me lots of individual attention. Her assistant Koko was also very nice. Even for me it was a very enjoyable evening, and others in my group had an even better time discussing the different wines.So in a nut shell - a pleasant and memorable evening that was a unique experience during my two weeks in Buenos Aires. If you are into wine or just want to learn a bit more about it - this can be a good fun.

SO MUCH FUN!. Our wine tasting was soooo much fun! Sarah B was a wonderful hostess and very knowledgeable. This one tasting made us wish we had time for a trip to Mendoza for sure. Definitely a MUST DO...especially is you don't have time to make it to Mendoza.

A Memorable Experience of Buenos Aires, Through the Rosy View of a Bottomless Wineglass.. Located in a charming boutique hotel in Palermo, Anuva's wine tasting was so lovely, that when it ended all the guests lingered for forty-five minutes, savoring the delightful experience.Six delicious Argentine wines were sampled: one sparkling, one white and four red. Each wine was paired with an equally scrumptious food to complement it. Explanations of the wines, given by owner Daniel, were educational and entertaining. His passion for wine is contagious, and his charismatic presentation of hand-selected wines is the finishing touch on an already perfect experience.Anuva prepares a spread and presentation that can be appreciated by wine novice and expert alike. One will learn about the entire wine making process - from grape harvesting to the scientific properties of wine's chemical compounds, to bottling, aging and exporting. Whether you're a foodie, wine affectionado or tourist, Anuva's wine tasting is a memorable experience of Buenos Aires, through the rosy view of a bottomless wineglass.

A definite complement to first experience in Buenos Aires. I was introduced to the Anuva Wine tasting experience as part of a pre planned group exercise, however the experience was such a complement to my first introduction to Buenos Aires that I will sign up for another wine tasting experience in my next visit. As a novice wine drinker and for someone who doesn't particularly drink wine as the drink of choice per se, the wine tasting experience from the ambience, culture insights, wine tasting experience and the staff was overall excellent. The owner of the firm-Daniel was present and you could see the personalized touch of their service. Select Argentinian wines were paired with diverse food groups, the knowledge of which I could then use on my own when experimentating the restaurants in the city. This is definitely on my list of experiences on my next visit. Cheers to Daniel and his team.

Meeting Sarah and KoKoa was simply refreshing..... Simply an amazing and informative evening. The Ladies Rocked and our guest where a lil late but added greatly too the mix...The Cast of Characters:Cleveland, Ohio, Alabama, Mississippi, Georgia and Dove Hunting.... Gotta love fate!!

Superior Wine, Unique Experience. I've been to a few wine tastings in the past and the Anuva tasting certainly sets itself above the rest. I always enjoy wine tastings in order to taste new wines and learn something new, but Anuva allows the tasters to make it an experience of their own. Even if you don't like wines, you should give it a go. First off, the tasting is held in a chic hotel in Palermo amongst the best restaurants in the city (perfect locale for dinner after the tasting) adding to the overall feel and mood of the experience. Our guide educated everyone at the table, even the aficionados with insights into the Argentine vineyards, grapes, and culture. We tasted 6 wines all distinct in taste along with 6 traditional dishes to get a taste for the Argentine palate. Whether you are staying in Buenos Aires for a quick visit or a long stay, try the Anuva tasting. We even had people at our table who didn't drink wine, but still enjoyed hearing about the vineyards and country while tasting the empanadas and gourmet chocolate.

Really Great Wine Tasting and Food Pairing. Anuva Wines wine tasting was really a great experience. Their service is 6 wines plus 6 foods and a presentation about all of it. The 6 wines are from all over Argentina and were no question the best wines we had on our trip. The foods also went really nicely with each wine. They really put a lot of thought into the presentation, wines and food. Our host was super nice and a native English speaker so there was no issue with language. They also give a really generous amount of wine to each person. This is something every visitor to Buenos Aires should do.

Great for wines tastings.........delicious wine!. I had a group of 14-16 people enjoy a delicious wine tasting on the upper west side when the founder of Anuva Wines flew to NY. It was a truly wonderful event. Several people joined Anuva wine club and got great value and amazing Argentine wine!!!!! People are still talking about the event -- wishing we could do more of theseI recommend a company/product based on a few factors: quality of product, price and whether I'm supporting good people. I give 3 checks -- as the quality is top notched (as backed by a wine expert friend of mine who verified this). The price is affordable/ on par with the market and the company is led by a great person -- who is customer oriented and wants to create the best product possible!

ummmmm malbec. What a great experience. I'm not much of a wine drinker, but this wine tasting has converted me. Having traveled to Argentina, the tastes and aromas of the wines transported me to my time in Bs.As. and Mendoza. Not being able to remember my favorite wine from my travels, I turned to Sarah who was helpful in reintroducing me to the lovely Malbecs of Argentina. She demonstrated a good knowledge of the products and was able to translate the insufficient descriptions of a novice (me) to the high quality of wine, and then back to me so that I understood the great tastes of the variety of Anuva wines.

Don't miss this wine tasting. Daniel Karlin is part showman, part tour guide and a total wine guy. The wines were great and I really appreciated his style of wine tasting. He did not try to impress us with his knowledge (extensive) but watched to see what conclusions we reached on our own after each wine. After the tasting Daniel is very good at spending time with each guest so that all of us got a chance to get to know him and his story (very interesting) a little better. And the ability to order wines for delivery in the US was a nice benefit as I absolutely hate traveling with heavy bags!Anuva wines is definitely on my top 10 list of things to do in Buenos Aires.

Amazing Wine Tasting Experience. Wow - you definitely have to do this on your trip to BA. We loaved our personalized wine tasting. The wines AND food were both excellent. I learned all about the Argentinian wines and how they pair well with certain foods. Highly recommended - the guide was excellent and gave us tips on local areas within the city as well as what wineries to go to in Mendoza.

Rushed tasting with poor value and lots of sales pressure. Given all of the reviews that I'd read, my wife and I were very disappointed by our experience at Anuva wines. Our wine host, Sarah, was clearly tired, and gave a very rushed tasting. By the time we were halfway through tasting and discussing one wine, she would already be pouring the next one. At the same time, I was shocked by her knowledge. She had no good advice for our upcoming visit to Mendoza (the wine touring capital of Argentina), and actually got some wine facts wrong! (She said that Chile doesn't grow Malbec, which isn't true, see wikipedia for example.) After the rushed drinking portion, almost half of the tasting was centered around trying to sell their wine club and their wine. I'd expect that at a free tasting, but not at a supposedly elegant tasting that I paid good money to attend.Finally, for $40 a person, you can buy a lot of great wine in Buenos Aires. I added up the price of the wines we tasted, and for the $80 that my wife and I spent, we could have just bought one of all of the bottles that we tasted (at Anuva's prices!) Never mind that with $80 we could have an incredible steak dinner and a superb bottle of wine and still have money left over.I'm baffled as to why Anuva is ranked so high, and would suggest that visitors to Buenos Aires skip this tasting and put their time and money towards better activities.

Loved Anuva Tastings - I've Been 3x - Good Wine, Cool People. As a local BA perma-tourist I've been to Anuva 3 times in the past year. The wines are great, and the staff really helps to demystify them. They really care about good wine and good times, not about pushing wine. It's also a great way to meet other like minded people, which really helps make the entire experience great. I highly recommend giving Anuva a try.

Great pre-dinner activity to provide zing to your trip to BA. The tasting took place at the Rendezvous Hotel, Palmero Hollywood a brand new hotel which has been been renovated adding a chic twist to an old building. We had four other fellow wine tasters. Sarah did a fantastic job hosting the event, describing what we could expect from the wines and giving us some background on the wine terroir. We started with a sparkling wine just to get us in the mood and then followed by a white Torrantes and then 4 reds. The wines were accompanied by a tasting platter with the individual food elements matched to the wines to bring out the taste. The sorbets were seriously to die for.Starting at 18:00 allows you to fit this into your itinerary and go for dinner afterwards. There is no hard sell, Sarah just hands out a price list if you are interested in getting hold of more wine. She also provides hints and tips for restaurants in BA and trips within the region. We used her recommendation to go to Sarkis and had an excellent meal.Really enjoyed it and would recommend it - very accessible and enjoyable part of your trip if you don't have time to get to Mendoza.

Don't do it. My girlfriend and I thought this would be a great experience and way to enjoy Argentinian Culture. Inturn, we were both extremely disappointed for a number of reasons. To start the wine tasting was held in an apartment. The environment was very stuffy and uncomfortable. The wine tasting was rushed and conversation seemed controlled by the host. The food was average at best and the empenadas were cold. To top it off, upon leaving our host tried to upsell us 12 bottles of wine to be shipped from the US, where they bottle and distribute all of their "Argentinian" wines. If you want a more authentic argentinian wine experience, go to the super market, buy 4 bottles of wine with your friends, some cheese and bread and go for it...it will definitely be cheaper too.

Perfect intro to BA and Argentinean wine. We scheduled a wine testing with Daniel and his company, Anuva, early in our trip to BA on account of the glowing reviews. We were not disappointed. Daniel greeted us personally (we were early). Besides his obvious passion for wine, Daniel was quite engaging and honestly made the experience worthwhile. He knew each wine very well and even seemed to have personal relationships with many of the wineries. He answered my basic questions openly and clearly.I must admit that when it comes to wine I am still a novice. Many of the subtle scents and tastes in wine generally escape me. For what its worth, the wine we sampled was good. A sparkling white followed by four progressively "fuller" reds (mostly Malbec) were all delightful. The wine was poured liberally and refills were encouraged. Each was paired with a different food. We ended the night with Daniel's personal dinner recommendations (VERY HELPFUL). Our experience at this wine tasting really helped set the tone for the rest of our trip. We really enjoyed many of the recommended restaurants, confidently ordering Malbec at each.
Me and my fiancee had a great time.... Me and my fiancee had a great time there!!!!!! Sarah was an awesome hostess. We will come back to anuva for sure!

Great wine experience when you can't actually make it to the wineries in Mendoza.. Since we were unable to visit the Mendoza wine region during our trip to Argentina, we were delighted to find a wine tasting in Buenos Aires where we could experience the wines of small boutique wineries of the Mendoza region without actually traveling there. As an added bonus, the tasting included a food paired to each wine. The careful thought that went into choosing the wine and foods were evident in the fact the the pairings were perhaps the best we have ever had. Sarah, the tasting room director, was extremely knowledgeable about the wines and was very friendly. We had both experienced and novice wine drinkers in our group and she did a great job of making sure everyone could enjoy the tasting. We were the first group to have a tasting in their new location at the Rendezvouz hotel in Palermo and it was gorgeous. The space is intimate and comfortable and the decor is beautiful. Overall we had a great time. It was probably the best experience that we had in Buenos Aires and I highly recommend it.

Great wine, greate company, great night.. Simply put, you have to go to Anuva. I have been in Buenos Aires for three weeks, and this was one of the best nights yet. Daniel is friendly and incredibly knowledgable, welcoming novices and experts to his wine-tasting table. I couldn´t have asked for more.

Amazing wine experience in Buenos Aires. I had the opportunity to go to one of Anuva's wine tasting events, and it was one of the best things I did in Buenos Aires. The tasting was done by Dan (who I believe owns the company), and was extremely informational and fun. Dan had us taste various wines, and helped us understand both the origins of the wine, as well as food pairings for different wines. If you are looking for an authentic, off-the-beaten path activity in Buenos Aires, I whole-heartedly recommend Anuva wine tastings. The wine was so good that I actually joined their wine club, and as a result, get to experience 6 wonderful bottles of Argentinean wine every 3 months!

Intimate setting, great wines. While studying in Buenos Aires I booked a wine tasting with Anuva Wines. It turned out to be in the owners home which gave it a very intimate feeling. There were five of us total which was perfect. I really enjoyed the food/wine combos and how they flowed from one to the next. As I am a novice wine drinker this was a great learning experience in wine pairing. I also learned some great stuff about Argentina's wine industry. Overall money well spent!

fun wine tasting and inside tips on buenos aires. we really enjoyed our tasting at anuva wines. it included five wines andfive food pairings. i am more of a beer drinker, but the wines werefantastic, especially the limited production syrah we tried. the hostess wasgenerous and we were able to get refills of the wines we liked. we learnedall about argentine wines including the bonarda which i had never heard of,and fun things to do in buenos aires. we received bar and restaurantrecommendations from our hostess and as a result, my new favorite restaurantin buenos aires is sarkis. if i had a criticism it was that there weren'tenough visual aides. I would have liked to see more maps and pictures of thevineyards.

Just ok and not worthy of top BA attraction. Our experience with Anuva Wines was ok but I would not classify it as the best experience we had in Buenos Aires. The ladies who led us through the tasting were definitely nice, and they accommodated our group of five and time changes that we had. However, the apartment where it was located was small, dark and, sorry to say it, kind of dirty. There was a layer of dust on all the furniture except the table and chairs where we sat. From our group of five people, all with differing levels of wine knowledge and interest, none of us thought it was something we would recommend others to do. The price is fairly steep for what you get, and at the end you almost feel bad if you don't order any of the wines to be shipped to the States or to take with you. Yes, Sarah and Emily were nice. The pairings were good. But was it above and beyond our expectations? No. Did we learn something new? Not really. Did it seem to be more of a sales pitch for future Anuva Wine purchases? Yes. We also felt we were rushed throughout the evening and would have preferred to be allowed more conversation and time on our foods and wines.

A great experience. I had the opportunity to attend an Anuva wine tasting that was coordinated by coworkers and it was truly a great experience. Sarah, our host and wine connoisseur was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. She provided us with a wide variety of wines from different regions within Argentina and significant background on the unique variations. I ordered a case of wine and it made it back to the US before I did at a very reasonable price. I defintely plan on ordering wines from Anuva again in the near future.

not to be missed!!. This was a wonderful way to begin our visit to Buenos Aires. It was just a fabulous experience in all ways, great fun. Sarah and Emily were quite charming, and the wines and food were excellent. It really was just a fun way to spend a couple of hours. And we learned something about the wine as well. I joined the wine club and both my wife and I as well as our friends ordered a case of wine. If you like wine, or even if you think you might, you MUST do this. And Sarah and Emily even made some excellent restaurant suggestions as well.

Mendoza in Buenos Aires. Our wine tasting with Anuva Wines was one of the best experiences we had in BA. Living near Napa & Sonoma, I am passionate about wine and definitely spoiled. Ideally, I wanted to visit Mendoza and soak in the wine region but I was in Argentina for a very short time for work. Luckily, Anuva brought Mendoza to me! Sarah was wonderful to work with. We had booked our tasting with very short notice and not only was she responsive, but she was flexible in fitting us in. It was definitely my most unique wine tasting experience. Being in someone's home, it's a very intimate setting. The pairings were really spot on and the food was very good. Everyone bought some wine and even better, they have a distributor in the US so we saved a lot on shipping. We all had an amazing time. Sarah was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. Next time in BA, I'm definitely booking another tasting!! I'd recommend this venue to any wine-lover.

Be surprise by a quality you couldn't imagine!. Friendly, cozy, well fundamented wine knowledge and most of all DELICIOUS!Anuva Wine Tasting is an experience that everyone who loves wines or wants to know a little more should do! A trip throught argentinian wine and cousine culture in every sip and bite.Our host Daniel had a great selection of wines, from sparkling soft to red and strong all of them combined with perfect and well cooked snacks and foods!I was really surprised by everything I tasted, saw heard! A real lesson!RECOMMENDED!

You haven't been to Argentina if you haven't tasted their wines properly. Argentina has some exquisite wines, many of which are very unique (no other wine-growing region is so well shielded from "killer" sea air). They are also the best value anywhere, period. Anuva can show you all this, and show you where to get these wines back home (it's easy: on the web!).A definite must-do if you're in BA.

Hesitant at first, but left more than satisfied by the experience !. I will admit I was skeptical when we got to an apartment building in Buenos Aires. However, Dan and Emily were the nicest hosts any one could ask for. We tasted a wide and unique variety of wines, each with its own distinct personality. Both Dan and Emily were very friendly and were more than happy to share their knowledge of Argentine wines, and the local food and entertainment options. This was a great way to spend an evening in Argentina particularly in the early days of their visit here.

well-priced, informative, and intimate tasting of great argentine wines. Fantastic way to learn about Argentine wines and wine tasting in general. Daniel was a great host, and he was happy to accommodate our budget and travel schedule.

Anuva wine tasting offered us a great introduction to Argentinean wines.. We truly enjoyed the evening, sampling good quality wines matched to local nibbles in a relaxed atmosphere. Highly recommended experience.
Excellent wines. Great experience for the wine lover and wine novice. Very personal treatment and advice. Highly recommended.
Excellent advice and a fun evening. Good advice and a very enjoyable and relaxed way to taste some wine!

even if you don't like wine you will love Anuva. The Anuva wine tasting should be a required first stop for all Americans visiting Buenos Aires. I love Malbecs. My wife sips Manishevits and white zin on occasion. I was in heaven. Boutique Malbecs and some thing new called Bonarda not to be found in the US. Generous variety and amounts. Food and sorbet were excellent. Most importantly- one gets an expatriates view on where to go ( dinner, art entertainment) what to do, where not to go, how to tip etc. in a relaxed atmosphere. One also gets a glimpse of apartment life in BA. My wife even developed a taste for something different. Even better it is a gift that keeps on giving, since you can continue to order wines not available in the states

Great variety of wines and pairings. My husband and I recently went to BA for vacation and wanted to try out some new wines. We found Anuva on trip advisor and signed right up. We, along with 2 other couples tried 5 wines, a sparkling, a white and 3 different reds paired with food such as chocolate, empanadas or sorbet. As we tried each wine we were given a description of the wine, flavors and location of the grapes. They also have a wine club if you would like to sign up at the end. A good choice if you are in BA and enjoy wine.

Fun wine tasting experience with tapas too.. We did this tasting in early March. When my husband and I arrived there were 5 other women there to do the tasting with us. It was fun to hear everyones opinion on each of the wines as we tried them. We were probably there for about an hour and a half. We tried 5 wines from Mendoza, Argentina. Each wine was paired with what I would call a tapas offering selected to compliment the wine. We enjoy wine alot so we thought this was big fun and well worth the 40 US dollars each that it cost. Our hostess Sarah, did a great job educating us about Argentine wines and also telling us lots of helpful hints about BA.

Personalized attention, spectacular Argentine wines and a great learning experience!. Due to disastrous weather our group was over 1 hour late to the Anuva Wine Tasting hosted in their lovely Las Canitas apartment. Despite our tardy arrival, the Anuva staff patiently waited for us to and even speeded up the process by sending us a personalized car service that they use. The staff couldn't have been more professional, fun or kind. The wines were a great variety of Argentine wines from a sparking white to a traditional Malbec. All which were paired nicely with little tapas that enhanced their flavors. It was an intimate night and we learned a lot about Argentine wines as well as their wine club that delivers from Buenos Aires to 34 states in America. I recommend it for tourists interested in learning more about Argentine Wines and shipping wines to America from Buenos Aires.

Excellent wine tasting!. I recently attended a wine tasting at Anuva Wines and really enjoyed myself. The atmosphere was relaxing and inviting. Our hostess was very informative about not only the wines, but also other activities in Buenos Aires, restaurants, etc. I was impressed with the presentation of the wine and the food it was paired with. The wines were excellent and we were served a variety of different types, including a sparkling wine and Malbecs. The food was delicious. I was pleased to find out that Anuva ships their wine to my house in the U.S. Overall, this wine tasting was a very pleasant experience and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for something fun and relaxing to do.

The best part of our trip. By far the best thing we did in BA was go to the Anuva wine tasting. It was an intimate affair - there were 6 of us at the table. The wine and food pairings were to die for. We actually purchased 24 bottles of wine that will be shipped to us in New York. We also loved our hostess; she's a class act.Not to be missed!

A wonderful wine experience, with great company, and a charming host. Enjoyed a lovely late afternoon wine tasting session with Anuva Wines. The host Sarah is a charming vinophile who passionately educates the group on the amazing wine selections she pours. Our group sampled 3 reds, one white, and a sparkling white. Each pour was well paired to a food sampling that helped bring out the flavor of the wine. What I liked most about the experience was the coziness of it all. It was like being invited over to a friends house for an evening of wine and good conversation. And we were all strangers! Also, Sarah will arrange for you to have any of the wines you liked shipped to you in the United States. I would highly recommend that you include Anuva Wines in your Buenos Aires itinerary.

nice evening. I had a wonderful time at this intimate wine tasting which included 5 wines from Mendoza, each served with a small piece of cheese, cracker, fruit or meat. It was informative for my novice standards and very laid back, so questions could be answered. I do, however, think the tasting was overpriced at USD $40 (not incl. taxi fare to/from the tasting site). I was expecting more food choices or snacks for that amount, or some kind of small gift (bottle opener with Anuva logo or something).

A must do!. On my recent trip to Buenos Aires, my boyfriend and I had the pleasure of visiting Anuva Wines. It is a wine tasting that is set in an apartment, which makes it very cozy. It is very nice and the hosts Sarah and Daniel were great and very friendly. The wines were from smaller wineries throughout Argentina and were delicious. They paired them with some light tapas which were really good and really complimented the wines beautifully. You do not need to be a "wine snob" to have a great time here. They can ship Argentinian wines to some US states via their wine club, which makes it easy to get fantastic wine from smaller wineries. I would go back to Anuva anytime I was in Argentina!

Wine tasting in a relaxed atmosphere. They offered an excellent experience that we all enjoyed in a relaxed atmosphere. There were small local food samples to accompany the wine which were excellent and they also provided an alternative vegetarian plate for one person in our group. The hosts provided indepth knowledge about the wine but also gave extra insights on alternative things to do while in BA from a local's point of view. This was gratefully appreciated.

Fun, interesting, and GREAT win!. What a great wine tasting! The hosts are smart and informed, yet not pretentious at all. The atmosphere was warm and engaging, not a typical "lecture" environment. They listened and learned about my preferences and made excellent recommendations, not just for wine, but for restaurants, tours, cafes, and more. Best of all, the wine was FANTASTIC! Their wine club is such a great deal. Can't wait till I start receiving some of these great Argentine wines back in the states!

Two hours of fun. My girlfriend and I got back this morning from a terrific five-day trip to Buenos Aires. We relied heavily on tripadvisor in deciding where to go and what to do. Since people eat dinner late in BA, we had to come up with something to pass time in the early evenings. We like wine and decided to give the Anuva Wines tasting a shot.We both really enjoyed it. The wines were delicious, the pairings were thoughtful, and our hosts couldn't have been more gracious. We got to taste things that we might not have otherwise come across, from small producers. As Americans in BA, it was nice to spend a little time speaking English with other Americans (Dan the owner is from the States, as is Sarah his colleague) and they gave us great tips on which restaurants to try, which to skip, and how best to use our time. We also asked Dan about maté, the Argentine beverage we had wanted to try, and he promptly heated some water, filled a gourd with yerba, and introduced us properly to the maté ritual. That was a great bonus.If I had to come up with any criticism, I would say that the price seems a little steep for BA. Maybe in the future the price will come down or Anuva will offer to apply the tasting fee to a purchase. But it was a fun experience, and we're glad we went. I'd suggest doing this early in your trip if you want to take advantage of Dan's knowledge of the city and recommendations. Now that we're back in the States, we are thinking of ways to use his online store to send gifts to friends.

Intimiate, free flowing, worthwhile. The beauty of this wine tasting is in its size. I was one of three participants in the wine tasting, so we had plenty of opportunities to ask questions, discuss wines and other topics, and absorb authentic Argentine hospitality. If you like or want to try a small, intimate setting for a wine tasting, give Anuva a try. The instruction in Argentine wine is worthwhile, but I think it has the most value for those who want to have a dialog about it. The entire event is akin to having wine with friends, but where the subject matter IS wine. A great time.

An evening not to be missed!. Dan was an excellent, unimposing host and wine connoisseur. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the 2 hours dedicated solely to ourselves in his apartment. There were 5 wine tastings accompanied by tapas, carefully paired and beautifully presented. We kicked off with a cava, a white torrontes and three reds, the last of which was a reserve. Throughout the tastings we learnt about each of the wines and wine-tasting in general. They were so divine we had 6 bottles sent to our hotel the following day! Even if you are only in BA for a few days, this is an evening not to be missed.

Excellent Wine Tasting Experience. Dan is a warm person and knows his wines. The tasting is well prepared and paired with different foods. We tasted 2 whites (one sparkling) and 3 reds. Dan found some excellent unique Argentinian wines. I had to bring one bottle of each wine to do the tasting again at home. Next time I visit Buenos Aires will check if Anuva has some new exquisit Argentinian wines.

Impressive wines, great food pairing, warm, friendly setting!. You walk in to Dan's dining room with a beautiful array of tapas on the table. There are also 5-6 wine glasses in front of every setting! Every wine we tasted was very good, from the sparkler to the big chewy malbec, all were awesome! Dan is knowledgeable in regards to the wines, the city and it's people and I would suggest doing this early on in your trip. Not only will you get some local knowledge, but you can also purchase the wines that you taste for extremely reasonable prices so that you can have them to drink over the rest of your stay. Additonally, you can have Dan ship any wines that you like back to the US!

Great Wines, Great Company. Having tasted wine in many a winery and wine tasting over the years I can honestly say that this was one of my top 3. Why? First, the wines themselves: exquisite! Second, the format and company: really relaxed but informative, fun, engaging, etc. Third, the convenience: they are right there in the middle of Buenos Aires and offer to ship to the US on the cheap.

Great experience for both novice wine drinkers and experts alike. I enjoyed the presentation during the wine tasting I attended because Daniel catered to both the experienced wine drinkers in the crowd and the newbies, such as myself.If a wine term comes up that I wouldn't know, I never needed to ask. I learned a lot about the wine regions of Argentina, what makes them particularly unique (hint: the Andes Mountains), and also drank a nice variety of wines from an Argentinean sparkling white to the Malbec I've heard so much about. I have joined their wine club and am happy to be able to take a little piece of Argentina home with me.

Fantastic Wines, Fantastic Presentation. We had the pleasure of visiting Daniel and Anuva in Buenos Aires a few days ago. We had 5 wines and 5 food pairings as well as an informative but engaging presentation. I have always hated wine tastings that drag on or where the sommelier talks too much. Here it was great. And oh, the wines! Great Malbecs and some interesting stuff too that I had never heard of. My friends were very happy that Anuva ships to the U.S. as well for very cheap. Apparently they are the only place that does.
